general.quote: I am indebted to my father for living, but to my teacher for living well.
general.author: alexander the great

general.quote: Everyone and everything around you is your teacher.
general.author: ken keyes jr.

general.quote: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Who dares to teach must never cease to learn.
general.author: john cotton dana

general.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think.
general.author: socrates

general.quote: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be and you help them become what they are capable of becoming.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: The true aim of everyone who aspires to be a teacher should be, not to impart his own opinions, but to kindle minds.
general.author: frederick w. robertson

general.quote: A teacher who is not dogmatic is simply a teacher who is not teaching.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: Woe to him who teaches men faster than they can learn.
general.author: william j. durant

general.quote: if you have forgotten how to be a child you cannot teach children.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: To be good is noble, but to teach others how to be good is nobler and less trouble.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Fear is not a lasting teacher of duty.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Once more I would adopt the graver style — a teacher should be sparing of his smile.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: When teaching, light a fire, don’t fill a bucket.
general.author: dan snow

general.quote: If the past cannot teach the present and the father cannot teach the son, then history need not have bothered to go on, and the world has wasted a great deal of time.
general.author: russell hoban

general.quote: The good teacher makes the poor student good and the good student superior. When our students fail, we, as teachers, too, have failed.
general.author: marva collins

general.quote: A teacher should have maximal authority, and minimal power.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths theater.
general.author: gail godwin

general.quote: Teaching is of more importance than urging.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: In teaching you cannot see the fruit of a day’s work. It is invisible and remains so, maybe for twenty years.
general.author: jacques barzun

general.quote: If we teach today’s students as we taught yesterday’s, we rob them of tomorrow.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: The teacher is like the candle which lights others in consuming itself.
general.author: giovanni ruffini

general.quote: Teachers who educate children deserve more honor than parents who merely gave birth; for bare life is furnished by the one, the other ensures a good life.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Acquire new knowledge whilst thinking over the old, and you may become a teacher of others.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: In a completely rational society, the best of us would be teachers and the rest of us would have to settle for something else.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: Your enemy can be your greatest teacher.
general.author: buddha

general.quote: We never completely escape the teachers of our childhood nor any of the patterns that formed us.
general.author: frank herbert

general.quote: A teacher who is attempting to teach without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn is hammering on a cold iron.
general.author: horace mann

general.quote: When you study great teachers… you will learn much more from their caring and hard work than from their style.
general.author: william glasser

general.quote: The evil of people can come from their like of being teachers of others.
general.author: mencius mengzi meng-tse

general.quote: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.
general.author: john patrick

general.quote: Wisdom always makes men fortunate: for by wisdom no man could ever err, and therefore he must act rightly and succeed, or his wisdom would be wisdom no longer.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Wisdom no more consists in science than happiness in wealth.
general.author: marquis stanislas jean de boufflers

general.quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
general.author: jimi hendrix

general.quote: Wisdom consists in being able to distinguish among dangers and make a choice of the least harmful.
general.author: niccolo machiavelli

general.quote: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.
general.author: martin h. fischer

general.quote: A man remains ignorant because he loves ignorance, and chooses ignorant thoughts; a man becomes wise because he loves wisdom and chooses wise thoughts.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Wisdom is often counted folly by the unwise.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Wisdom begins at the end.
general.author: daniel webster

general.quote: Never, no, never did Nature say one thing and Wisdom say another.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: Wisdom is understanding when to ask questions.
general.author: brian herbert & kevin j. anderson

general.quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and … there is a wisdom of the heart.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: Learned men fall into error oftenest by mistaking knowledge for wisdom.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: There is no wisdom, save in truth. Truth is everlasting, but our ideas about truth are changeable. Only a little of the first fruits of wisdom, only a few fragments of the boundless heights, breadths and depths of truth, have I been able to gather.
general.author: martin luther quotes

general.quote: Wisdom is a safe ship; and we may trust ourselves to it in all weathers.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Wisdom is wisdom, wherever found.
general.author: g. david nordley

general.quote: He dares to be a fool, and that is the first step in the direction of wisdom.
general.author: james gibbons huneker

general.quote: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages may be preserved by quotation.
general.author: isaac d’israeli,

general.quote: Half a man’s wisdom goes with his courage.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Knowledge is flour, but wisdom is bread.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Wisdom’s door is ever open.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Travel makes a wise man better, and a fool worse.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Wisdom grows in quiet places.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good.
general.author: gabriel garcia marquez

general.quote: Like water in the desert is wisdom to the soul.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: All wisdom ends in paradox.
general.author: jeffrey eugenides

general.quote: Wisdom is mostly the fruit of experience.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: When wisdom leaves the house folly enters it.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: This type of man who is devoted to the study of wisdom is always most unlucky in everything, and particularly when it comes to procreating children; I imagine this is because Nature wants to ensure that the evils of wisdom shall not spread further throughout mankind.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: Mixing one’s wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: Wisdom is never on the menu, you have to own the restaurant.
general.author: carrie latet

general.quote: Learning sleeps and snores in libraries, but wisdom is everywhere, wide awake, on tiptoe.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.
general.author: felix frankfurter

general.quote: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.
general.author: juvenal, satires

general.quote: Wisdom sails with wind and time.
general.author: john florio

general.quote: The wise man knows nothing if he cannot benefit from his wisdom. Wisdom is not only to be acquired, but also to be utilized.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Wisdom hath her excesses, and no less need of moderation than folly.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: No man has all the wisdom in the world; everyone has some.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Common-sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: Cunning is seeing a hundred yards ahead–wisdom, fifty miles in advance.
general.author: charles william day

general.quote: Justice without wisdom is impossible.
general.author: james anthony froude

general.quote: It’s a beautiful thing, the blossoming of Wisdom. Like a flower in spring.
general.author: michael rudd

general.quote: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: We judge of man’s wisdom by his hope.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Wisdom comes only through suffering.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: Everyone whose deeds are more than his wisdom, his wisdom endures; and everyone whose wisdom is more than his deeds, his wisdom does not endure.
general.author: the talmud

general.quote: To finish the moment, to find the journey’s end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
general.author: norman cousins

general.quote: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
general.author: octavio paz

general.quote: The wealth of mankind is the wisdom they leave.
general.author: john boyle o’reilly

general.quote: Wisdom is the only thing which can relieve us from the sway of the passions and the fear of danger, and which can teach us to bear the injuries of fortune itself with moderation, and which shows us all the ways which lead to tranquillity and peace.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: A simple realization that there are other points of view is the beginning of wisdom.
general.author: grenville kleiser

general.quote: There are many gates to the house of wisdom.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Wisdom is the daughter of experience.
general.author: leonardo da vinci quotes

general.quote: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: The music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
general.author: walter lippmann

general.quote: Wisdom is only found in truth.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: A man begins cutting his wisdom teeth the first time he bites off more than he can chew.
general.author: herb caen

general.quote: Wisdom consists not no much in seeing as in foreseeing.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Was not this … what we spoke of as the great advantage of wisdom — to know what is known and what is unknown to us?
general.author: plato

general.quote: The next thing to having wisdom ourselves, is to profit by that of others.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you’d have preferred to talk.
general.author: doug larson

general.quote: Each of us knows all. We need only open our minds to hear our own wisdom.
general.author: dan brown

general.quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
general.author: alfred lord tennyson

general.quote: Wisdom is a treasure, the key whereof is never lost.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: The beginning of wisdom is the knowledge of folly.
general.author: norman macdonald

general.quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: The wise man questions the wisdom of others because he questions his own, the foolish man, because it is different from his own.
general.author: leo stein

general.quote: When people agree with me I always feel that I must be wrong.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Nobody agrees with anybody else anyhow, but adults conceal it and infants show it.
general.author: ogden nash

general.quote: Minds do not act together in public; they simply stick together; and when their private activities are resumed, they fly apart again.
general.author: frank moore colby

general.quote: A verbal contract isn’t worth the paper it’s written on.
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: The fellow that agrees with everything you say is either a fool or he is getting ready to skin you.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: An agreement between two men to do what both agree is wrong.
general.author: lord edward cecil,

general.quote: There is nothing more likely to start disagreement among people or countries than an agreement.
general.author: elwyn brooks white

general.quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make life more livable.
general.author: louise nevelson

general.quote: We seldom find any person of good sense, except those who share our opinions.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Men keep agreements when it is to the advantage of neither to break them.
general.author: solon

general.quote: If you wish to appear agreeable in society, you must consent to be taught many things which you know already.
general.author: johann kaspar lavater

general.quote: Three may keep counsel, if two are away.
general.author: john heywood

general.quote: One can be very happy without demanding that others agree with them.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: If two men agree on everything, you may be sure that one of them is doing the thinking.
general.author: lyndon baines johnson

general.quote: My idea of an agreeable person is a person who agrees with me.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: There’s nothing is this world more instinctively abhorrent to me than finding myself in agreement with my fellow humans.
general.author: malcolm muggeridge

general.quote: Even savage animals can agree among themselves.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Too much agreement kills the chat.
general.author: eldridge cleaver

general.quote: The reason why so few people are agreeable in conversation is that each is thinking more about what he intends to say than others are saying.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: You can always tell when a man’s well informed. His views are pretty much like your own.
general.author: louie morris

general.quote: Man, an animal that makes bargains.
general.author: adam smith

general.quote: A consensus means that everyone agrees to say collectively what no one believes individually.
general.author: abba eban

general.quote: He that complies against his will is of his own opinion still.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: My opinion, my conviction, gains immensely in strength and sureness the minute a second mind as adopted it.
general.author: novalis

general.quote: One good analogy is worth three hours discussion.
general.author: james t. mccay

general.quote: Make fair agreements and stick to them.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: What usually comes first is the contract.
general.author: ira gershwin

general.quote: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.
general.author: dudley field malone

general.quote: An alliance with a powerful person is never safe.
general.author: phaedrus

general.quote: Those who agree with us may not be right, but we admire their astuteness.
general.author: cullen hightower

general.quote: You may easily play a joke on a man who likes to argue — agree with him.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: You can get assent to almost any proposition so long as you are not going to do anything about it.
general.author: john jay chapman

general.quote: I seem to smell the stench of appeasement in the air.
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: Perhaps the most delightful friendships are those in which there is much agreement, much disputation, and yet more personal liking.
general.author: george eliot quotes

general.quote: The rule of my life is to make business a pleasure, and pleasure my business.
general.author: aaron burr

general.quote: The busy have no time for tears.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Let’s be honest. There’s not a business anywhere that is without problems. Business is complicated and imperfect. Every business everywhere is staffed with imperfect human beings and exists by providing a product or service to other imperfect human beings.
general.author: bob parsons

general.quote: You are not in business to be popular.
general.author: kristie alley

general.quote: If you can run one business well, you can run any business well.
general.author: richard branson

general.quote: Being good in business is the most fascinating kind of art. Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
general.author: andy warhol

general.quote: What helps people, helps business.
general.author: leo burnett

general.quote: Fidelity is seven-tenths of business success.
general.author: james parton

general.quote: You have to have your heart in the business and the business in your heart.
general.author: thomas j. watson

general.quote: Business has only two functions, marketing and innovation.
general.author: peter f. drucker

general.quote: Business is more exciting than any game.
general.author: lord beaverbrook

general.quote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.
general.author: w. edwards deming

general.quote: The success combination in business is: Do what you do better… and: do more of what you do…
general.author: david joseph schwartz

general.quote: A business exists to create a customer.
general.author: peter f. drucker

general.quote: Leisure for people of business, and business for people of leisure would cure many problems.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: When you’re out of quality you’re out of business.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: In business, three things are necessary: knowledge, temper, and time.
general.author: owen felltham

general.quote: To succeed in business it is necessary to make others see things as you see them.
general.author: john h. patterson

general.quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor kind of business.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Business is like a wheelbarrow — it stands still until someone pushes it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What you think of me is none of my business.
general.author: terry cole-whittaker

general.quote: My own business always bores me to death; I prefer other people’s
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Business, that’s easily defined; it’s other people’s money.
general.author: alexandre dumas

general.quote: If you don’t drive your business you will be driven out of business.
general.author: b.c forbes

general.quote: Business was originated to produce happiness, not to pile up millions.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: Thought, not money, is the real business capital…
general.author: harvey s. firestone

general.quote: It is difficult, but not impossible, to conduct strictly honest business.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: Drive your business, let not your business drive you.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Our business in life is not to get ahead of others, but to get ahead of ourselves.
general.author: e. joseph cossman

general.quote: Business today consists in persuading crowds.
general.author: gerald stanley lee

general.quote: You can’t run a business without taking risks.
general.author: millard drexler

general.quote: Business is a combination of war and sport.
general.author: andré maurois

general.quote: Let love give way to business; give attention to business and you will be safe.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: A hard thing about business is minding your own.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To succeed in business, to reach the top, an individual must know all it is possible to know about that business.
general.author: j.paul getty

general.quote: The most successful businessman is the man who holds onto the old just as long as it is good, and grabs the new just as soon as it is better.
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: If I love you, what business is it of yours?
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Business conventions are important because they demonstrate how many people a company can operate without.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The safe way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
general.author: kin hubbard

general.quote: Is that a gun in your pocket, or are you just happy to see me?
general.author: mae west

general.quote: People do not want what we have in our pockets half as much as they want what is in our hearts. If we combine both, intelligently, however, according to our means, we give wisely and well.
general.author: george matthew adams

general.quote: It’s diamonds in your pockets one week, macaroni and cheese the next.
general.author: jolene blalock

general.quote: The way the people around you position themselves around you to get in your pockets and in your mind is infuriating to me.
general.author: dave chappelle

general.quote: January, month of empty pockets! let us endure this evil month, anxious as a theatrical producer’s forehead.
general.author: sidonie gabrielle colette

general.quote: Feel for others in your pocket.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: If you make any money, the government shoves you in the creek once a year with it in your pockets, and all that don’t get wet you can keep.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: The last suit that you wear, you don’t need any pockets.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: It isn’t what you have in your pocket that makes you thankful, but what you have in your heart.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The traveller with empty pockets will sing in the thief ‘s face.
general.author: juvenal

general.quote: Money is always there but the pockets change; it is not in the same pockets after a change, and that is all there is to say about money.
general.author: gertrude stein

general.quote: He walked around with pockets full of quarters, handing out handfuls to people just to put a smile on their faces.
general.author: jim cole

general.quote: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
general.author: emil zatopek

general.quote: Empty pockets make empty heads.
general.author: william carlos williams

general.quote: Empty pockets never held anyone back. Only empty heads and empty hearts can do that.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: It is not helpful to help a friend by putting coins in his pockets when he has got holes in his pockets.
general.author: elizabeth bowen

general.quote: You love me so much, you want to put me in your pocket. And I should die there smothered.
general.author: d.h. lawrence

general.quote: Time and again we have learned that the best way to achieve growth and create jobs is for hardworking people to keep more of their own money in their own pockets.
general.author: chris chocola

general.quote: We must look after our own before lining the pockets of overseas countries and investors.
general.author: pauline hanson

general.quote: Just remember, you can’t climb the ladder of success with your hands in your pockets.
general.author: arnold schwarzenegger

general.quote: When you put more money in the pockets of working families, they spend it on groceries, gas, school supplies, and other goods and services. And that helps businesses grow and create jobs. So many forward-looking employers, large and small, understand this.
general.author: thomas perez

general.quote: The only security men can have for their political liberty, consists in keeping their money in their own pockets.
general.author: lysander spooner

general.quote: If you want the government off your back, get your hands out of its pockets.
general.author: gary hart

general.quote: Our goals for this nation must be nothing less than to double the size of our economy and bring prosperity and jobs, ownership and equality of opportunity to all Americans, especially those living in our nation’s pockets of poverty.
general.author: jack kemp

general.quote: I never trust a man unless I’ve got his pecker in my pocket.
general.author: lyndon b. johnson

general.quote: No one can read with profit that which he cannot learn to read with pleasure.
general.author: thomas hardy

general.quote: The investor of today does not profit from yesterday’s growth.
general.author: warren buffett

general.quote: The loss which is unknown is no loss at all.
general.author: syrus (publilius syrus)

general.quote: Corporation: An ingenious device for obtaining profit without individual responsibility.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Don’t be seduced into thinking that that which does not make a profit is without value.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: For what shall it profit a man, if he gain the whole world, and suffer the loss of his soul?
general.author: jesus christ

general.quote: In the state of nature profit is the measure of right.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: Take every gain without showing remorse about missed profits, because an eel may escape sooner than you think.
general.author: lope de vega

general.quote: When profit is unshared it’s less likely to grow greater.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: A person is born with a liking for profit.
general.author: xun zi

general.quote: The art of losing isn’t hard to master; so many things seem filled with the intent to be lost that their loss is no disaster.
general.author: elizabeth bishop

general.quote: There can be no rise in the value of labour without a fall of profits.
general.author: david ricardo

general.quote: Nothing that grieves us can be called little: by the eternal laws of proportion a child’s loss of a doll and a king’s loss of a crown are events of the same size.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Wise men never sit and wail their loss, but cheerily seek how to redress their harms.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: No man can lose what he never had.
general.author: izaak walton

general.quote: Nothing profits more than self-esteem, grounded on what is just and right.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Profit is not the legitimate purpose of business. The legitimate purpose of business is to provide a product or service that people need and do it so well that it’s profitable.
general.author: james rouse

general.quote: Take care to sell your horse before he dies. The art of life is passing losses on.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: For small business people, less paperwork means higher profits, boosted sales and more time with the family.
general.author: tony abbott

general.quote: Profit is sweet, even if it comes from deception.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: No wise person should make known the loss of fortune, any malpractice in their house, his being cheated, or having been disgraced.
general.author: hitopadesa

general.quote: Giving yourself permission to lose guarantees a loss.
general.author: pat riley

general.quote: That is a good book which is opened with expectation, and closed with delight and profit.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: It takes nearly as much ability to know how to profit by good advice as to know how to act for one’s self.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The best way to guarantee a loss is to quit.
general.author: morgan freeman

general.quote: War against a foreign country only happens when the moneyed classes think they are going to profit from it.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Too many people think only of their own profit. but business opportunity seldom knocks on the door of self-centered people. no customer ever goes to a store merely to please the storekeeper.
general.author: kazuo inamori

general.quote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.
general.author: w. edwards deming

general.quote: To win you have to risk loss.
general.author: jean-claude killy

general.quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: No matter how hard the loss, defeat might serve as well as victory to shake the soul and let the glory out.
general.author: al gore

general.quote: What does it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses his own soul?
general.author: robert fulghum

general.quote: A business absolutely devoted to service will have only one worry about profits. They will be embarrassingly large.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: There is nothing the body suffers the soul may not profit by.
general.author: george meredith

general.quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts… perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
general.author: john steinbeck

general.quote: Know how to listen, and you will profit even from those who talk badly.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: The best plan is to profit by the folly of others.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: Talk is by far the most accessible of pleasures. It costs nothing in money, it is all profit, it completes our education, founds and fosters our friendships, and can be enjoyed at any age and in almost any state of health.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: Prefer a loss to a dishonest gain; the one brings pain at the moment, the other for all time.
general.author: chilon

general.quote: The more illegal a profit, the more tenaciously a man clings to it.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Many receive advice, only the wise profit from it.
general.author: harper lee

general.quote: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: Poets wish to profit or to please.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Sometimes a loss is the best thing that can happen. It teaches you what you should have done next time.
general.author: snoop dogg

general.quote: Profitability doesn’t happen when you’re walking on bullshit.
general.author: jerry martin

general.quote: Nobody ever lost money taking a profit.
general.author: bernard baruch

general.quote: Take all the fools out of this world and there wouldn’t be any fun living in it, or profit.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: One who works for his own profit is likely to work hard. One who works for the use of others, without profit to himself, is likely not to work any harder than he must.
general.author: b. carroll reece

general.quote: When morality comes up against profit, it is seldom that profit loses.
general.author: shirley chisholm

general.quote: If you open up the mind, the opportunity to address both profits and social conditions are limitless. It’s a process of innovation.
general.author: jerry greenfield

general.quote: Life is divided into three terms – that which was, which is, and which will be. Let us learn from the past to profit by the present, and from the present to live better in the future.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: Make every thought, every fact, that comes into your mind pay you a profit. Make it work and produce for you. Think of things not as they are but as they might be. Don’t merely dream – but create!
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Profits on the exchange are the treasures of goblins. At one time they may be carbuncle stones, then coals, then diamonds, then flint stones, then morning dew, then tears.
general.author: lope de vega

general.quote: Remind people that profit is the difference between revenue and expense. This makes you look smart.
general.author: scott adams

general.quote: Profit and morality are a hard combination to beat.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: The worst crime against working people is a company which fails to operate at a profit.
general.author: samuel gompers

general.quote: Faithfully guard your reputation.
general.author: nathaniel mayer victor rothschild

general.quote: All it takes is a single act of aggression to permanently wound a nation’s reputation.
general.author: ramman kenoun

general.quote: A reputation once broken may possibly be repaired, but the world will always keep their eyes on the spot where the crack was.
general.author: joseph hall

general.quote: The two chief things that give a man reputation in counsel, are the opinion of his honesty, and the opinion of his wisdom; the authority of those two will persuade.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: My reputation grows with every failure.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: Until you’ve lost your reputation, you never realize what a burden it was or what freedom really is.
general.author: margaret mitchell

general.quote: One may be better than his reputation or his conduct, but never better than his principles.
general.author: niocolas valentin de latena

general.quote: Reputation is only a candle, of wavering and uncertain flame, and easily blown out, but it is the light by which the world looks for and finds merit.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: Our reputation is more important than the last hundred million dollars.
general.author: rupert murdoch

general.quote: Concealed talent brings no reputation.
general.author: desiderius erasmus

general.quote: Begin somewhere; you cannot build a reputation on what you intend to do.
general.author: liz smith

general.quote: Character is like a tree and reputation like its shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
general.author: socrates quotes

general.quote: One can survive everything, nowadays, except death, and live down everything except a good reputation.
general.author: oscar wilde quotes

general.quote: It is a maxim to me that no man was ever written out of reputation but by himself.
general.author: richard bentley,

general.quote: There are two way of establishing a reputation, one to be praised by honest people and the other to be accused by rogues. It is best, however, to secure the first one, because it will always be accompanied by the latter.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: The reputation of a woman may also be compared to a mirror of crystal, shining and bright, but liable to be sullied by every breath that comes near it.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Time never fails to bring every exalted reputation to a strict scrutiny.
general.author: fisher ames

general.quote: Reputation is made every day and every minute.
general.author: christopher ruel

general.quote: Repetition makes reputation and reputation makes customers.
general.author: elizabeth arden

general.quote: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Reputation is an idle and most false imposition; oft got without merit, and lost without deserving.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Reputation is a jewel which nothing can replace; it is ten thousand times more valuable capital than your diamonds.
general.author: edouard rene lefebure laboulaye

general.quote: Time goes by, reputation increases, ability declines.
general.author: dag hammarskjold

general.quote: Gain a modest reputation for being unreliable and you will never be asked to do a thing.
general.author: paul theroux

general.quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: In all the affairs of this world, so much reputation is in reality so much power.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: Reputation is an interpretation, more or less accurate, of character.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Associate with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: Silence and reserve will give anyone a reputation for wisdom.
general.author: myrtle reed

general.quote: A man’s judgment is best when he can forget himself and any reputation he may have acquired and can concentrate wholly on making the right decisions.
general.author: raymond spruance

general.quote: How many people live on the reputation of the reputation they might have made!
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: The strange machinery by which a reputation precedes its source we all know is faulty. Yet how much faith we put in it!
general.author: samuel r

general.quote: Reputation is rarely proportioned to virtue.
general.author: st. francis de sales

general.quote: How difficult it is to save the bark of reputation from the rocks of ignorance.
general.author: francesco petrarch

general.quote: A man’s reputation draws eyes upon him that will narrowly inspect every part of him.
general.author: joseph addison quotes

general.quote: It is easier to add to a great reputation than to get it.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Unfortunately, your reputation often rests not on your ability to do what you say, but rather on your ability to do what people expect.
general.author: bryant h. mcgill

general.quote: You have lost no reputation at all, unless you repute yourself such a loser.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Many a man’s reputation would not know his character if they met on the street.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The great difficulty is first to win a reputation; the next to keep it while you live; and the next to preserve it after you die, when affection and interest are over, and nothing but sterling excellence can preserve your name.
general.author: benjamin robert haydon

general.quote: Reputation depends more on what is hidden than on what is seen. If you can’t be good, be careful.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Reputation, reputation, reputation! O, I ha lost my reputation, I ha lost the immortal part of myself, and what remains is bestial!
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Reputation is what men and women think of us; character is what God and angels know of us.
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: When a man has once gained a Reputation not even with God’s help can he get rid of it.
general.author: abraham miller

general.quote: A reputation for good judgment, for fair dealing, for truth, and for rectitude, is itself a fortune.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The worst thing that can happen to a man is to lose his money, the next worst his health, the next worst his reputation.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: A good name is better than bags of gold.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: A man can get a reputation from very small things.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: The most important thing for a young man is to establish a credit… a reputation, character.
general.author: john d. rockefeller

general.quote: Kindly words do not enter so deeply into men as a reputation for kindness.
general.author: mencius

general.quote: Reputation is but a synonym of popularity: dependent on suffrage, to be increased or diminished at the will of the voters.
general.author: washington allston

general.quote: The easiest way to get a reputation is to go outside the fold, shout around for a few years as a violent atheist or a dangerous radical, and then crawl back to the shelter.
general.author: f. scott fitzgerald

general.quote: We would all like a reputation for generosity and we’d all like to buy it cheap.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: It is the duty of every one to strive to gain and deserve a good reputation.
general.author: francis atterbury

general.quote: You don’t build a reputation on what you’re going to do.
general.author: henry ford quotes

general.quote: Few people think more than two or three times a year; I have made an international reputation for myself by thinking once or twice a week.
general.author: george bernard shaw quotes

general.quote: Not much more can happen to you after you lose your reputation and your wife.
general.author: john n. mitchell

general.quote: It ain’t often that a man’s reputation outlasts his money.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: It takes many good deeds to build a good reputation, and only one bad one to lose it.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: In the end, you make your reputation and you have your success based upon credibility and being able to provide people who are really hungry for information what they want.
general.author: brit hume

general.quote: A single lie destroys a whole reputation of integrity.
general.author: balthazar gracian

general.quote: Earn a reputation for living well in God’s eyes and the eyes of the people.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Worldly wisdom teaches that it is better for the reputation to fail conventionally than to succeed unconventionally.
general.author: john maynard keynes

general.quote: Ninety percent of the politicians give the other ten percent a bad reputation.
general.author: henry a. kissinger

general.quote: He, who worries about reputation, has a reputation to worry about.
general.author: edwin leibfreed

general.quote: There are few persons of greater worth than their reputation; but how many are there whose worth is far short of their reputation!
general.author: leszczynski stanislaus

general.quote: Build your reputation by helping other people build theirs.
general.author: anthony j. d’angelo

general.quote: Work is the price which is paid for reputation.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: There is nothing more necessary to establish reputation than to suspend the enjoyment of it.
general.author: sir richard steele

general.quote: It is generally much more shameful to lose a good reputation than never to have acquired it.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: Glass, china, and reputation are easily cracked, and never mended well.
general.author: benjamin franklin quotes

general.quote: Think and grow rich.
general.author: napoleon hill

general.quote: We may lack riches, but the greatest fortune is what lies in our hearts.
general.author: dean koontz

general.quote: The rich are like beasts of burden, carrying treasure all day, and at the night of death unladen; they carry to their grave only the bruises and marks of their toil.
general.author: saint aurelius augustine

general.quote: The way to cure hatred of the rich is to accumulate some property yourself.
general.author: lewis f. korns

general.quote: Who is rich? He that rejoices in his portion.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Wisdom ruleth in counsel — so do riches.
general.author: lancelot andrewes

general.quote: Those who spend too fast never grow rich.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Riches do not delight us so much with their possession, as torment us with their loss.
general.author: dick gregory

general.quote: A rich woman seems to have all her banknotes about her, guarding her virtue, like a cuirass, in the lining of her corset.
general.author: gustave flaubert

general.quote: He who knows he has enough is rich.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: It is better to live rich, than to die rich.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: As the cream abandons the milk from which it took its life, and rises to the top and rides there, so men, because they are richer than those around about them, separate themselves, and all mankind below them they regard as skim milk.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Fashion and riches will mask much annoyance…
general.author: christopher pearse cranch

general.quote: Man was born to be rich, or grow rich by use of his faculties, by the union of thought with nature. Property is an intellectual production. The game requires coolness, right reasoning, promptness, and patience in the players.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I don’t believe in riches, but you should see where I live.
general.author: bond

general.quote: Of all the riches that we hug, of all the pleasures we enjoy, we can carry no more out of this world than out of a dream.
general.author: john s. bonnell

general.quote: Riches are able to solder up abundance of flaws.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Riches do not consist in the possession of treasures, but in the use made of them.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: The man who dies rich… dies disgraced.
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: That which can be lost cannot be deemed riches.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: Riches are but a means, or instrument; and the virtue of an instrument lies in its use.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: He who is contented is rich.
general.author: lao-tzu

general.quote: There is a very easy way to return from a casino with a small fortune: go there with a large one.
general.author: jack yelton

general.quote: The fame of the rich man dies with him; the fame of the treasure, and not of the man who possessed it, remains.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: Riches are a good handmaid, but the worst mistress.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Every man thinks God is on his side. The rich and powerful know he is.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: It is wonderful to think how men of very large estates not only spend their yearly income, but are often actually in want of money. It is clear, they have not value for what they spend.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: It is the wretchedness of being rich that you have to live with rich people.
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: Among the very rich you will never find a really generous man, even by accident. They may give their money away, but they will never give themselves away; they are egoistic, secretive, dry as old bones. To be smart enough to get all that money you must be dull enough to want it.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: The jests of the rich are ever successful.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: He hath riches sufficient who hath enough to be charitable.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: The rich man’s happiness is but from the teeth outwards, a counterfeit satisfaction, with a worm in his heart.
general.author: wellins calcott

general.quote: We want wealth, but there are many other things we want very much more. Among them are peace, honor, charity, and idealism.
general.author: calvin coolidge

general.quote: Riches are not an end of life, but an instrument of life.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: There is nothing wrong with men possessing riches. The wrong comes when riches possess men.
general.author: billy graham

general.quote: To be satisfied with what one has; that is wealth. As long as one sorely needs a certain additional amount, that man isn’t rich.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Riches expose a man to pride and luxury, and a foolish elation of heart.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Nothing more clearly shows how little God esteems his gift to men of wealth, money, position and other worldly goods, than the way he distributes these, and the sort of men who are most amply provided with them.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: The most wanton torture is that of the rich trying to kill time.
general.author: lewis f. korns

general.quote: Titles, riches, and fine houses signify no more to the making of one man better than another, than the finer saddle to the making the better horse.
general.author: wellins calcott

general.quote: Riches are apt to betray a man into arrogance.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Riches are of little avail in many of the calamities to which mankind are liable.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: We may see the small value God has for riches by the people he gives them to.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Men leave their riches either to their kindred or their friends, and moderate portions prosper best in both.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Riches enlarge rather than satisfy appetites.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: A man that hoards up riches and enjoys them not, is like an ass that carries gold and eats thistles.
general.author: sir richard burton

general.quote: Never respect men merely for their riches; but rather for their philanthropy: we do not value the sun for its height, but for its use.
general.author: william scott downey

general.quote: If your riches are yours, why don’t you take them with to the other world?
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Every day I get up and look through the Forbes list of the richest people in America. If I’m not there, I go to work.
general.author: robert orben

general.quote: It’s better to have a rich soul than to be rich.
general.author: olga korbut

general.quote: The desire for riches is more sharpened by their use than by their need. Pleasing all: a mark that can never be aimed at or hit.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Know from the bounteous heavens all riches flow; and what man gives, the gods by man bestow.
general.author: homer

general.quote: So our Lord God commonly gives riches to those gross asses to whom He vouchsafes nothing else.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Those that say they despise riches are saints or liars.
general.author: austin o’malley

general.quote: Many speak the truth when they say that they despise riches, but they mean the riches possessed by other men.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: Riches are chiefly good because they give us time.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
general.author: coco chanel

general.quote: He who multiplies riches, multiplies cares.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: In a rich man’s house there is no place to spit but his face.
general.author: diogenes of sinope

general.quote: Rich isn’t an amount of money, it’s a mindset about how you live. If you believe you can win, you can.
general.author: dave ramsey

general.quote: Any man can become rich who is base enough to keep a brothel, a gin palace, or a gambling house.
general.author: charles william day

general.quote: Ordinary riches can be stolen; real riches cannot. In your soul are infinitely precious things that cannot be taken from you.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Ability involves responsibility; power to its last particle, is duty."
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: To become an able man in any profession, there are three things necessary,–nature, study, and practice."
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old."
general.author: franz kafka

general.quote: Be thankful for problems. If they were less difficult, someone with less ability might have your job."
general.author: james a. lovell

general.quote: The highest reward that God gives us for good work is the ability to do better work."
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: I had the right to remain silent… but I didn’t have the ability."
general.author: ron white

general.quote: Nothing so conclusively proves a man’s ability to lead others as what he does from day to day to lead himself."
general.author: thomas j. watson

general.quote: The test of character is having the ability to meet challenges."
general.author: walter annenberg

general.quote: The ability to convert ideas to things is the secret of outward success."
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: But I always had the ability to say no. That’s how I called my own shots."
general.author: sidney poitier

general.quote: God does not ask about our ability, but our availability."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It is ability, not disability that counts."
general.author: edgar j. helms

general.quote: Man’s greatness consists in his ability to do and the proper application of his powers to things needed to be done."
general.author: frederick douglass

general.quote: You are the only person on earth who can use your ability."
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: He, who has acquired the ability, may wait securely the occasion of making it felt and appreciated, and know that it will not loiter."
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Choose your corner, pick away at it carefully, intensely and to the best of your ability and that way you might change the world."
general.author: charles eames

general.quote: It is a fine thing to have ability, but the ability to discover ability in others is the true test."
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Consider the postage stamp: its usefulness consists in the ability to stick to one thing till it gets there."
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Sometimes I think if I had the same body and the same natural ability and someone else’s brain, who knows how good a player I might have been."
general.author: mickey mantle

general.quote: Trust your ability!"
general.author: itzhak perlman

general.quote: Ability hits the mark where presumption overshoots and diffidence falls short."
general.author: john henry newman

general.quote: I’ve got a woman’s ability to stick to a job and get on with it when everyone else walks off and leaves it."
general.author: margaret thatcher

general.quote: I add this also, that natural ability without education has oftener raised man to glory and virtue, than education without natural ability."
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Wicked people are always surprised to find ability in those that are good."
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: If you have ability in a certain area, why not capitalize on it and improve it and use it?"
general.author: wilt chamberlain

general.quote: Every man’s ability may be strengthened or increased by culture."
general.author: john abbott

general.quote: Ability is a poor man’s wealth."
general.author: matthew wren

general.quote: If you are carrying strong feelings about something that happened in your past, they may hinder your ability to live in the present."
general.author: les brown

general.quote: Never underestimate your problem or your ability to deal with it."
general.author: robert h. schuller

general.quote: Progress is man’s ability to complicate simplicity."
general.author: thor heyerdahl

general.quote: The extent of your consciousness is limited only by your ability to love and to embrace with your love the space around you, and all it contains."
general.author: ken carey

general.quote: One of the true tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency."
general.author: arnold h. glasow

general.quote: Don’t measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability."
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: I think that God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability."
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it."
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change."
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: Ability is the art of getting credit for all the home runs somebody else hits."
general.author: casey stengel

general.quote: Great success is commoner than great abilities."
general.author: luc de clapiers de vauvenargues

general.quote: Consider well what your strength is equal to, and what exceeds your ability."
general.author: horace

general.quote: To know how to hide one’s ability is great skill."
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: We all have ability. The difference is how we use it."
general.author: stevie wonder

general.quote: Natural ability without education has more often raised a man to glory and virtue than education without natural ability."
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: The world cares very little about what a man or woman knows; it is what a man or woman is able to do that counts."
general.author: booker t. washington

general.quote: The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience and ability."
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: Choose a subject equal to your abilities; think carefully what your shoulders may refuse, and what they are capable of bearing."
general.author: horace

general.quote: The ability to concentrate and to use time well is everything."
general.author: lee iacocca

general.quote: There is far more opportunity than there is ability."
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life."
general.author: dean koontz

general.quote: Success is what you do with your ability. It’s how you use your talent."
general.author: george allen, sr.

general.quote: You can only do the work to the very best of your ability."
general.author: christine baranski

general.quote: Natural abilities are like natural plants; they need pruning by study."
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: I think luck is the sense to recognize an opportunity and the ability to take advantage of it… The man who can smile at his breaks and grab his chances gets on."
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: All endeavor calls for the ability to tramp the last mile, shape the last plan, endure the last hours toil. the fight to the finish spirit is the one…characteristic we must possess if we are to face the future as finishers.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Our duty, as men and women, is to proceed as if limits to our ability did not exist. We are collaborators in creation."
general.author: pierre teilhard de chardin

general.quote: It is the ability to choose which makes us human."
general.author: madeleine l’engle

general.quote: Ability is sexless."
general.author: christabel pankhurst

general.quote: Martyrdom is the only way a man can become famous without ability."
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Ability wins us the appreciation of the true persons, and luck wins that of "the people."
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The ability to change constantly and effectively is made easier by high-level continuity."
general.author: michael porter

general.quote: Great ability develops and reveals itself increasingly with every new assignment."
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Unfortunately, your reputation often rests not on your ability to do what you say, but rather on your ability to do what people expect."
general.author: bryant h. mcgill

general.quote: We are often able because we think we are able."
general.author: joel hawes

general.quote: Since you are like no other being ever created since the beginning of time, you are incomparable."
general.author: brenda ueland

general.quote: If money is your hope for independence you will never have it. The only real security that a man will have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience, and ability."
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: The greatest ability in business is to get along with others and to influence their actions."
general.author: john hancock

general.quote: The height of ability consists in a thorough knowledge of the real value of things, and of the genius of the age in which we live."
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Ability without honor is useless."
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: There is no need to show your ability before everyone."
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability."
general.author: walter scott

general.quote: A politician needs the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month, and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didn’t happen."
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: An able man shows his spirit by gentle words and resolute actions."
general.author: philip dormer stanhope

general.quote: Every person is responsible for all the good within the scope of his abilities, and for no more, and none can tell whose sphere is the largest."
general.author: gail hamilton

general.quote: I believe the greatest asset a head of state can have is the ability to get a good night’s sleep."
general.author: harold wilson

general.quote: Put yourself in a state of mind where you say to yourself, "Here is an opportunity for me to celebrate like never before, my own power, my own ability to get myself to do whatever is necessary."
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: With realization of one’s own potential and self-confidence in one’s ability, one can build a better world."
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: I could never be a manager. All I have is natural ability."
general.author: mickey mantle

general.quote: As we advance in life we learn the limits of our abilities."
general.author: james a. froude

general.quote: Wisdom is not attained by years, but by ability."
general.author: plautus

general.quote: Ability may get you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there."
general.author: john wooden

general.quote: There is something that is much more scarce, something finer far, something rarer than ability. It is the ability to recognize ability."
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Executive ability is deciding quickly and getting somebody else to do the work."
general.author: john g. pollard

general.quote: Instinct is untaught ability."
general.author: alexander bain

general.quote: Every American deserves to live in freedom, to have his or her privacy respected and a chance to go as far as their ability and effort will take them – regardless of race, gender, ethnicity or economic circumstances."
general.author: christopher dodd

general.quote: Our only security is our ability to change."
general.author: john lilly

general.quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators."
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: Great abilities have always been less serviceable to the possessors than moderate ones."
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: If only every man would make proper use of his strength and do his utmost, he need never regret his limited ability."
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: Success is the maximum utilization of the ability that you have."
general.author: zig ziglar

general.quote: He is able who thinks he is able."
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Be yourself. Follow your instincts. Success depends, at least in part, on the ability to "carry it off."
general.author: donald rumsfeld

general.quote: The tragedy is that so many have ambition and so few have ability."
general.author: william feather

general.quote: Big jobs usually go to the men who prove their ability to outgrow small ones."
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The world judge of men by their ability in their profession, and we judge of ourselves by the same test: for it is on that on which our success in life depends."
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: A stiff apology is a second insult. The injured party does not want to be compensated because he has been wronged; he wants to be healed because he has been hurt.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: I feel sorry for people who don’t drink. When they wake up in the morning, that’s as good as they’re going to feel all day.
general.author: dean martin

general.quote: Doomed are the hotheads! Unhappy are they who lose their cool and are too proud to say, I’m sorry.
general.author: rober h schuller

general.quote: Play fair. Don’t hit people. Say you’re sorry when you hurt somebody.
general.author: robert fulghum

general.quote: To feel sorry for the needy is not the mark of a Christian — to help them is.
general.author: frank a. clark

general.quote: I believe that God felt sorry for actors so he created Hollywood to give them a place in the sun and a swimming pool. The price they had to pay was to surrender their talent.
general.author: sir cedric hardwicke

general.quote: I believe that he was really sorry that people would not believe he was sorry that he was not more sorry.
general.author: samuel butler

general.quote: Being Politically Correct means always having to say you’re sorry.
general.author: charles osgood

general.quote: Compassion doesn’t, of course, mean feeling sorry for people, or pity, which is how the word has become emasculated in a way.
general.author: karen armstrong

general.quote: I sort of feel sorry for the next man who gets me. I may just kill him with passion. He’d better be strong and have a good heart!
general.author: kirstie alley

general.quote: Feeling sorry for ourselves is the most useless waste of energy on the planet. It does absolutely no good. We can’t let our circumstances or what others do or don’t do control us. We can decide to be happy regardless.
general.author: joyce meyer

general.quote: There’s no room in my life for feeling sorry for myself.
general.author: wayne newton

general.quote: It is a good rule in life never to apologize. The right sort of people do not want apologies, and the wrong sort take a mean advantage of them.
general.author: p.g. wodehouse

general.quote: Feeling sorry for yourself, and your present condition, is not only a waste of energy but the worst habit you could possibly have.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: Keep your words soft and tender because tomorrow you may have to eat them.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Let the wife make the husband glad to come home, and let him make her sorry to see him leave.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: I have done my duty by the laws of my people and I am sorry my people were led this time by men who were not soldiers and that crimes were committed of which I had no knowledge.
general.author: ernst kaltenbrunner

general.quote: The best apology against false accusers is silence and sufferance, and honest deeds set dishonest words.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Never ruin an apology with an excuse.
general.author: kimberly johnson

general.quote: And I felt sorry, and I have felt bad about what happened.
general.author: monica lewinsky

general.quote: No sensible person ever made an apology.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Except for the young or very happy, I can’t say I am sorry for anyone who dies.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: A very desperate habit; one that is rarely cured. Apology is only egotism wrong side out. Nine times out of ten, the first thing a man’s companion knows of his short-comings is from his apology.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: An apology might help, but you can change your life without one.
general.author: robin quivers

general.quote: I feel sorry for the person who can’t get genuinely excited about his work. Not only will he never be satisfied, but he will never achieve anything worthwhile.
general.author: walter chrysler

general.quote: I am sorry to think that you do not get a man’s most effective criticism until you provoke him. Severe truth is expressed with some bitterness.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: More people should apologize, and more people should accept apologies when sincerely made.
general.author: greg lemond

general.quote: When you’re in a situation, you can complain about it, you can feel sorry for yourself, you can do a lot of things. But how are you gonna make the situation better?
general.author: tony dungy

general.quote: No writer need feel sorry for himself if he writes and enjoys it, even if he doesn’t get paid.
general.author: irwin shaw

general.quote: Apology is only egotism wrong side out.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: Keep courage. Whatever you do, do not feel sorry for yourself. You will win in a great age of opportunity.
general.author: richard l. evans

general.quote: Maturity is the ability to reap without apology and not complain when things don’t go well.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and for deeds left undone.
general.author: harriet beecher stowe

general.quote: A man is sorry to be honest for nothing.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: I’m sorry you are wiser, I sorry you are taller; I liked you better foolish and I liked you better smaller.
general.author: alien murray

general.quote: If you don’t love your enemies and feel sorry for them they’re winning an internal battle against you
general.author: james dye

general.quote: And all that you are sorry for is what you haven’t done.
general.author: margaret widdemer

general.quote: If you’re willing to tell somebody that you love them, are you also willing to say you’re sorry? You need to, even when you think you’re in the right.
general.author: kevin costner

general.quote: If you were going to die soon and had only one phone call you could make, who would you call and what would you say? And why are you waiting?
general.author: stephen levine

general.quote: Apologies are great, but they don’t really change anything. You know what does? Action.
general.author: stella young

general.quote: Grab a chance and you won’t be sorry for a might-have-been.
general.author: arthur ransome

general.quote: Never apologize and never explain – it’s a sign of weakness.
general.author: john wayne

general.quote: Apologies only account for the evil which they cannot alter.
general.author: benjamin disraeli quotes

general.quote: If you’re going to do something tonight that you’ll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.
general.author: henny youngman

general.quote: Families with babies and families without babies are sorry for each other.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: I feel sorry for someone who has to win at everything.
general.author: snoopy

general.quote: I have made terrible mistakes that have hurt the people that I cared about the most, and I am terribly sorry. I am deeply ashamed of my terrible judgment and my actions.
general.author: anthony weiner

general.quote: Love in the real world means saying you’re sorry 10 times a day.
general.author: kathie lee gifford

general.quote: Let no man be sorry he has done good, because others concerned with him have done evil! If a man has acted right, he has done well, though along; if wrong, the sanction of all mankind will not justify him.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: An apology for the devil: it must be remembered that we have heard one side of the case. God has written all the books.
general.author: samuel butler quotes

general.quote: Being sorry is the highest act of selfishness, seeing value only after discarding it.
general.author: douglas horton

general.quote: Saying, ‘I’m sorry’ is the same as saying, ‘ I apologize.’ Except at a funeral.
general.author: demetri martin

general.quote: Apologizing — a very desperate habit — one that is rarely cured. Apology is only egotism wrong side out.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes quotes

general.quote: I was born in very sorry circumstances. Both of my parents were very sorry.
general.author: norman wisdom

general.quote: I believe we are solely responsible for our choices, and we have to accept the consequences of every deed, word, and thought throughout our lifetime.
general.author: elisabeth kubler-ross

general.quote: Right actions in the future are the best apologies for bad actions in the past.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: An apology? Bah! Disgusting! Cowardly! Beneath the dignity of any gentleman, however wrong he might be.
general.author: baroness orczy

general.quote: To feel sorry for oneself is one of the most disintegrating things the individual can do to himself.
general.author: winifred rhoades

general.quote: There are occasions on which all apology is rudeness.
general.author: samuel johnson quotes

general.quote: Among the reasons people keep sad stories to themselves is that they do not want anyone to feel sorry for them.
general.author: judith moore

general.quote: I believe that things should be let go once they are discussed. Apology accepted. End of story.
general.author: brad goreski

general.quote: Most truths are so naked that people feel sorry for them and cover them up, at least a little bit.
general.author: edward r. murrow

general.quote: An apology is a good way to have the last word.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: An apology is the superglue of life. It can repair just about anything.
general.author: lynn johnston

general.quote: No one has the right to be sorry for himself for a misfortune that strikes everyone.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Never make a defense or an apology until you are accused.
general.author: king charles i

general.quote: Sorry is the Kool-Aid of human emotions.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: I’m not sorry for who I am.
general.author: hayley williams

general.quote: Do not feel sorry for me if I am gone.
general.author: arthur ashe

general.quote: The minute a phrase, becomes current, it becomes an apology for not thinking accurately to the end of the sentence.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes quotes

general.quote: Apology is a lovely perfume; it can transform the clumsiest moment into a gracious gift.
general.author: margaret lee runbeck

general.quote: I only feel sorry for weak people. And mostly what I’ve come to find is that the weak people are the ones that are the haters.
general.author: r. kelly

general.quote: My wife heard me say I love you a thousand times, but she never once heard me say sorry.
general.author: bruce willis

general.quote: A hero is someone we can admire without apology.
general.author: kitty kelley

general.quote: Friends are God’s apology for relations.
general.author: hugh kingsmill

general.quote: If love means never having to say you’re sorry, then marriage means always having to say everything twice.
general.author: estelle getty

general.quote: Let us live so that when we come to die even the undertaker will be sorry.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: No matter how many times you say you’re sorry, somebody is not going to hear you.
general.author: pete rose

general.quote: Affliction comes to us, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise.
general.author: henery ward beecher

general.quote: A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough, without ever having felt sorry for itself.
general.author: d.h. lawrence

general.quote: In some families, please is described as the magic word. In our house, however, it was sorry.
general.author: margaret laurence

general.quote: Confidence is the bond of friendship.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Confidence imparts a wonderful inspiration to its possessor.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Winning breeds confidence and confidence breeds winning.
general.author: hubert green

general.quote: People who have a confidence in their personal worth seem to be magnets for success and happiness.
general.author: alan loy mcginnis

general.quote: In a just cause it is right to be confident.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Danger breeds best on too much confidence.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: We advance on our journey only when we face our goal, when we are confident and believe we are going to win out.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: The road to confidence is paved by daily accomplishments.
general.author: keith johnson

general.quote: Confidence is almost all about perception. Very few people are wholly confident in every area of their life. Those who appear to be so are probably good at acting — with themselves as the audience.
general.author: kate burton & brinley n. platts

general.quote: Confidence… is directness and courage in meeting the facts of life.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.
general.author: criss jami

general.quote: I always thought I could play pro ball. I had confidence in my ability, You have to. If you don’t, who will?
general.author: johnny unitas

general.quote: Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Confidence always pleases those who receive it.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Hard to feel confident when you’re surrounded by horse-sized wolves.
general.author: stephenie meyer

general.quote: If you don’t have confidence, you’ll always find a way not to win.
general.author: carl lewis

general.quote: Lack of confidence is what makes you want to change somebody else’s mind. When you’re OK, you don’t need to convince anyone else in order to empower yourself.
general.author: jada pinkett smith

general.quote: Confidence … is the foundation upon which rests the consummation of all Life’s many plans.
