general.quote: Love is to the heart what the summer is to the farmer’s year — it brings to harvest all the loveliest flowers of the soul.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Deep summer is when laziness finds respectability.
general.author: sam keen

general.quote: The trouble with the future is that is usually arrives before we’re ready for it.
general.author: arnold h. glasgow

general.quote: I have seen the future and it is very much like the present – only longer.
general.author: kehlog albran

general.quote: The Present gallops away with clattering feet, while the Future steals noiselessly upon us.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: The present is the laboratory of the future.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: From the experience of the past we derive instructive lessons for the future.
general.author: john quincy adams

general.quote: The past is finished. There is nothing to be gained by going over it. Whatever it gave us in the experiences it brought us was something we had to know .
general.author: rebecca beard

general.quote: If the past is not to bind us … we should have no law but the inclination of the moment.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: History-writing is a way of getting rid of the past.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Night is the blotting paper for many sorrows.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You can’t stand up to the night until you understand what’s hiding in its shadows.
general.author: charles de lint

general.quote: By night, an atheist half believes in God.
general.author: edward young

general.quote: Music is moonlight in the gloomy night of life.
general.author: jean paul

general.quote: Dawn: When men of reason go to bed.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Put yourself in competition with yourself each day. Each morning look back upon your work of yesterday and then try to beat it.
general.author: charles m. sheldon

general.quote: The mind is found most acute and most uneasy in the morning.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: No man knows till he has suffered from the night how sweet and dear to his heart and eye the morning can be.
general.author: bram stoker

general.quote: To have a reason to get up in the morning, it is necessary to possess a guiding principle.
general.author: judith guest

general.quote: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It’s the best part of the day.
general.author: george allen

general.quote: It is always with excitement that I wake up in the morning wondering what my intuition will toss up to me, like gifts from the sea. I work with it and rely on it. It’s my partner.
general.author: dr. jonas salk

general.quote: No human being believes that any other human being has a right to be in bed when he himself is up.
general.author: robert lynd

general.quote: It is the set of the sails, not the direction of the wind that determines which way we will go.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: Money can’t buy you happiness, but it can buy you a yacht big enough to pull up right alongside it.
general.author: david lee roth

general.quote: I don’t get cast as the guy who steps off a yacht in a white linen suit with a martini.
general.author: martin freeman

general.quote: It is not the ship so much as the skillful sailing that assures the prosperous voyage.
general.author: george william curtis

general.quote: Modern carpet designs may provide endless entertainment for your guests.
general.author: w. heath robinson and k.r.g. browne

general.quote: The first day a man is a guest, the second a burden, the third a pest.
general.author: edouard rene lefebure laboulaye

general.quote: One might well say that mankind is divisible into two great classes: hosts and guests.
general.author: max beerbohm

general.quote: Dessert is probably the most important stage of the meal, since it will be the last thing your guests remember before they pass out all over the table.
general.author: william powell

general.quote: If happy little bluebirds fly beyond the rainbow, why oh why can’t I?
general.author: e.y. harburg

general.quote: Thank God men cannot fly, and lay waste the sky as well as the earth.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: In the space age, man will be able to go around the world in two hours – one hour for flying and one hour to get to the airport.
general.author: neil mcelroy

general.quote: When once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: It’s a never ending battle of making your cars better and also trying to be better yourself.
general.author: dale earnhardt

general.quote: A business like an automobile has to be driven, in order to get results.
general.author: b. c. forbes

general.quote: The elderly don’t drive that badly; they’re just the only ones with time to do the speed limit.
general.author: jason love

general.quote: I love to travel, but hate to arrive.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive, and the true success is to labor.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: To be a successful hostess, when guest arrive say, "At last!" and when they leave say, "So soon!".
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: The greatest event for the world is the arrival of a new and wise person.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Adventure is not outside a man; it is within.
general.author: david grayson

general.quote: Belief in oneself is one of the most important bricks in building any successful venture.
general.author: frank gifford

general.quote: A work of art is above all an adventure of the mind.
general.author: eugene ionesco

general.quote: There are two kinds of adventurers: those who go truly hoping to find adventure and those who go secretly hoping they won’t.
general.author: william trogdon

general.quote: Nothing adventured, nothing attained.
general.author: peter mcwilliams

general.quote: There are those who are so scrupulously afraid of doing wrong that they seldom venture to do anything.
general.author: marquis de vauvenargues

general.quote: Service to a just cause rewards the worker with more real happiness and satisfaction than any other venture of life.
general.author: carrie chapman catt

general.quote: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: All men’s gains are the fruit of venturing.
general.author: herodotus

general.quote: I quit being afraid when my first venture failed and the sky didn’t fall down.
general.author: allen h. neuharth

general.quote: Adventure is worthwhile.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Marriage is an adventure, like going to war.
general.author: s. t. coleridge

general.quote: What I love most about this crazy life is the adventure of it.
general.author: juliette binoche

general.quote: It’s when you’re safe at home that you wish you were having an adventure. When you’re having an adventure you wish you were safe at home.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Democracy is an extraordinary adventure. It’s difficult, full of daring and risk and danger. But it’s the greatest gift we have.
general.author: jon voight

general.quote: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
general.author: amelia earhart

general.quote: An adventure is only an inconvenience rightly considered. An inconvenience is only an adventure wrongly considered.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: If we didn’t live adventurously, plucking the wild goat by the beard and trembling over precipices, we should never be depressed, I’ve no doubt, but already should be faded, fatalistic and aged.
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: Knowledge is an unending adventure at the edge of uncertainty.
general.author: jacob bronowski

general.quote: Adventure is just bad planning.
general.author: roald amundsen

general.quote: It is only in adventure that some people succeed in knowing themselves — in finding themselves.
general.author: andré gide

general.quote: Adventure is not outside a man; it is within.
general.author: david grayson

general.quote: Belief in oneself is one of the most important bricks in building any successful venture.
general.author: frank gifford

general.quote: A work of art is above all an adventure of the mind.
general.author: eugene ionesco

general.quote: There are two kinds of adventurers: those who go truly hoping to find adventure and those who go secretly hoping they won’t.
general.author: william trogdon

general.quote: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: As contagion of sickness makes sickness, contagion of trust can make trust.
general.author: marianne moore

general.quote: Trust in yourself. Your perceptions are often far more accurate than you are willing to believe.
general.author: claudia black

general.quote: Trust exists; only lies are invented.
general.author: georges braque

general.quote: "There are seeds of self-destruction in all of us that will bear only unhappiness if allowed to grow."
general.author: dorothea brande

general.quote: "Much unhappiness results from our inability to remember the nice things that happen to us."
general.author: w.n. rieger

general.quote: "The world will never be long without some good reason to hate the unhappy; their real faults are immediately detected, and if those are not sufficient to sink them into infamy, an additional weight of calumny will be super added."
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: "How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself."
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Accept the pain, cherish the joys, resolve the regrets; then can come the best of benedictions, "If I had my life to live over, I’d do it all the same.
general.author: joan mcintosh

general.quote: The person whose doors I enter with most pleasure, and quit with most regret, never did me the smallest favor.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Go to the effort. Invest the time. Write the letter. Make the apology. Take the trip. Purchase the gift. Do it. The seized opportunity renders joy. The neglected brings regret.
general.author: max l. lucado

general.quote: Heart knows no sorrow like the sorrow of regretting.
general.author: martha lavinia hoffman

general.quote: Passion is the genesis of genius.
general.author: anthony robbins

general.quote: Understanding should go first and find out the way, then passion should be as wings to carry us on in it.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: Men live by intervals of reason under the sovereignty of humor and passion.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: Great passions are incurable diseases.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.
general.author: cesare pavese

general.quote: It is pain that changes our lives.
general.author: steve martin

general.quote: Pain is less subject than pleasure to careless expression.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Nature has placed mankind under the government of two sovereign masters, pain and pleasure.
general.author: jeremy bentham

general.quote: There’s one way to find out if a man is honest — ask him. If he says, "Yes," you know he is a crook.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: An honest man’s word is as good as his bond.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Honest hearts produce honest actions.
general.author: brigham young

general.quote: With death comes honesty.
general.author: salman rushdie

general.quote: Luck is being ready for the chance.
general.author: j. frank doble

general.quote: Luck never made a man wise.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: The man who is intent on making the most of his opportunities is too busy to bother about luck.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: The amount of good luck coming your way depends on your willingness to act.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: It is better to be unfaithful than faithful without wanting to be.
general.author: brigitte bardot

general.quote: Camerado, I give you my hand; I give you my love more precious than money; I give you myself before preaching or law. Will you give me yourself?
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: Constancy… that small change of love, which people exact so rigidly, receive in such counterfeit coin, and repay in baser metal.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: Histories are more full of examples of the fidelity of dogs than of friends.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Jealousy is bred in doubts. When those doubts change into certainties, then the passion either ceases or turns absolute madness.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Jealousy would be far less torturous if we understood that love is a passion entirely unrelated to our merits.
general.author: paul eldridge

general.quote: Jealousy — that jumble of secret worship and ostensible aversion.
general.author: emil cioran

general.quote: Envy is a littleness of soul, which cannot see beyond a certain point, and if it does not occupy the whole space feels itself excluded.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.
general.author: margaret lee runbeck

general.quote: Happiness is distraction from the human tragedy.
general.author: j.m. reinoso

general.quote: Those who are not looking for happiness are the most likely to find it, because those who are searching forget that the surest way to be happy is to seek happiness for others.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: Unquestionably, it is possible to do without happiness; it is done involuntarily by nineteen-twentieths of mankind.
general.author: john stuart mill

general.quote: The secret of happiness is freedom, and the secret of freedom is courage.
general.author: thucydides

general.quote: You have been given freedom… to love and serve each other.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Freedom has its life in the hearts, the actions, the spirit of men and so it must be daily earned and refreshed – else like a flower cut from its life-giving roots, it will wither and die.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: No matter what a man does, he is not fully sane or human unless there is a spirit of freedom in him, a soul unconfined by purpose and larger than the practicable world.
general.author: charles horton cooley

general.quote: Confidence is a natural life force designed to overcome dark times.
general.author: sheenah hankin

general.quote: If you are prepared, then you are able to feel confident.
general.author: robert j. ringer

general.quote: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
general.author: lazarus long

general.quote: We have to serve ourselves many years before we gain our own confidence.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: I’m sorry my existence is not very noble or sublime.
general.author: keanu reeves

general.quote: If people are good only because they fear punishment, and hope for reward, then we are a sorry lot indeed.
general.author: albert einstein quotes

general.quote: We would often be sorry if our wishes were gratified.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Love means not ever having to say you’re sorry.
general.author: erich segal

general.quote: The ability to forgive is one of man’s greatest achievements."
general.author: bryant h. mcgill

general.quote: The first requisite for success is the ability to apply your physical and mental energies to one problem incessantly without growing weary."
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: My most brilliant achievement was my ability to be able to persuade my wife to marry me."
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: No amount of ability is of the slightest avail without honor."
general.author: andrew carnegie

general.quote: To suppose as we all suppose, that we could be rich and not behave as the rich behave, is like supposing that we could drink all day and stay sober.
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: Of all classes the rich are the most noticed and the least studied.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Riches have never fascinated me, unless combined with the greatest charm or distinction.
general.author: f.scott fitzgerald

general.quote: I have the greatest of all riches: that of not desiring them.
general.author: eleanora duse

general.quote: The blaze of reputation cannot be blown out, but it often dies in the socket; a very few names may be considered as perpetual lamps that shine unconsumed.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A reputation for a thousand years may depend upon the conduct of a single moment.
general.author: ernest bramah

general.quote: An eminent reputation is as dangerous as a bad one.
general.author: tacitus

general.quote: At ev’ry word a reputation dies.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: The engine which drives enterprise is not thrift, but profit.
general.author: john maynard keynes

general.quote: If you count all your assets you always show a profit.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature’s delight.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Profits are like breathing. You have to have them. But who would stay alive just to breathe?
general.author: maurice mascaranhas

general.quote: When one has a great deal to put into it a day has a hundred pockets.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Since the governments are in the pockets of businesses, who’s going to control this most powerful institution? Business is more powerful than politics, and it’s more powerful than religion. So it’s going to have to be the vigilante consumer.
general.author: anita roddick

general.quote: We carry around computers in our pockets. Many people barely use them as phones. We use them as computers. If you think about the future, when you’re traveling around, it’s great to have a lightweight, small form factor.
general.author: mitchell baker

general.quote: If workers have less money in their pockets to put food on the table, they will be spending less money; your economy will suffer.
general.author: martin o’malley

general.quote: Boldness is business is the first, second, and third thing.
general.author: h.g bohn

general.quote: It’s better to take over and build upon an existing business than to start a new one.
general.author: harold s. geneen

general.quote: The first rule of any technology used in a business is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency. The second is that automation applied to an inefficient operation will magnify the inefficiency.
general.author: bill gates

general.quote: Business opportunities are like buses, there’s always another one coming.
general.author: richard branson

general.quote: Better a lean agreement than a fat lawsuit.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: No two on earth in all things can agree. All have some daring singularity.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Don’t agree and believe that success comes free… Gold on the floor is a lie! You must dig deep and then you will reap big!
general.author: israelmore ayivor

general.quote: On one issue at least, men and women agree; they both distrust women.
general.author: h. l. mencken

general.quote: Wisdom doesn’t necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
general.author: tom wilson

general.quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
general.author: david star jordan

general.quote: Wisdom is like electricity. There is no permanently wise man, but men capable of wisdom, who, being put into certain company, or other favorable conditions, become wise for a short time, as glasses rubbed acquire electric power for a while.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: The growth of wisdom may be gauged exactly by the diminution of ill temper.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Instructors should not only be skilful in those sciences which they teach, but have skill in the method of teaching, and patience in the practice.
general.author: isaac watts

general.quote: The world of knowledge takes a crazy turn when teachers themselves are taught to learn.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: Experience is the worst teacher; it gives the test before presenting the lesson.
general.author: vernon s. law

general.quote: No one ever teaches well who wants to teach, or governs well who wants to govern.
general.author: plato

general.quote: I like to get my hands dirty. Talk is cheap.
general.author: chen guangbiao

general.quote: I do do a lot of talking, because it saves me listening.
general.author: david hockney

general.quote: As a man sow, shall he reap. and I know that talk is cheap. But the heat of the battle is as sweet as the victory.
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: Anybody who thinks talk is cheap should get some legal advice.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: Stupidity combined with arrogance and a huge ego will get you a long way.
general.author: chris lowe

general.quote: To be clever enough to get all the money, one must be stupid enough to want it.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: It is so pleasant to come across people more stupid than ourselves. We love them at once for being so.
general.author: jerome k. jerome

general.quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Name is a fence and within it you are nameless.
general.author: samuli paronen

general.quote: I would rather make my name than inherit it.
general.author: william m thackeray

general.quote: People’s fates are simplified by their names.
general.author: elias canetti

general.quote: To live in mankind is far more than to live in a name.
general.author: vachel lindsay

general.quote: Curiosity is one of the permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous mind.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Satisfaction of one’s curiosity is one of the greatest sources of happiness in life.
general.author: linus pauling

general.quote: Each story we approach in the same way, with curiosity and interest and determination to get behind the image.
general.author: martin bashir

general.quote: Curiosity begins as an act of tearing to pieces or analysis.
general.author: samuel alexander

general.quote: When the newspapers have got nothing else to talk about, they cut loose on the young. The young are always news. If they are up to something, that’s news. If they aren’t, that’s news too.
general.author: kenneth rexroth

general.quote: We live under a government of men and morning newspapers.
general.author: wendell phillips

general.quote: People everywhere confuse what they read in newspapers with news.
general.author: a.j. liebling

general.quote: One little person, giving all of her time to peace, makes news. Many people, giving some of their time, can make history.
general.author: peace pilgrim

general.quote: Only a weak mind seeks ultimate answers.
general.author: agnes thornton

general.quote: He who knows all the answers has not yet been asked all the questions.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Too often we give children answers to remember rather than problems to solve.
general.author: roger lewin

general.quote: Judge a person by their questions, rather than their answers.
general.author: voltaire qoutes

general.quote: Tears mess up your makeup.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: Oh, I am very weary, though tears no longer flow; my eyes are tired of weeping, my heart is sick of woe.
general.author: anne bronte

general.quote: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears.
general.author: john vance cheney

general.quote: Tears are the noble language of the eye.
general.author: robert herrick

general.quote: It is wise for us to forget our troubles, there are always new ones to replace them.
general.author: brigham young

general.quote: The art of living lies not in eliminating but in growing with troubles.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: Whether planned or not, humor takes our mind off of our troubles.
general.author: allen klein

general.quote: Never complain about your troubles; they are responsible for more than half of your income.
general.author: robert r. updegraff

general.quote: Tears mess up your makeup.
general.author: julia child

general.quote: Oh, I am very weary, though tears no longer flow; my eyes are tired of weeping, my heart is sick of woe.
general.author: anne bronte

general.quote: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears.
general.author: john vance cheney

general.quote: Tears are the noble language of the eye.
general.author: robert herrick

general.quote: Who will not suffer labor in this world, let him not be born.
general.author: john florio

general.quote: Thank God for a few free waves.
general.author: miki dora

general.quote: The tragedy of life is not so much what men suffer, but rather what they miss.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: Yesterday I lived, today I suffer, tomorrow I die; but I still think fondly, today and tomorrow, of yesterday.
general.author: gotthold lessing

general.quote: We ought to fear a man who hates himself, for we are at risk of becoming victims of his anger and revenge. Let us then try to lure him into self-love.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: You will find that silence or very gentle words are the most exquisite revenge for insult.
general.author: judge hall

general.quote: The indulgence of revenge tends to make men more savage and cruel.
general.author: henry home

general.quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more a man’s nature runs to, the more ought law to weed it out.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: A mind enclosed in language is in prison.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: Prisons are built with stones of Law, Brothels with bricks of Religion.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Two men look out the same prison bars; one sees mud and the other stars.
general.author: frederick langbridge

general.quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: We don’t make mistakes, we only have happy accidents.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: You make mistakes. Mistakes don’t make you.
general.author: maxwell maltz

general.quote: Nobody’s perfect. Even the most successful people make serious mistakes.
general.author: travis bradberry

general.quote: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
general.author: phyllis theroux

general.quote: No one ever discovers the depths of his own loneliness.
general.author: georges bernanos

general.quote: When so many are lonely as seem to be lonely, it would be inexcusably selfish to be lonely alone.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: The surest cure for vanity is loneliness.
general.author: thomas wolfe

general.quote: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you’re alone with.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: Every failure teaches a man something if he will learn.
general.author: charles dickens

general.quote: Failure changes for the better, success for the worse.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: One who fears failure limits his activities.
general.author: henry ford quotes

general.quote: Failures to heroic minds are the stepping stones to success.
general.author: thomas c. haliburton

general.quote: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: I was never less alone than when by myself.
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: Every man must do two things alone; he must do his own believing and his own dying.
general.author: martin luther

general.quote: I don’t want to be alone; I want to be left alone.
general.author: audrey hepburn

general.quote: Many children appear graceful enough until they begin to learn to dance.
general.author: s. t. coleridge

general.quote: Don’t sing for me, dance for me.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Dancing is wonderful training for girls, it’s the first way you learn to guess what a man is going to do before he does it.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: A perpendicular expression of a horizontal desire.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: There is no gambling like politics. Nothing in which the power of circumstance is more evident.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: The gambler is more wicked as he is a greater proficient in his art.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: I do not have a problem, I enjoy gambling, but I think people are trying to make it seem like I have a problem, because people really don’t know.
general.author: michael jordan

general.quote: A gambler is nothing but a man who makes his living out of hope.
general.author: william bolitho

general.quote: Life is God’s joke on us. It’s our mission to figure out the punch line.
general.author: john guarrine

general.quote: If you want anything done well, do it yourself. This is why most people laugh at their own jokes.
general.author: bob edwards

general.quote: Were it not for my little jokes, I could not bear the burdens of this office.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: I hope life isn’t a big joke, because I don’t get it.
general.author: jack handey

general.quote: Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.
general.author: plato

general.quote: I think music in itself is healing. It’s an explosive expression of humanity. It’s something we are all touched by. No matter what culture we’re from, everyone loves music.
general.author: billy joel

general.quote: You don’t need any brains to listen to music.
general.author: luciano pavarotti

general.quote: The pleasure we feel in music springs from the obedience which is in it.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Swans sing before they die — t’were no bad thing did certain persons die before they sing.
general.author: samuel taylor coleridge

general.quote: I sing like I feel.
general.author: ella fitzgerald

general.quote: The total person sings not just the vocal chords.
general.author: esther broner

general.quote: This is a fault common to all singers, that among their friends they will never sing when they are asked; unasked, they will never desist.
general.author: horace

general.quote: If faith without works is dead, willingness without action is fantasy.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Action is the only reality; not only reality, but morality as well.
general.author: abbie hoffman

general.quote: We are taught by great actions that the universe is the property of every individual in it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Action is eloquence.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: Competition is not only the basis of protection to the consumer, but is the incentive to progress.
general.author: herbert hoover

general.quote: All you have to do is play better than the other guy and things go well. If you don’t play better than the other players then somebody takes your place. Now a lot of guys, in this day and time with the transient nature of the sport, as soon as the competition gets too good, they want out.
general.author: bill parcells

general.quote: Slow but steady wins the race.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: Competition is the spice of sports; but if you make spice the whole meal you’ll be sick.
general.author: george leonard

general.quote: Whether you be man or woman you will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Courage is the virtue which champions the cause of right.
general.author: marcus t. cicero

general.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
general.author: walt disney

general.quote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
general.author: amelia earhart

general.quote: Perhaps the best definition of progress would be the continuing efforts of men and women to narrow the gap between the convenience of the powers that be and the unwritten charter.
general.author: nadine gordimer

general.quote: One is happy as a result of one’s own efforts — once one knows the necessary ingredients of happiness — simple tastes, a certain degree of courage, self-denial to a point, love of work, and, above all, a clear conscience.
general.author: george sand

general.quote: So get a few laughs and do the best you can.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: Men are convinced of your arguments, your sincerity, and the seriousness of your efforts only by your death.
general.author: albert camus quotes

general.quote: Goals are dreams with deadlines.
general.author: diana scharf hunt

general.quote: Success as I see it is a result, not a goal.
general.author: gustave flaubert

general.quote: A good system shortens the road to the goal.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Far away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
general.author: theodore roosevelt

general.quote: Hard work never hurt anyone who hired someone else to do it.
general.author: evan esar

general.quote: How hard you work matters more than how much you make.
general.author: michelle obama

general.quote: If you care about what you do and work hard at it, there isn’t anything you can’t do if you want to.
general.author: jim henson

general.quote: Opportunities multiply as they are seized; they die when neglected.
general.author: john wicker

general.quote: Opportunity dances with those who are ready on the dance floor.
general.author: h. jackson brown jr.

general.quote: A good opportunity is seldom presented, and is easily lost.
general.author: syrus

general.quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: It’s not the plan that is important, it’s the planning.
general.author: graeme edwards

general.quote: An intelligent plan is the first step to success. The man who plans knows where he is going, knows what progress he is making and has a pretty good idea when he will arrive.
general.author: basil s walsh

general.quote: Planning is bringing the future into the present so that you can do something about it now.
general.author: alan lakein

general.quote: Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
general.author: vince lombardi

general.quote: You’re never a loser until you quit trying.
general.author: mike ditka

general.quote: Self-confidence is the result of a successfully survived risk.
general.author: jack gibb

general.quote: If we do not succeed, then we run the risk of failure.
general.author: dan quayle

general.quote: If you’re not a risk taker, you should get the hell out of business.
general.author: ray kroc

general.quote: Everything is sweetened by risk.
general.author: alexander smith

general.quote: Rest satisfied with doing well, and leave others to talk of you as they please.
general.author: pythagoras

general.quote: Better a little which is well done, than a great deal imperfectly.
general.author: plato

general.quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The reward for work well done is the opportunity to do more.
general.author: dr. jonas salk

general.quote: If you want to make beautiful music, you must play the black and the white notes together.
general.author: richard m.nixon

general.quote: We are one, after all, you and I. Together we suffer, together exist, and forever will recreate each other.
general.author: pierre teilhard de chardin

general.quote: That is what our educational system has to encourage. It has to foster the social goals of living together, and working together, for the common good.
general.author: julius kambarge nyerere

general.quote: We cannot be separated in interest or divided in purpose. We stand together until the end.
general.author: woodrow t.wilson

general.quote: One test of strength is the ability to take defeat graciously.
general.author: lewise korns

general.quote: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: The strong are God’s natural protectors of the weak.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Our strength is often composed of the weakness we’re damned if we’re going to show.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: We confide in our strength, without boasting of it; we respect that of others, without fearing it.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
general.author: henrik ibsen

general.quote: He sends a cross, but He also sends the strength to bear it.
general.author: leo s tolstoy

general.quote: Few men during their lifetime come anywhere near exhausting the resources dwelling within them. There are deep wells of strength that are never used.
general.author: richard btrd

general.quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: The strongest may have need of more strength.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: Strength comes from solitude, a waiting, a communion with the best in us, which is at one with the divine spark.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Strengthen me by sympathizing with my strength, not my weakness.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: It does not take much strength to do things, but it requires great strength to decide what to do.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
general.author: woodrow t. wilson

general.quote: The greatest strength expires with loss of breath; the mightiest in one minute stoop to death.
general.author: thomas dekker

general.quote: People do not lack strength; they lack will.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Only actions give life strength; only moderation gives it charm.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Cunning is better than strength.
general.author: bahamian

general.quote: You really have to look inside yourself and find your own inner strength, and say, "I’m proud of what I am and who I am, and I’m just going to be myself.
general.author: mariah carey

general.quote: Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power…
general.author: tao te ching

general.quote: Strength is an empty shell.
general.author: jack london

general.quote: Consciousness of our strength increases it.
general.author: lucde claoiers

general.quote: The hand of the aggressor is stayed by strength–and strength alone.
general.author: dwight eisenhower

general.quote: Charm is a woman’s strength just as strength is a man’s charm.
general.author: havelock ellis

general.quote: We acquire the strength we have overcome.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Never be afraid to expose a weakness in yourself. Exposing a weakness is the beginning of strength.
general.author: robert anthony

general.quote: Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: We do not have to become heroes overnight. Just a step at a time, meeting each thing that comes up … discovering we have the strength to stare it down.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: That which does not kill me makes me stronger.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: As long as I fear my weakness, I am stronger than when I trust my strength.
general.author: ivan panin

general.quote: Oh, it is excellent to have a giant’s strength, but it is tyrannous to use it like a giant.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: If we are strong, our strength will speak for itself. If we are weak, words will be of no help.
general.author: john kennedy

general.quote: As our heart summons our strength, our wisdom must direct it.
general.author: dwight eisenhower

general.quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: Strength, if not used to protect, is but weakness.
general.author: lewise korns

general.quote: My strength is as the strength of ten, because my heart is pure.
general.author: alfred tennyson

general.quote: Endurance is nobler than strength and patience than beauty.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: Credulity is the man’s weakness, but the child’s strength.
general.author: charles lamb

general.quote: It is not when the cable lies coiled up on the deck that you know how strong or how weak it is; it is when it is put to the test.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: No man is infinitely strong; for every creature that runs, flies, hops or crawls there is a terminal nemesis which he will not circumvent, which will finally do him in.
general.author: philip dick

general.quote: Real strength never impairs beauty of harmony, but it often bestows it; and in everything imposingly beautiful, strength has much to do with the magic.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: No one can read with profit that which he cannot learn to read with pleasure.
general.author: thomas hardy

general.quote: The investor of today does not profit from yesterday’s growth.
general.author: warren buffett

general.quote: The loss which is unknown is no loss at all.
general.author: syrus (publilius syrus)

general.quote: Corporation: An ingenious device for obtaining profit without individual responsibility.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Don’t be seduced into thinking that that which does not make a profit is without value.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: For what shall it profit a man, if he gain the whole world, and suffer the loss of his soul?
general.author: jesus christ

general.quote: In the state of nature profit is the measure of right.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: Take every gain without showing remorse about missed profits, because an eel may escape sooner than you think.
general.author: lope de vega

general.quote: When profit is unshared it’s less likely to grow greater.
general.author: malcolm s. forbes

general.quote: A person is born with a liking for profit.
general.author: xun zi

general.quote: The art of losing isn’t hard to master; so many things seem filled with the intent to be lost that their loss is no disaster.
general.author: elizabeth bishop

general.quote: There can be no rise in the value of labour without a fall of profits.
general.author: david ricardo

general.quote: Nothing that grieves us can be called little: by the eternal laws of proportion a child’s loss of a doll and a king’s loss of a crown are events of the same size.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Wise men never sit and wail their loss, but cheerily seek how to redress their harms.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: No man can lose what he never had.
general.author: izaak walton

general.quote: Nothing profits more than self-esteem, grounded on what is just and right.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Profit is not the legitimate purpose of business. The legitimate purpose of business is to provide a product or service that people need and do it so well that it’s profitable.
general.author: james rouse

general.quote: Take care to sell your horse before he dies. The art of life is passing losses on.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: For small business people, less paperwork means higher profits, boosted sales and more time with the family.
general.author: tony abbott

general.quote: Profit is sweet, even if it comes from deception.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: No wise person should make known the loss of fortune, any malpractice in their house, his being cheated, or having been disgraced.
general.author: hitopadesa

general.quote: Giving yourself permission to lose guarantees a loss.
general.author: pat riley

general.quote: That is a good book which is opened with expectation, and closed with delight and profit.
general.author: amos bronson alcott

general.quote: It takes nearly as much ability to know how to profit by good advice as to know how to act for one’s self.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: The best way to guarantee a loss is to quit.
general.author: morgan freeman

general.quote: War against a foreign country only happens when the moneyed classes think they are going to profit from it.
general.author: george orwell

general.quote: Too many people think only of their own profit. but business opportunity seldom knocks on the door of self-centered people. no customer ever goes to a store merely to please the storekeeper.
general.author: kazuo inamori

general.quote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.
general.author: w. edwards deming

general.quote: To win you have to risk loss.
general.author: jean-claude killy

general.quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: No matter how hard the loss, defeat might serve as well as victory to shake the soul and let the glory out.
general.author: al gore

general.quote: What does it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses his own soul?
general.author: robert fulghum

general.quote: A business absolutely devoted to service will have only one worry about profits. They will be embarrassingly large.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.
general.author: dale carnegie

general.quote: There is nothing the body suffers the soul may not profit by.
general.author: george meredith

general.quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts… perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
general.author: john steinbeck

general.quote: Know how to listen, and you will profit even from those who talk badly.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: The best plan is to profit by the folly of others.
general.author: pliny the elder

general.quote: Talk is by far the most accessible of pleasures. It costs nothing in money, it is all profit, it completes our education, founds and fosters our friendships, and can be enjoyed at any age and in almost any state of health.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: Prefer a loss to a dishonest gain; the one brings pain at the moment, the other for all time.
general.author: chilon

general.quote: The more illegal a profit, the more tenaciously a man clings to it.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: Many receive advice, only the wise profit from it.
general.author: harper lee

general.quote: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: Poets wish to profit or to please.
general.author: horace

general.quote: Sometimes a loss is the best thing that can happen. It teaches you what you should have done next time.
general.author: snoop dogg

general.quote: Profitability doesn’t happen when you’re walking on bullshit.
general.author: jerry martin

general.quote: Nobody ever lost money taking a profit.
general.author: bernard baruch

general.quote: Take all the fools out of this world and there wouldn’t be any fun living in it, or profit.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: One who works for his own profit is likely to work hard. One who works for the use of others, without profit to himself, is likely not to work any harder than he must.
general.author: b. carroll reece

general.quote: When morality comes up against profit, it is seldom that profit loses.
general.author: shirley chisholm

general.quote: If you open up the mind, the opportunity to address both profits and social conditions are limitless. It’s a process of innovation.
general.author: jerry greenfield

general.quote: Life is divided into three terms – that which was, which is, and which will be. Let us learn from the past to profit by the present, and from the present to live better in the future.
general.author: william wordsworth

general.quote: Make every thought, every fact, that comes into your mind pay you a profit. Make it work and produce for you. Think of things not as they are but as they might be. Don’t merely dream – but create!
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Profits on the exchange are the treasures of goblins. At one time they may be carbuncle stones, then coals, then diamonds, then flint stones, then morning dew, then tears.
general.author: lope de vega

general.quote: Remind people that profit is the difference between revenue and expense. This makes you look smart.
general.author: scott adams

general.quote: Profit and morality are a hard combination to beat.
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: The worst crime against working people is a company which fails to operate at a profit.
general.author: samuel gompers

general.quote: Where is the good in goodbye?
general.author: meredith willson

general.quote: Never part without loving words to think of during your absence. It may be that you will not meet again in this life.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Why does it take a minute to say hello and forever to say goodbye?
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: We only part to meet again.
general.author: john gay

general.quote: Goodbye, goodbye, I hate the word. Solitude has long since turned brown and withered, sitting bitter in my mouth and heavy in my veins.
general.author: r.m. grenon

general.quote: Until we meet again, may the good Lord take a liking to you."
general.author: roy rogers

general.quote: The return makes one love the farewell.
general.author: alfred de musset

general.quote: See you later, alligator. After a while, crocodile.
general.author: bill haley

general.quote: It’s time to say goodbye, but I think goodbyes are sad and I’d much rather say hello. Hello to a new adventure.
general.author: ernie harwell

general.quote: Don’t be dismayed at goodbyes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetime, is certain for those who are friends.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: A goodbye isn’t painful unless you’re never going to say hello again.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Be well, do good work, and keep in touch.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: Farewell! "But not for ever.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Absent in body, but present in spirit.
general.author: saint paul

general.quote: Goodbye. I am leaving because I am bored."
general.author: george saunders

general.quote: Unless one says goodbye to what one loves, and unless one travels to completely new territories, one can expect merely a long wearing away of oneself and an eventual extinction.
general.author: jean dubuffet

general.quote: Never say goodbye, say farewell."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The joy of meeting pays the pangs of absence; else who could bear it?
general.author: nicholas rowe

general.quote: Farewell! God knows when we shall meet again.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.
general.author: nicholas sparks

general.quote: If I had a single flower for every time I think of you, I could walk forever in my garden.
general.author: claudia adrienne grandi

general.quote: Good night, good night! Parting is such sweet sorrow – That I shall say good night till it be morrow.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: History never really says goodbye. History says, ‘See you later.’
general.author: eduardo galeano

general.quote: And by and by, will there come a time, when souls congenial will no more say adieu?
general.author: adelaide billet dufresnoy

general.quote: You and I will meet again, When we’re least expecting it, One day in some far off place, I will recognize your face, I won’t say goodbye my friend, For you and I will meet again.
general.author: tom petty

general.quote: Promise me you’ll never forget me because if I thought you would I’d never leave.
general.author: a.a. milne

general.quote: Man’s feelings are always purest and most glowing in the hour of meeting and of farewell.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Saying goodbye doesn’t mean anything. It’s the time we spent together that matters, not how we left it."
general.author: trey parker

general.quote: Parting is all we know of heaven and all we need of hell."
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Someone would leave. Someone always leaves. Then we would have to say good-bye. I hate good-byes. I know what I need. I need more hellos.
general.author: charles m. schulz

general.quote: How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard.
general.author: carol sobieski and thomas meehan

general.quote: Every parting is a form of death, as every reunion is a type of heaven.
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: Beware of parting! The true sadness is not in the pain of the parting; it is in the when and the how you are to meet again with the face about to vanish from your view.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Only in the agony of parting do we look into the depths of love.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: That farewell kiss which resembles greeting, that last glance of love which becomes the sharpest pang of sorrow."
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: A memory lasts forever, never does it die. True friends stay together and never said goodbye."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Nothing is lost yet, nothing broken, and yet the cold blue word is spoken: say goodbye now to the Sun, the days of love and leaves are done."
general.author: r.p.t. coffin

general.quote: Farewell, dearest friend, never to see one another any more till at the right hand of Christ."
general.author: donald cargill

general.quote: Sweets to the sweet: farewell!
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Good-byes breed a sort of distaste for whomever you say good-bye to; this hurts, you feel, this must not happen again.
general.author: elizabeth bowen

general.quote: Painful though parting be, I bow to you as I see you off to distant clouds.
general.author: emperor saga

general.quote: So we are not saying goodbye forever, … We are saying we will see you later."
general.author: john cross

general.quote: I hate the part of the show where we have to say goodbye to someone."
general.author: ant mcpartlin

general.quote: The story of life is quicker then the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye."
general.author: jimi hendrix

general.quote: Love is missing someone whenever you’re apart, but somehow feeling warm inside because you’re close in heart.
general.author: kay knudsen

general.quote: Every farewell combines loss and new freedom.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: Don’t be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: There is such sweet pain in parting that I could hang forever on thine arms, and look away my life into thine eyes.
general.author: thomas otway

general.quote: Welcome ever smiles, and farewell goes out sighing."
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Those to whom we say farewell, are welcomed by others."
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The happy never say, and never hear said, farewell.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: And soon, too soon, we part with pain, To sail o’er silent seas again.
general.author: thomas moore

general.quote: Saying goodbye doesn’t mean anything. It’s the time we spent together that matters, not how we left it.
general.author: trey parker

general.quote: That bitter word, which closed all earthly friendships and finished every feast of love farewell!
general.author: robert pollok

general.quote: All I know is, I pass people on the street these days, and they don’t know whether to say hello or to say goodbye."
general.author: billy martin

general.quote: If you ask me something and you don’t hear from me, I’ve dozed off, and I’m gone, so just say goodbye."
general.author: neal mccoy

general.quote: Can miles truly separate you from friends…. If you want to be with someone you love, aren’t you already there?
general.author: richard bach

general.quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Some folks are wise and some are otherwise.
general.author: tobias smollett

general.quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool..
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Travel makes a wise man better, and a fool worse.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: The wise man says it cannot be done, but the fool goes and does it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The beginning of wisdom is the knowledge of folly.
general.author: norman macdonald

general.quote: The wise man questions the wisdom of others because he questions his own, the foolish man, because it is different from his own.
general.author: leo stein

general.quote: A wise man may look ridiculous in the company of fools.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: When wisdom leaves the house folly enters it.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: He dares to be a fool, and that is the first step in the direction of wisdom.
general.author: james gibbons huneker

general.quote: The mistakes of the fool are known to the world, but not to himself. The mistakes of the wise man are known to himself, but not to the world.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: It takes a wise man to handle a lie; a fool had better remain honest.
general.author: norman douglas

general.quote: If wisdom were on sale in the open market, the stupid would not even ask the price.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Wisdom is often counted folly by the unwise.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: A wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: A wise man can see more from the bottom of a well than a fool can from a mountain top.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Few things are necessary to make the wise man happy while no amount of material wealth would satisfy a fool.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: A man remains ignorant because he loves ignorance, and chooses ignorant thoughts; a man becomes wise because he loves wisdom and chooses wise thoughts.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: He that walks with wise men shall be wise, but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
general.author: bible

general.quote: A wise man fights to win, but he is twice a fool who has no plan for possible defeat.
general.author: louis l’amour

general.quote: Home is the place, where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: No matter how dreary and gray our homes are, we people of flesh and blood would rather live there than in any other country, be it ever so beautiful. There is no place like home.
general.author: l. frank baum

general.quote: For too many people, coming home is like arriving at a second job. With all the chores to do, bills to pay, mail to answer, e-mail to answer, and the rest, home can seem more like a pit stop than a sanctuary.
general.author: victoria moran

general.quote: Home is like a bee-hive; there may be much toil, there must be much order, but there will always be a honeyed sweetness.
general.author: ebenezer coloham brewer

general.quote: Money will buy a bed but not sleep; books but not brains; food but not appetite; finery but not beauty; a house but not a home; medicine but not health; luxuries but not culture; amusements but not happiness; religion but not salvation; a passport to everywhere but heaven.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Home is the place where you are most thoroughly yourself, with no pretenses.
general.author: victoria moran

general.quote: He is the happiest, be he king or peasant, who finds peace in his home.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Where we love is home, Home that our feet may leave, but not our hearts.
general.author: oliver wendell holmes

general.quote: A man’s home may seem to be his castle on the outside; inside, it is more often his nursery.
general.author: clare boothe luce

general.quote: The home to everyone is to him his castle and fortress, as well for his defence against injury and violence, as for his repose.
general.author: lord edward coke

general.quote: Home is like a house inside your head where your thoughts gather.
general.author: marcus eriksen

general.quote: Home makes the man.
general.author: samuel smiles

general.quote: Home is a shelter from storms — all sorts of storms.
general.author: william j. bennett

general.quote: Home, in one form or another, is the great object of life.
general.author: josiah gilbert holland

general.quote: Home is where you can say anything you like cause nobody listens to you anyway.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Home is the seminary of all other institutions. There are the roots of all public prosperity, the foundations of the State, the germs of the church. There is all that in the child makes the future man; all that in the man makes the good citizen.
general.author: e. h. chapin

general.quote: The first indication of domestic happiness is the love of one’s home.
general.author: francois dominique reynaud de comte de montlosier

general.quote: If you know you’re going home, the journey is never too hard.
general.author: angela wood

general.quote: A home is like a nest–it’s only useful for so long.
general.author: david lynch

general.quote: Home is where the heart can laugh without shyness. Home is where the heart’s tears can dry at their own pace.
general.author: vernon baker

general.quote: To be happy at home is the ultimate result of all ambition; the end to which every enterprise and labor tends, and of which every desire prompts the prosecution.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Home is where the heart is.
general.author: joseph c. neal

general.quote: Home is a place you grow up wanting to leave, and grow old wanting to get back to.
general.author: john ed pearce

general.quote: You can never go home again, but the truth is you can never leave home, so it’s all right.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: The light is what guides you home, the warmth is what keeps you there.
general.author: ellie rodriguez

general.quote: Any old place I can hang my hat is home sweet home to me.
general.author: william jerome

general.quote: Home is the girl’s prison and the woman’s workhouse.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: "Home" is any four walls that enclose the right person.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: The three most important factors in buying a home are, location, location, location!
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To live is to go on a journey; to die is to come back home.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Home is not where you live but where they understand you.
general.author: christian morgenstern

general.quote: It takes hands to build a house, but only hearts can build a home.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: Missing someone gets easier every day because even though it’s one day further from the last time you saw each other, it’s one day closer to the next time you will.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Adieu! I have too grieved a heart to take a tedious leave.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: If I leave here tomorrow, will you still remember me?
general.author: allen collins & ronnie van zant

general.quote: A man never knows how to say goodbye; a woman never knows when to say it.
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: The engine which drives enterprise is not thrift, but profit.
general.author: john maynard keynes

general.quote: If you count all your assets you always show a profit.
general.author: wilson mizner

general.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature’s delight.
general.author: marcus aurelius

general.quote: Profits are like breathing. You have to have them. But who would stay alive just to breathe?
general.author: maurice mascaranhas

general.quote: Some folks are wise and some are otherwise.
general.author: tobias smollett

general.quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool..
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Travel makes a wise man better, and a fool worse.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: The wise man says it cannot be done, but the fool goes and does it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The beginning of wisdom is the knowledge of folly.
general.author: norman macdonald

general.quote: The wise man questions the wisdom of others because he questions his own, the foolish man, because it is different from his own.
general.author: leo stein

general.quote: A wise man may look ridiculous in the company of fools.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: When wisdom leaves the house folly enters it.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: He dares to be a fool, and that is the first step in the direction of wisdom.
general.author: james gibbons huneker

general.quote: The mistakes of the fool are known to the world, but not to himself. The mistakes of the wise man are known to himself, but not to the world.
general.author: charles caleb colton

general.quote: It takes a wise man to handle a lie; a fool had better remain honest.
general.author: norman douglas

general.quote: If wisdom were on sale in the open market, the stupid would not even ask the price.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Wisdom is often counted folly by the unwise.
general.author: edward counsel

general.quote: A wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: A wise man can see more from the bottom of a well than a fool can from a mountain top.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Few things are necessary to make the wise man happy while no amount of material wealth would satisfy a fool.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: A man remains ignorant because he loves ignorance, and chooses ignorant thoughts; a man becomes wise because he loves wisdom and chooses wise thoughts.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: He that walks with wise men shall be wise, but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
general.author: bible

general.quote: A wise man fights to win, but he is twice a fool who has no plan for possible defeat.
general.author: louis l’amour

general.quote: Sooner or later, we will have to recognize that the Earth has rights, too, to live without pollution. What mankind must know is that human beings cannot live without Mother Earth, but the planet can live without humans.
general.author: evo morales

general.quote: Sooner or later, false thinking brings wrong conduct.
general.author: julian s. huxley

general.quote: We are no longer happy so soon as we wish to be happier.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: We must welcome the future, remembering that soon it will be the past; and we must respect the past, remembering that it was once all that was humanly possible.
general.author: george santayana

general.quote: Sooner or later all the people of the world will have to discover a way to live together in peace.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: Always do your best. what you plant now, you will harvest later.
general.author: og mandino

general.quote: When life is too easy for us, we must beware or we may not be ready to meet the blows which sooner or later come to everyone, rich or poor.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Sooner or later you’ve heard all your best friends have to say. Then comes the tolerance of real love.
general.author: ned rorem

general.quote: If a man or woman is born ten years sooner or later, their whole aspect and performance shall be different.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: If one tells the truth, one is sure, sooner or later, to be found out.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: Look to the past and remember no empire rises that sooner or later won’t fall.
general.author: al stewart

general.quote: Everybody sooner or later has to drop the luggage and the baggage of illusions.
general.author: carlos santana

general.quote: Sooner or later I’m going to die, but I’m not going to retire.
general.author: margaret mead

general.quote: I never think of the future – it comes soon enough.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
general.author: paul tournier

general.quote: The business that considers itself immune to the necessity for advertising sooner or later finds itself immune to business.
general.author: derby brown

general.quote: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Everything happens to everybody sooner or later if there is time enough.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Politics will sooner or later make fools of everybody.
general.author: dick armey

general.quote: Sooner or later everyone sits down to a banquet of consequences.
general.author: robert louis stevenson

general.quote: Since we must all die sooner or later, let us enjoy life while we can!
general.author: otoma no tabito

general.quote: Sooner or later we all discover that the important moments in life are not the advertised ones, not the birthdays, the graduations, the weddings, not the great goals achieved. the real milestones are less.
general.author: susan b. anthony

general.quote: Sooner or later, I hate to break it to you, you’re gonna die, so how do you fill in the space between here and there? It’s yours. Seize your space.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: Sooner or later comes a crisis in our affairs, and how we meet it determines our future happiness and success.
general.author: robert collier

general.quote: People who cannot find time for recreation are obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.
general.author: john wanamaker

general.quote: Socialism is like a dream. Sooner or later you wake up to reality.
general.author: winston churchill

general.quote: Sooner or later we’ve all got to confront the reality that we have got to come to understand who we are and what we’re doing, and the extent to which we are guided or manipulated by forces that are beyond our control.
general.author: ayad akhtar

general.quote: I believe success is preparation, because opportunity is going to knock on your door sooner or later but are you prepared to answer that?
general.author: omar epps

general.quote: Let the world know you as you are, not as you think you should be, because sooner or later, if you are posing, you will forget the pose, and then where are you?
general.author: fanny brice

general.quote: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.
general.author: james allen

general.quote: Life’s tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: If you are going to try and hide something, sooner or later people are going to find out.
general.author: lou ferrigno

general.quote: Sooner or later, man has always had to decide whether he worships his own power or the power of God.
general.author: arnold j. toynbee

general.quote: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Getting fired is what happens to a manager sooner or later.
general.author: joe torre

general.quote: Sooner or later all the people of the world will have to discover a way to live together in peace.
general.author: martin luther king, jr.

general.quote: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always come around to where you started again.
general.author: stephen king

general.quote: There are three things which the public will always clamor for, sooner or later: namely, novelty, novelty, novelty.
general.author: thomas hood

general.quote: If you really have something to say, sooner or later it will be heard. And if you’re lucky you’ll still be alive.
general.author: marilyn minter

general.quote: Sooner or later all the people of the world will have to discover a way to live together in peace, and thereby transform this pending cosmic elegy into a creative psalm of brotherhood.
general.author: martin luther king

general.quote: You could cover the whole earth with asphalt, but sooner or later green grass would break through.
general.author: ilya ehrenburg

general.quote: Sooner or later that which is now life shall be poetry, and every fair and manly trait shall add a richer strain to the song.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The weariest night, the longest day, sooner or later must perforce come to an end.
general.author: baroness orczy

general.quote: People may live as much retired from the world as they like, but sooner or later they find themselves debtor or creditor to someone.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: If you step on people in this life, you’re going to come back as a cockroach.
general.author: willie davis

general.quote: Grief comes and goes, but depression is unremitting.
general.author: kay redfield jamison

general.quote: Joy comes, grief goes, we know not how.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: When the heroes go off the stage, the clowns come on.
general.author: heinrich heine

general.quote: I think fame can come and go.
general.author: ashley tisdale

general.quote: Time will pass and seasons will come and go.
general.author: roy bean

general.quote: If you’re going to go through hell… I suggest you come back learning something.
general.author: drew barrymore

general.quote: I have always believed that what goes around comes around.
general.author: rajeev shukla

general.quote: Family and God – that is what’s important. Money, cars, those are things that come and go.
general.author: fabrice muamba

general.quote: Technical problems are like gremlins. They come and go.
general.author: eric fellner

general.quote: Boredom, anger, sadness, or fear are not ‘yours,’ not personal. They are conditions of the human mind. They come and go. Nothing that comes and goes is you.
general.author: eckhart tolle

general.quote: Friends come and go but enemies accumulate.
general.author: arthur bloch

general.quote: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: Begin at the beginning and go on till you come to the end; then stop.
general.author: lewis carroll

general.quote: What goes up must come down.
general.author: isaac newton

general.quote: Presidents come and go, but the Supreme Court goes on forever.
general.author: william howard taft

general.quote: Everything that goes up must come down. But there comes a time when not everything that’s down can come up.
general.author: george burns

general.quote: If an ass goes travelling he will not come home a horse.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Love comes unseen; we only see it go.
general.author: henry austin dobson

general.quote: Always go to other people’s funerals, otherwise they won’t come to yours.
general.author: yogi berra

general.quote: I just like to take it as it comes, go where the wind blows me. I’m not going to plan.
general.author: matthew mcgrory

general.quote: What comes through my head is going to come out of my mouth.
general.author: marcus luttrell

general.quote: How strangely easy difficult things are!
general.author: charles buxton

general.quote: A fool often fails because he thinks what is difficult is easy.
general.author: john churton collins

general.quote: There is nothing so easy in itself but grows difficult when it is performed against one’s will.
general.author: terence (publius terentius afer)

general.quote: All good is hard. All evil is easy. Dying, losing, cheating, and mediocrity is easy. Stay away from easy.
general.author: scott alexander

general.quote: A life of ease is a difficult pursuit.
general.author: william cowper

general.quote: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
general.author: theodore isaac rubin

general.quote: Many things difficult to design prove easy to performance.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Farming looks mighty easy when your plow is a pencil and you’re a thousand miles from the corn field.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: The road to success is not easy to navigate, but with hard work, drive and passion, it’s possible to achieve the American dream.
general.author: tommy hilfiger

general.quote: It is easy to hate and it is difficult to love. This is how the whole scheme of things works. All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get.
general.author: morarji desai
