general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: Promise is most given when the least is said.
general.author: george chapman

general.quote: Promises that you make to yourself are often like the Japanese plum tree – they bear no fruit.
general.author: francis marion

general.quote: Political promises are much like marriage vows. They are made at the beginning of the relationship between candidate and voter, but are quickly forgotten.
general.author: dick gregory

general.quote: For every promise, there is price to pay.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: To threaten the brave with death is like promising water to a duck.
general.author: arabian

general.quote: Better break your word than do worse in keeping it.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: How little is the promise of the child fulfilled in the man.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Unless commitment is made, there are only promises and hopes; but no plans.
general.author: peter f. drucker

general.quote: This is the first convention of the space age – where a candidate can promise the moon and mean it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The future is as bright as the promises of God.
general.author: william carey

general.quote: Whom the gods wish to destroy they first call promising.
general.author: cyril connolly

general.quote: I will fore think what I will promise, that I may promise but what I will do.
general.author: arthur warwick

general.quote: But as the arms-control scholar Thomas Schelling once noted, two things are very expensive in international life: promises when they succeed and threats when they fail.
general.author: fareed zakaria

general.quote: America is like an unfaithful love who promises us more than we got.
general.author: charlotte bunch

general.quote: Promises retain men better than services; for hope is to them a chain, and gratitude a thread.
general.author: jean-antoine petit-senn

general.quote: Hypocrisy can afford to be magnificent in its promises, for never intending to go beyond promise, it costs nothing.
general.author: edmund burke

general.quote: The politician’s promises of yesterday are the taxes of today.
general.author: mackenzie king

general.quote: A liar is always lavish of oaths.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: A promise must never be broken.
general.author: alexander hamilton

general.quote: Illness is the most heeded of doctors: to goodness and wisdom we only make promises; pain we obey.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Oft expectation fails, and most oft where most it promises; and oft it hits where hope is coldest; and despair most sits.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: For anything worth having one must pay the price; and the price is always work, patience, love, self-sacrifice — no paper currency, no promises to pay, but the gold of real service.
general.author: john burroughs

general.quote: Promises are like babies: easy to make, hard to deliver.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The promises of yesterday are the taxes of today.
general.author: william lyon mackenzie

general.quote: Those who promise by the cart-load generally pay by the spadeful.
general.author: james lendall basford

general.quote: Promises,–the ready money that was first coined and made current by the law of nature, to support that society and commerce that was necessary for the comfort and security of mankind.
general.author: lord clarendon

general.quote: The best way to keep one’s word is not to give it.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte

general.quote: If you can’t give me your word of honor, will you give me your promise?
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: One of the things I’m always proud of is ‘Promises made, promises kept.’ I’ve never ever not done what I’ve said I’m going to do.
general.author: russell pearce

general.quote: In executing the duties of my present important station, I can promise nothing but purity of intentions, and, in carrying these into effect, fidelity and diligence.
general.author: george washington

general.quote: God never made a promise that was too good to be true.
general.author: dwight l. moody

general.quote: He is poor indeed who can promise nothing.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: Nothing is as easy to make as a promise this winter to do something next summer; this is how commencement speakers are caught.
general.author: sydney j. harris

general.quote: Most of us are pretty good at keeping promises to others and pretty bad at keeping promises to ourselves.
general.author: lawrence leshan

general.quote: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
general.author: wayne dyer

general.quote: I thought he was a young man of promise; but it appears he was a young man of promises.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: One must have a good memory to be able to keep the promises that one makes.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: God’s promises are like the stars; the darker the night the brighter they shine.
general.author: david nicholas

general.quote: A politician is known by the promises he keeps.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Those that are slowest in making a promise are the most faithful at performing it.
general.author: jean jacques rousseau

general.quote: Some persons make promises for the pleasure of breaking them.
general.author: william hazlitt

general.quote: Beauty always promises, but never gives anything.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: A prince never lacks legitimate reasons to break his promise.
general.author: niccolò machiavelli

general.quote: We promise according to our hopes, and perform according to our fears.
general.author: françois vi de la rochefoucault

general.quote: Politicians are the same all over. They promise to build bridges even when there are no rivers.
general.author: nikita khrushchev

general.quote: Half the promises people say were never kept, were never made.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Promises are like crying babies in a theater, they should be carried out at once.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: An ounce of performance is worth pounds of promises.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Vote for the man who promises least; he’ll be the least disappointing.
general.author: bernard m. baruch

general.quote: Keep every promise you make and only make promises you can keep.
general.author: anthony hitt

general.quote: I had rather do and not promise, than promise and not do.
general.author: arthur warwick

general.quote: It is easy to promise, and alas! How easy to forget!
general.author: louis charles alfred de musset

general.quote: April is a promise that May is bound to keep.
general.author: hal borland

general.quote: One promises much, to avoid giving little.
general.author: luc de clapiers

general.quote: The very first law in advertising is to avoid the concrete promise and cultivate the delightfully vague.
general.author: bill cosby

general.quote: If we got one-tenth of what was promised to us in these acceptance speeches there wouldn’t be any inducement to go to heaven.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: It makes my heart sick when I remember all the good words and the broken promises.
general.author: chief joseph

general.quote: All promise outruns performance.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Losers make promises they often break. Winners make commitments they always keep.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: Promises and pie crusts are made to be broken.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: Those who promise us paradise on earth never produced anything but a hell.
general.author: karl popper

general.quote: The promise given was a necessity of the past: the word broken is a necessity of the present.
general.author: niccolò machiavelli

general.quote: We must not promise what we ought not, lest we be called on to perform what we cannot.
general.author: abraham lincoln quotes

general.quote: Where there is an unknowable, there is a promise.
general.author: thornton wilder

general.quote: Everyone’s a millionaire where promises are concerned.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: A promise made is a debt unpaid.
general.author: robert w. service

general.quote: Life is too short to worry about anything. You had better enjoy it because the next day promises nothing.
general.author: eric davis

general.quote: Between today and tomorrow are graves, and between promising and fulfilling are chasms.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It is an immutable law in business that words are words, explanations are explanations, promises are promises but only performance is reality.
general.author: harold geneen

general.quote: He was ever precise in promise-keeping.
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: You cannot live on other people’s promises, but if you promise others enough, you can live on your own.
general.author: mark caine

general.quote: He who is the slowest in making a promise is the most faithful in the performance of it.
general.author: jean-jacques rousseau

general.quote: Not the maker of plans and promises, but rather the one who offers faithful service in small matters. This is the person who is most likely to achieve what is good and lasting.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Breach of promise is a base surrender of truth.
general.author: mohandas gandhi quotes

general.quote: Life didn’t promise to be wonderful.
general.author: teddy pendergrass

general.quote: It is easy to make promises – it is hard work to keep them.
general.author: boris johnson

general.quote: An acre of performance is worth a whole world of promise.
general.author: william dean howells

general.quote: Magnificent promises are always to be suspected.
general.author: theodore parker

general.quote: Rarely promise, but, if lawful, constantly perform.
general.author: william penn

general.quote: Promises are the uniquely human way of ordering the future, making it predictable and reliable to the extent that this is humanly possible.
general.author: hannah arendt

general.quote: In business, words are words; explanations are explanations, promises are promises, but only performance is reality.
general.author: harold s. geneen

general.quote: To promise not to do a thing is the surest way in the world to make a body want to go and do that very thing.
general.author: mark twain quotes

general.quote: If you wish to be success in the world, promise everything, deliver nothing.
general.author: napoleon bonaparte quotes

general.quote: Let God’s promises shine on your problems.
general.author: corrie ten boom

general.quote: Anyone can be rich in promises.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: The woods are lovely, dark and deep. But I have promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: Promise only what you can deliver. Then deliver more than you promise.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To promise is to give, to hope is to enjoy.
general.author: abbe jacques delille

general.quote: Magic trick: to make people disappear, ask them to fulfill their promises.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: A promise is a child of the understanding and the will; the understanding begets it, the will brings it forth.
general.author: francis quarles

general.quote: Enemies’ promises were made to be broken.
general.author: aesop

general.quote: When did the future switch from being a promise to being a threat?
general.author: chuck palahniuk

general.quote: The man who promises everything is sure to fulfill nothing, and everyone who promises too much is in danger of using evil means in order to carry out his promises, and is already on the road to perdition.
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Thou ought to be nice, even to superstition, in keeping thy promises, and therefore equally cautious in making them.
general.author: thomas fuller

general.quote: But the relationship of morality and power is a very subtle one. Because ultimately power without morality is no longer power.
general.author: james baldwin

general.quote: Justice and power must be brought together, so that whatever is just may be powerful, and whatever is powerful may be just.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Power over a man’s subsistence amounts to power over his will.
general.author: alexander hamilton

general.quote: You shall have joy, or you shall have power, said God; you shall not have both.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Laughing cheerfulness throws the light of day on all the paths of life.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Laugh and be fat.
general.author: john taylor

general.quote: Even in despair, man must laugh.
general.author: lin yutang

general.quote: A laugh, to be joyous, must flow from a joyous heart, for without kindness, there can be no true joy.
general.author: thomas carlyle

general.quote: A failure establishes only this, that our determination to succeed was not strong enough.
general.author: christian nestell bovee

general.quote: Determine your future now by taking hold of every opportunity.
general.author: debbye turner

general.quote: Goals determine what you’re going to be.
general.author: julius erving

general.quote: Determination is power. If the prospect be dark, kindle up the fire of resolution that nothing but death can extinguish.
general.author: charles simmons

general.quote: May we never let the things we can’t have, or don’t have, spoil our enjoyment of the things we do have and can have.
general.author: richard l. evans

general.quote: The best things in life are appreciated most after they have been lost.
general.author: roy l. smith

general.quote: It often happens that those of whom we speak least on earth are best known in heaven.
general.author: nicolas caussin

general.quote: There is more hunger for love and appreciation in this world than for bread.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: If life were measured by accomplishments, most of us would die in infancy.
general.author: a. p. gouthey

general.quote: Take a look at those two open hands of yours. They are tools with which to serve, make friends, and reach out for the best in life. Open hands open the way to achievement put them to work today.
general.author: wilfred a. peterson

general.quote: Achievement results from work realizing ambition.
general.author: adam ant

general.quote: Every great achievement is the victory of a flaming heart.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Don’t aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
general.author: david frost

general.quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
general.author: plutarch

general.quote: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark.
general.author: michelangelo

general.quote: Having an aim is the key to achieving your best.
general.author: henry j. kaiser

general.quote: As soon as beauty is sought not from religion and love, but for pleasure, it degrades the seeker.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Beauty is not caused. It is.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Do I love you because you’re beautiful, Or are you beautiful because I love you?
general.author: richard rodgers and oscar hammerstein ii

general.quote: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
general.author: rabindrath tagore

general.quote: A beautiful form is better than a beautiful face; it gives a higher pleasure than statues or pictures; it is the finest of the fine arts.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
general.author: marguerite gardiner

general.quote: Beauty is the mark God sets on virtue: every natural action is graceful, every heroic act is also decent and causes the place and the bystanders to shine.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: I don’t want something special. I want something beautifully plain.
general.author: anne lamott

general.quote: The beauty seen, is partly in him who sees it.
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: There is certainly no absolute standard of beauty. That precisely is what makes its pursuit so interesting.
general.author: john kenneth galbraith

general.quote: Remember that the most beautiful things in the world are the most useless; peacocks and lilies for instance.
general.author: john ruskin

general.quote: I’m not ugly, but my beauty is a total creation.
general.author: tyra banks

general.quote: Beauty will be convulsive or will not be at all.
general.author: andre breton

general.quote: Our hearts are drunk with a beauty our eyes could never see.
general.author: george w. russell

general.quote: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
general.author: john muir

general.quote: Strange that the vanity which accompanies beauty — excusable, perhaps, when there is such great beauty, or at any rate understandable — should persist after the beauty was gone.
general.author: mary arnim

general.quote: If I think something is beautiful, there must be somebody out there who will agree with me.
general.author: william kraft

general.quote: Exuberance is beauty.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: Beauty is one of the rare things that do not lead to doubt of God.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Beauty… when you look into a woman’s eyes and see what is in her heart.
general.author: nate dircks

general.quote: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: Plainness has its peculiar temptations quite as much as beauty.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Always have something beautiful in sight, even if it’s just a daisy in a jelly glass.
general.author: h. jackson brown, jr.

general.quote: Beauty?… To me it is a word without sense because I do not know where its meaning comes from nor where it leads to.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: There is nothing that makes its way more directly to the soul than beauty.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: The most beautiful view is the one I share with you.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Beauty itself is but the sensible image of the infinite.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: Beauty in the flesh will continue to rule the world.
general.author: florenz ziegfeld

general.quote: Remember, no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Beauty and folly are generally companions.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: I don’t like standard beauty – there is no beauty without strangeness.
general.author: karl lagerfeld

general.quote: Beauty is but the sensible image of the infinite. Like truth and justice, it lives within us; like virtue and the moral law, it is a companion of the soul.
general.author: george bancroft

general.quote: In every man’s heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: Beauty always promises, but never gives anything.
general.author: simone weil

general.quote: Things are beautiful if you love them.
general.author: jean anouilh

general.quote: Beauty soon grows familiar to the lover, fades in his eye, and palls upon the sense.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Beauty… is the shadow of God on the universe.
general.author: gabriela mistral

general.quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
general.author: confucius

general.quote: I’ve never seen a smiling face that was not beautiful.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Beauty is the promise of happiness.
general.author: stendhal

general.quote: Beauty comes as much from the mind as from the eye.
general.author: grey livingston

general.quote: A face is like the outside of a house, and most faces, like most houses, give us an idea of what we can expect to find inside.
general.author: loretta young

general.quote: He had a face like a blessing.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: As Americans, our purpose is to make kinder the face of the nation and gentler the face of the world.
general.author: george h. bush

general.quote: A blank helpless sort of face, rather like a rose just before you drench it with D.D.T.
general.author: john carey

general.quote: Her face was her chaperone.
general.author: rupert hughes

general.quote: The serial number of a human specimen is the face, that accidental and unrepeatable combination of features. It reflects neither character nor soul, nor what we call the self. The face is only the serial number of a specimen.
general.author: milan kundera

general.quote: Every man over forty is responsible for his face.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Even if you fall on your face, you’re still moving forward.
general.author: victor kiam

general.quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: To love another person is to see the face of God.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Trust not too much to an enchanting face.
general.author: virgil

general.quote: Often a noble face hides filthy ways.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: I wake up every morning literally with a smile on my face, grateful for another day I never thought I’d see.
general.author: dick cheney

general.quote: The face is the mirror of the mind, and eyes without speaking confess the secrets of the heart.
general.author: st. jerome

general.quote: What is a face, really? Its own photo? Its make-up? Or is it a face as painted by such or such painter? That which is in front? Inside? Behind? And the rest? Doesn’t everyone look at himself in his own particular way? Deformations simply do not exist.
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: A brave man is a man who dares to look the Devil in the face and tell him he is a Devil.
general.author: james a. garfieldv

general.quote: The smile on your face lets me know that you need me, there’s a truth in your heart that says you’ll never leave me, and the touch of your hand says you’ll catch me whenever I fall.
general.author: allison krauss

general.quote: The eyes those silent tongues of love.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: It matters more what’s in a woman’s face than what’s on it.
general.author: claudette colbert, quoted in kindling the spirit by lois p. frankel

general.quote: A writer never reads his work. For him, it is the unreadable, a secret, and he cannot remain face to face with it. A secret, because he is separated from it.
general.author: maurice blanchot

general.quote: When a wife has a good husband it is easily seen in her face.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: A man finds room in the few square inches of the face for the traits of all his ancestors; for the expression of all his history, and his wants.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: A man’s face is his autobiography. A woman’s face is her work of fiction.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: The human face is the organic seat of beauty. It is the register of value in development, a record of Experience, whose legitimate office is to perfect the life, a legible language to those who will study it, of the majestic mistress, the soul.
general.author: eliza farnham

general.quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: No one ever graduates from Bible study until he meets its Author face to face.
general.author: everett harris

general.quote: We see God face to face every hour, and know the savor of Nature.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: As a beauty I’m not a great star. Others are handsomer far; but my face — I don’t mind it because I’m behind it; it the folks out in front that I jar.
general.author: a. h. euwer

general.quote: The soul can split the sky in two and let the face of God shine through.
general.author: edna st. vincent millay

general.quote: After reading all that has been written, and after thinking all that can be thought on the topics of God and the soul, the man who has a right to say that he thinks at all, will find himself face to face with the conclusion that, on these topics, the most profound thought is that which can be the least easily distinguished from the most superficial sentiment.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: The face of evil is always the face of total need.
general.author: william s. burroughs

general.quote: The face of a child can say it all, especially the mouth part of the face.
general.author: jack handy

general.quote: For by his face straight shall you know his heart.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: My face is set, my gait is fast, my goal is Heaven, my road is narrow, my way is rough, my companions are few, my guide is reliable, my mission is clear.
general.author: robert moorehead

general.quote: A caricature is putting the face of a joke on the body of a truth.
general.author: joseph conrad

general.quote: What is your fortune, my pretty maid? "My face is my fortune, Sir," she said.
general.author: nursery rhyme

general.quote: I am ready to meet God face to face tonight and look into those eyes of infinite holiness, for all my sins are covered by the atoning blood.
general.author: r. a. torrey

general.quote: The world is a looking glass and gives back to every man the reflection of his own face.
general.author: william makepeace thackeray

general.quote: A man’s face as a rule says more, and more interesting things, than his mouth, for it is a compendium of everything his mouth will ever say, in that it is the monogram of all this man’s thoughts and aspirations.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: The tartness of his face sours ripe grapes.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: For now we see through a glass darkly, but then face to face; now I know in part, but then shall I know even as also I am known.
general.author: bible

general.quote: I have never been aware before how many faces there are. There are quantities of human beings, but there are many more faces, for each person has several.
general.author: rainer maria rilke

general.quote: A good face they say, is a letter of recommendation. O Nature, Nature, why art thou so dishonest, as ever to send men with these false recommendations into the World!
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: The faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: Now and then one sees a face which has kept its smile pure and undefiled. Such a smile transfigures; such a smile, if the artful but know it, is the greatest weapon a face can have.
general.author: helen hunt jackson

general.quote: My face looks like a wedding cake left out in the rain.
general.author: w. h. auden

general.quote: It has been said that a pretty face is a passport. But it’s not, it’s a visa, and it runs out fast.
general.author: julie burchill

general.quote: Honest labor bears a lovely face.
general.author: thomas dekker

general.quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I’ll make an exception.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: A face is too slight a foundation for happiness.
general.author: lady mary wortley montagu

general.quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: My evening visitors, if they cannot see the clock should find the time in my face.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine – and shadows will fall behind you.
general.author: walt whitman

general.quote: Life began with waking up and loving my mother’s face.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Her angel’s face, as the great eye of heaven shined bright, And made a sunshine in the shady place.
general.author: edmund spenser

general.quote: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: The face is more honest than the mouth will ever be.
general.author: daphne orebaugh

general.quote: People remain what they are even if their faces fall apart.
general.author: bertolt brecht

general.quote: You look rather rash my dear your colors don’t quite match your face.
general.author: daisy ashford

general.quote: All progress is precarious, and the solution of one problem brings us face to face with another problem.
general.author: martin luther king jr.

general.quote: Keep your nose out the sky, keep your heart to god, and keep your face to the raising sun.
general.author: kanye west

general.quote: You would not go out to work with a dirty face. Why start the day with the face of your soul unwashed?
general.author: robert a. cook

general.quote: Our work brings people face to face with love.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: Somehow our devils are never quite what we expect when we meet them face to face.
general.author: nelson demille

general.quote: Wicked thoughts and worthless efforts gradually set their mark on the face, especially the eyes.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: He, whose face gives no light, shall never become a star.
general.author: william blake

general.quote: It is only at the first encounter that a face makes its full impression on us.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Some people, no matter how old they get, never lose their beauty – they merely move it from their faces into their hearts.
general.author: martin buxbaum

general.quote: I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that.
general.author: lauren bacall

general.quote: I got sick of turning on the TV and seeing my face.
general.author: michael j. fox

general.quote: The countenance is the portrait of the soul, and the eyes mark its intentions.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: Who sees the human face correctly: the photographer, the mirror, or the painter?
general.author: pablo picasso

general.quote: It is the common wonder of all men, how among so many million faces, there should be none alike.
general.author: sir thomas browne

general.quote: Wicked thoughts and worthless efforts gradually set their mark on the face, especially the eyes.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: You’ve got to get up every morning with a smile on your face, and show the world all the love in your heart.
general.author: carole king

general.quote: Joyfulness keeps the heart and face young. A good laugh makes us better friends with ourselves and everybody around us.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Thinking a smile all the time will keep your face youthful.
general.author: frank gelett burgess

general.quote: When matters are desperate we must put on a desperate face.
general.author: robert burn

general.quote: Happiness never lays its finger on its pulse.
general.author: adam smith

general.quote: There is a light at the end of the tunnel… hopefully its not a freight train!
general.author: mariah carey

general.quote: For those people hoping for a light at the end of the tunnel, this report reveals the tunnel is still under construction.
general.author: anthony chan

general.quote: No matter what you’re going through, there’s a light at the end of the tunnel and it may seem hard to get to it but you can do it and just keep working towards it and you’ll find the positive side of things.
general.author: demi lovato

general.quote: There is absolutely, 100 percent, a light at the end of the tunnel for anyone who stutters.
general.author: emily blunt

general.quote: Every time I’m shooting a movie I want to kill myself. Because I don’t see the light in the end of the tunnel.
general.author: emir kusturica

general.quote: As a matter of fact, there is still a lot of light at the end of the tunnel. We just have to find a way to get to it.
general.author: tyrone willingham

general.quote: Light at the end of the tunnel? We don’t even have a tunnel; we don’t even know where the tunnel is.
general.author: lyndon b. johnson

general.quote: Sometimes that light at the end of the tunnel is a train.
general.author: charles barkley

general.quote: The light at the end of the tunnel is well worth the journey it took to get there.
general.author: amber kanady

general.quote: There is light at the end of the tunnel, but how long is the tunnel?
general.author: david briggs

general.quote: The light at the end of the tunnel is not an illusion. The tunnel is.
general.author: unknow

general.quote: Struggling is hard because you never know what’s at the end of the tunnel.
general.author: don rickles

general.quote: Some days are better than others … It’s been a long journey, but we’re starting to see the light at the end of the tunnel now.
general.author: brian robertson

general.quote: If you do not see light at the end of the tunnel, consider it an opportunity to create an opening yourself, wherever you want.
general.author: ashok kallarakkal

general.quote: The thing about a hero, is even when it doesn’t look like there’s a light at the end of the tunnel, he’s going to keep digging, he’s going to keep trying to do right and make up for what’s gone before, just because that’s who he is.
general.author: joss whedon

general.quote: If you see the light at the end of the tunnel, you’re looking through binoculars the wrong way.
general.author: josh stern,

general.quote: It’s true. The storms won’t last forever. The nasty weather will never last. There is always that light at the end of the tunnel.
general.author: diana rose morcilla

general.quote: Retiring for good wasn’t difficult. I knew at the time it was right. I was no longer capable of achieving the standards I’d set myself and there was no light at the end of the tunnel.
general.author: ian botham

general.quote: Politicians are people who, when they see light at the end of the tunnel, go out and buy some more tunnels.
general.author: john quinton

general.quote: We can see the light at the end of the tunnel. We just need to keep battling. We’re a team that has stuck together through the good times and the bad times. Our reward is near.
general.author: aaron rowand

general.quote: Poetry is the tunnel at the end of the light.
general.author: j. patrick lewis

general.quote: Also the wonderful thing about film, you can see light at the end of the tunnel. You did realize that it is going to come to an end at some stage.
general.author: john hurt

general.quote: It’s hard no matter where you are in the world, it’s always a bit of a battle, but there is light at the end of the tunnel.
general.author: andrew jack

general.quote: There is a light at the end of the tunnel. It can’t go lower. It can only go up.
general.author: jay patel

general.quote: At the end of every light, is a tunnel of darkness.
general.author: anthony liccione

general.quote: There is light at the end of the tunnel for India, but it’s that of an oncoming train which will run them over.
general.author: navjot singh sidhu

general.quote: We were just slogging on from day to day and making the best of it. But with a light at the end of the tunnel… AMERICA!
general.author: frank mccourt

general.quote: If you can see the light at the end of the tunnel, you are looking the wrong way.
general.author: barry commoner

general.quote: Unhappiness in a child accumulates because he sees no end to the dark tunnel. The thirteen weeks of a term might just as well be thirteen years.
general.author: graham greene

general.quote: Some actors couldn’t figure out how to withstand the constant rejection. They couldn’t see the light at the end of the tunnel.
general.author: harrison ford

general.quote: He who puts out his hand to stop the wheel of history will have his fingers crushed.
general.author: lech walesa

general.quote: The two most misused words in the entire English vocabulary are love and friendship. A true friend would die for you, so when you start trying to count them on one hand, you don’t need any fingers.
general.author: larry flynt

general.quote: On the other hand, you have different fingers.
general.author: steven wright

general.quote: God’s finger touched him and he slept.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Your heart just breaks, that’s all. But you can’t judge, or point fingers. You just have to be lucky enough to find someone who appreciates you.
general.author: audrey hepburn

general.quote: When a man points a finger at someone else, he should remember that four of his fingers are pointing at himself.
general.author: louis nizer

general.quote: Pointing fingers, trying to catch each other in scandal does not bring honor to this House.
general.author: mark foley

general.quote: We should give as we would receive, cheerfully, quickly, and without hesitation; for there is no grace in a benefit that sticks to the fingers.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: Failures, repeated failures, are finger posts on the mad? To achievement. One fails? Forward toward success.
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: God, I can push the grass apart and lay my finger on Thy heart.
general.author: edna st. vincent millay

general.quote: Every man’s life is a fairy tale written by God’s finger.
general.author: hans christian andersen

general.quote: To have hands, to have fingers, is weird. Real life is weird, to have fingers?
general.author: alejandro jodorowsky

general.quote: A basketball team is like the five fingers on your hand. If you can get them all together, you have a fist. That’s how I want you to play.
general.author: mike krzyzewski

general.quote: Ambition has one heel nailed in well, though she stretch her fingers to touch the heavens.
general.author: lao tzu

general.quote: Some people tap their feet, some people snap their fingers, and some people sway back and forth. I just shorta do’em all together, I guess.
general.author: elvis presley

general.quote: You hit somebody with your fist and not with your fingers spread.
general.author: heinz guderian

general.quote: Run your fingers through my soul. For once, just once, feel exactly what I feel, believe what I believe, perceive as I perceive, look, experience, examine, and for once; just once, understand.
general.author: c.s. lewis

general.quote: Burn not thy fingers to snuff another man’s candle.
general.author: james howell

general.quote: Writing, to me, is simply thinking through my fingers.
general.author: isaac asimov

general.quote: Of three things the devil makes a salad: advocate’s tongues, notaries’ fingers, and a third that shall be nameless.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The young are so old, they are born with their fingers crossed.
general.author: edna st. vincent millay

general.quote: The five separate fingers are five independent units. Close them and the fist multiplies strength. This is organization.
general.author: james cash penney

general.quote: Failures are finger posts on the road to achievement.
general.author: charles f. kettering

general.quote: My passions were all gathered together like fingers that made a fist. Drive is considered aggression today; I knew it then as purpose.
general.author: bette davis

general.quote: Everybody wants to take responsibility when you win, but when you fail, all these fingers are pointing.
general.author: mike krzyzewski

general.quote: Some of us have become so addicted to pointing fingers at others for all the wrong that happens in our lives that self-assessment has become synonymous with blaming the victim.
general.author: lz granderson

general.quote: All men are born with a nose and five fingers, but no one is born with a knowledge of God.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: The question is not so much what the hand is doing but what the heart is thinking while the hand is doing it.
general.author: john r. stott

general.quote: Whoever falls from God’s right hand Is caught into his left.
general.author: edwin markham

general.quote: If my hands are fully occupied in holding on to something, I can neither give nor receive.
general.author: dorothy solle

general.quote: To make a man happy, fill his hands with work.
general.author: frederick e. crane

general.quote: The gift of friendship… … a pair of helping hands.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: God warms his hands at man’s heart when he prays.
general.author: john masefield

general.quote: A long tongue is a sign of a short hand.
general.author: george herbert

general.quote: If we could but paint with the hand what we see with the eye.
general.author: honore de balzac

general.quote: I am like a little pencil in God’s hand. He does the writing. The pencil has nothing to do with it.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: The final forming of a person’s character lies in their own hands.
general.author: anne frank

general.quote: The game of life is not so much in holding a good hand as playing a poor hand well.
general.author: h.t. leslie

general.quote: Sometimes if you want to see a change for the better, you have to take things into your own hands.
general.author: clint eastwood

general.quote: The hands that help are holier than the lips that pray.
general.author: robert green ingersoll

general.quote: Jump into the middle of things, get your hands dirty, fall flat on your face, and then reach for the stars.
general.author: joan l. curcio

general.quote: Even God lends a hand to honest boldness.
general.author: menander of athens

general.quote: I love a hand that meets my own with a grasp that causes some sensation.
general.author: samuel osgood

general.quote: The desire of the lazy kill him; for his hands refuse to labor.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Success in life comes not from holding a good hand, but in playing a poor hand well.
general.author: denis waitley

general.quote: If you ever need a helping hand, you’ll find one at the end of your arm.
general.author: samuel levenson

general.quote: The ultimate test of a relationship is to disagree but to hold hands.
general.author: alexandria penney

general.quote: Only with the tools of production in their own hands could the workers ever hope to control their own lives and receive the fruits of their labor.
general.author: ella r. bloor

general.quote: Give me the ready hand rather than the ready tongue.
general.author: giuseppe garibaldi

general.quote: Happy is the man to whom nature has given a sufficiency with even a sparing hand.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: A heart to resolve, a head to contrive, and a hand to execute.
general.author: edward gibbon

general.quote: Men are made stronger on realization that the helping hand they need is at the end of their own arm.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: The open hand of giving is always full.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: God has given us two hands, one to receive with and the other to give with.
general.author: billy graham

general.quote: Put your future in good hands — your own.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The hand cannot reach higher than does the heart.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: We do not quite forgive a giver. The hand that feeds us is in some danger of being bitten.
general.author: ralph waldo

general.quote: The lonely one offers his hand too quickly to whomever he encounters.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: Chiefly the mold of a man’s fortune is in his own hands.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: The world is in your hands, now use it.
general.author: phil collins

general.quote: The dead hold in their hands only what they have given away.
general.author: carl sandburg

general.quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: The fragrance always stays in the hand that gives the rose.
general.author: heda be jar

general.quote: He whose hand is clasped in friendship cannot throw mud.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Before you point your fingers be sure your hands are clean.
general.author: bob marley

general.quote: Prayer moves the hand that moves the world.
general.author: john aikman wallace

general.quote: Men and women are like right and left hands: it doesn’t make sense not to use both.
general.author: jeannette rankin

general.quote: Now join your hands, and with your hands your hearts.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: The impersonal hand of government can never replace the helping hand of a neighbor.`
general.author: hubert h. humphrey

general.quote: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.
general.author: meister eckhart

general.quote: Taking the future in your own hands has a fantastic psychological impact.
general.author: aleqa hammond

general.quote: The mould of a man’s fortune is in his own hands.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing: no one to blame.
general.author: erica jong

general.quote: Ah, how good it feels! The hand of an old friend.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: I’ve taken my destiny into my own hands and I’m in a happy place.
general.author: charlie simpson

general.quote: To the man who himself strives earnestly, God also lends a helping hand.
general.author: aeschylus

general.quote: I’ve taken my destiny into my own hands and I’m in a happy place.
general.author: charlie simpson

general.quote: Stretch out your hand! Let no human soul wait for a benediction.
general.author: marie corelli

general.quote: The difference between a helping hand and an outstretched palm is a twist of the wrist.
general.author: laurence leamer

general.quote: Prayer puts God’s work in his hands — and keeps it there.
general.author: e.m. bounds

general.quote: One of the best ways to do yourself a favor is to lend somebody else a helping hand.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Nature has made you for a giver: Your hands are born open, and so is your heart.
general.author: frances hodgson burnett

general.quote: Walk boldly and wisely…. There is a hand above that will help you on.
general.author: philip james bailey

general.quote: Never hesitate to hold out your hand; never hesitate to accept the outstretched hand of another.
general.author: pope john xxiii

general.quote: Take a look at those two open hands of yours. They are tools with which to serve, make friends, and reach out for the best in life. Open hands open the way to achievement Put them to work today.
general.author: wilfred a. peterson

general.quote: Put your hands to work, and your hearts to God.
general.author: mother ann lee

general.quote: Experience is in the fingers and head. The heart is inexperienced.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Civilization has taught us to eat with a fork, but even now if nobody is around we use our fingers.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: The fingers must be educated, the thumb is born knowing.
general.author: marc chagall

general.quote: Clean your finger before you point at my spots.
general.author: benjamin franklin

general.quote: False face must hide what the false heart doth know.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Nature gives you the face you have at twenty; it is up to you to merit the face you have at fifty.
general.author: coco chanel

general.quote: After a certain number of years our faces become our biographies. We get to be responsible for our faces.
general.author: cynthia ozick

general.quote: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Some people, no matter how old they get, never lose their beauty – they merely move it from their faces into their hearts.
general.author: martin buxbaum

general.quote: The idea that happiness could have a share in beauty would be too much of a good thing.
general.author: walter benjamin

general.quote: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: My arms are too short to box with God.
general.author: johnny cash

general.quote: The best place to cry is on a mother’s arms.
general.author: jodi picoult

general.quote: Luck always seems to be against the man who depends on it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Today, well lived, will prepare me for both the pleasure and the pain of tomorrow.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The wise don’t expect to find life worth living; they make it that way.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Success is just a matter of luck, all you need to do is ask a failure.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is when opportunity knocks and you answer.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is good planning, carefully executed.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is a very good word if you put a P before it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck is a disease for which hard work is the only remedy.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Luck has a peculiar habit of favoring those who don’t depend on it.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Good luck is the twin brother of hard work.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Good luck is often with the man who doesn’t include it in his plans.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Good luck is a lazy man’s estimate of a worker’s success.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Combine common sense and the Golden Rule, and you will have very little bad luck.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The worst cynicism: a belief in luck.
general.author: joyce carol oates

general.quote: What is luck? It is not only chance, it is also creating the opportunity, recognizing it when it is there, and taking it when it comes.
general.author: natasha josefowitz

general.quote: A man forgets his good luck next day, but remembers his bad luck until next year.
general.author: edgar watson howe

general.quote: Luck is what a capricious man believes in.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: I believe in luck. The harder I work the luckier I get.
general.author: sam shoen

general.quote: Luck is being in the right place at the right time, but location and timing are to some extent under our control.
general.author: natasha josefowitz

general.quote: I’m a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Luck is not the hand of God…. Luck is the way the wind swirls and the dust settles eons after God has passed by.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Luck? I don’t know anything about luck. I’ve never banked on it, and I’m afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: hard work — and realizing what opportunity is and what isn’t.
general.author: lucille ball

general.quote: I find I’m luckier when I work harder.
general.author: dr. denton cooley

general.quote: Good and bad luck is but a synonym, in the great majority of instances, for good and bad judgment.
general.author: paul chatfield

general.quote: Luck. Take a second look at what appears to be someone’s "good luck." You’ll find not luck but preparation, planning, and success-producing thinking.
general.author: david j. schwartz

general.quote: I think the harder you work the more luck you have.
general.author: david thomas

general.quote: The lucky have whole days which still they choose; the unlucky have but hours, and those they lose.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: I have been extraordinarily lucky. Anyone who pretends that some kind of luck isn’t involved in his success is deluding himself.
general.author: arthur hailey

general.quote: To believe in luck… is skepticism.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Luck is what you have left over after you give 100 percent.
general.author: langston coleman

general.quote: You must always be open to your luck. You cannot force it, but you can recognize it.
general.author: henry moore

general.quote: People always call it luck when you’ve acted more sensibly than they have.
general.author: anne tyler

general.quote: You don’t just luck into things as much as you would like to think you do. You build step by step, whether it is friendships or opportunities.
general.author: barbara bush

general.quote: Luck is believing you’re lucky.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: Today is a new day. You will get out of it just what you put into it.
general.author: mary pickford

general.quote: Luck is not chance, it is toil. Fortune is expensive smile is earned.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: Luck always seems like it belongs to someone else.
general.author: david levien

general.quote: Luck has a way of evaporating when you lean on it.
general.author: brandon mull

general.quote: Motivation triggers luck.
general.author: mike wallace

general.quote: Luck is everything…. My good luck in life was to be a really frightened person. I’m fortunate to be a coward, to have a low threshold of fear, because a hero couldn’t make a good suspense film.
general.author: alfred hitchcock

general.quote: Luck, good or bad, is the invisible play of mind upon affairs, the effect of mental aptitudes and habits which are not in sight, but which work and bring forth their due issues.
general.author: james vila blake

general.quote: I’ve found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: I would rather have a lucky general than a smart general…. They win battles, and they make me lucky.
general.author: dwight d. eisenhower

general.quote: I’ve had bad luck and I’ve had good and neither one lasted long enough to dry spit.
general.author: jo clayton

general.quote: As long as we are lucky we attribute it to our smartness; our bad luck we give the gods credit for.
general.author: josh billings

general.quote: Lady Luck generally woos those who earnestly, enthusiastically, unremittingly woo her.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: Luck is a discernible, if mysterious, pattern of influences on your life path.
general.author: david kennedy

general.quote: Luck is a dividend of sweat. The more you sweat, the luckier you get.
general.author: ray kroc

general.quote: I believe in luck: how else can you explain the success of those you dislike?
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: Lucky people are usually bad players when it comes to correcting their faults; they always believe that they are right when chance backs up their vice or folly.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Luck is a combination of confidence and getting the breaks.
general.author: christy mathewson

general.quote: No luck was dumb because luck was just another name for miracle.
general.author: margaret atwood

general.quote: Luck is not as random as you think. Before that lottery ticket won the jackpot, someone had to buy it.
general.author: vera nazarian

general.quote: I always think luck‘s a bit like splitting a log. You’re much more likely to succeed if you read the grain and look for flaw-lines.
general.author: k.j.parker

general.quote: If the influence of luck is a delusion, then all I can say is that the delusion is virtually universal.
general.author: felix dennis

general.quote: Luck can be assisted. It is not all chance with the wise.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Luck implies an absolute absence of any principle.
general.author: chuang tzu

general.quote: What we call luck is the inner man externalized. We make things happen to us.
general.author: robertson davies

general.quote: You can create your own luck just like a cloud can create its own rain. You create your own luck by the way you act, think, feel, and talk.
general.author: mark benedict

general.quote: It is a great piece of skill to know how to guide your luck even while waiting for it.
general.author: baltasar gracian

general.quote: Get as much experience as you can, so that you’re ready when luck works. That’s the luck.
general.author: henry fonda

general.quote: I find that the harder I work the more luck I seem to have.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: Ill luck, you know, seldom comes alone.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: You’ve got to be in a position for luck to happen. Luck doesn’t go around looking for a stumblebum.
general.author: darrell royal

general.quote: Destiny is the invention of the cowardly, and the resigned.
general.author: ignazio silone

general.quote: Luck, mere luck may make even madness wisdom.
general.author: douglas william jerrold

general.quote: A man never has good luck who has a bad wife.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The doors we open and close each day decide the lives we live.
general.author: flora whittemore

general.quote: Everything that happened to me happened by mistake. I don’t believe in fate. It’s luck, timing and accident.
general.author: mery griffin

general.quote: The lucky fellow is the plucky fellow who has been burning midnight oil and taking defeat after defeat with a smile.
general.author: james b. hill

general.quote: Virtue without success is a fair picture shown by an ill light; but lucky men are favorites of heaven; all own the chief, when fortune owns the cause.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Luck relies on chance, labor on character.
general.author: richard cobden

general.quote: No writer should minimize the factor that affects everyone, but is beyond control: luck.
general.author: john jakes

general.quote: Hope nothing from. Luck; and the probability is that you will be so prepared, forewarned, and forearmed that all shallow observers will call you lucky.
general.author: edward george earle lytton bulwer-lytton

general.quote: Much of my good fortune was a matter of nothing more clever on my part than luck.
general.author: james fixx

general.quote: They say you have to be good to be lucky, but I think you have to be lucky to be good.
general.author: rico carty

general.quote: I’ve had bad luck and I’ve had good and neither one lasted long enough to dry spit.
general.author: jo clayton

general.quote: Luck was something you either earned or invented through strength of character. You had to come by it honestly; you could not trick or bluff your way into it.
general.author: patrick dewitt

general.quote: The powerless worship Luck and Fate.
general.author: mason cooley

general.quote: I will ride my luck on occasion, but I like to pick the occasion.
general.author: rex stout

general.quote: Luck is simply the advantage a true warrior gains in executing the correct course of action.
general.author: r.a.salvatore

general.quote: Luck marches with those who give their very best.
general.author: h. jackson brown jr.

general.quote: I’m a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
general.author: thomas jefferson

general.quote: I was born lucky, and I have lived lucky. What I had was used. What I still have is being used. Lucky.
general.author: katharine hepburn

general.quote: Some people are so fond of bad luck they run half way to meet it.
general.author: douglas william jerrold

general.quote: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
general.author: gary player

general.quote: All psychological studies indicate that a person’s luck is influenced by his state of mind.
general.author: june sawyer

general.quote: I think that one can have luck if one tries to create an atmosphere of spontaneity.
general.author: federico fellini

general.quote: Men of action are favored by the Goddess of luck.
general.author: george s. clason

general.quote: Nothing is as obnoxious as other people’s luck.
general.author: f.scott fitzgerald

general.quote: A pound of pluck is worth a ton of luck.
general.author: james a. garfield

general.quote: Luck’s always to blame.
general.author: jean de la fontaine

general.quote: When I work fourteen hours a day, seven days a week, I get lucky.
general.author: dr. armand hammer

general.quote: The only sure thing about luck is that it will change.
general.author: bret harte

general.quote: You know what luck is? Luck is believing you’re lucky….
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: When it comes to luck you make your own.
general.author: bruce springsteen

general.quote: Luck, bad if not good, will always be with us. But it has a way of favoring the intelligent and showing its back to the stupid.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: Since luck’s a nine days’ wonder, wait their end.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Shallow people believe in luck and in circumstances; Strong people believe in cause and effect.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Everything in life is luck.
general.author: donald trump

general.quote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
general.author: oprah winfrey

general.quote: When good luck knocks at the door, let him in and keep him there.
general.author: cervantes

general.quote: Don’t you know by now, luck don’t lead to anything or why you keep on moving.
general.author: steve winwood

general.quote: Those who have succeeded at anything and don’t mention luck are kidding themselves.
general.author: larry king

general.quote: The luck of having talent is not enough; one must also have a talent for luck.
general.author: hector berlioz

general.quote: Luck cannot change birth.
general.author: horace

general.quote: You don’t have to justify a beautiful stroke of good luck. Accept it. Smile and say thank you.
general.author: garrison keillor

general.quote: Luck is tenacity of purpose.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: It’s hard to detect good luck – it looks so much like something you’ve earned.
general.author: frank a. clark

general.quote: Luck is the savior for the few but a demon for the masses.
general.author: michael titorenk

general.quote: Luck enters into every contingency. You are a fool if you forget it — and a greater fool if you count upon it.
general.author: phyllis bottome

general.quote: In the queer mess of human destiny, the determining factor is luck.
general.author: william e. woodward

general.quote: Luck generally comes to those who look for it, and my notion is that it taps, once in a lifetime, at everybody’s door, but if industry does not open it luck goes away.
general.author: charles haddon spurgeon

general.quote: We must believe in luck. For how else can we explain the success of those we don’t like?
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: The man who glories in his luck may be overthrown by destiny.
general.author: euripides

general.quote: Luck can often mean simple taking advantage of a situation at the right moment; it is possible to "make" your luck by being always prepared.
general.author: michael korda

general.quote: I think luck is the sense to recognize an opportunity and the ability to take advantage of it. The man who can smile at his breaks and grab his chances gets on.
general.author: samuel goldwyn

general.quote: Good luck needs no explanation.
general.author: shirley temple black

general.quote: I am a great believer in luck, and I find the harder I work, the more of it I have.
general.author: stephen leacock

general.quote: Luck, be a lady tonight.
general.author: frank loesser

general.quote: A rabbit’s foot may bring good luck to you, but it brought none to the rabbit.
general.author: ambrose bierce

general.quote: Good luck is the willing handmaid of an upright and energetic character, and conscientious observance of duty.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: I’ve found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
general.author: brian tracy

general.quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
general.author: elmer g. letterman

general.quote: The profits of good luck are perishable; if you build on fortune, you build on sand; the more advancement you achieve, the more dangers you run.
general.author: marquis de racan

general.quote: I don’t believe in luck. We make our own good fortune.
general.author: dr. joyce brothers

general.quote: The best luck of all is the luck you make for yourself.
general.author: douglas macarthur

general.quote: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
general.author: harry golden

general.quote: There are so many people with all kinds of lucky things happening to them, and they don’t know how to use it.
general.author: rocky aoki

general.quote: Luck is being ready for the chance.
general.author: j. frank doble

general.quote: Luck never made a man wise.
general.author: seneca

general.quote: The man who is intent on making the most of his opportunities is too busy to bother about luck.
general.author: b.c. forbes

general.quote: The amount of good luck coming your way depends on your willingness to act.
general.author: barbara sher

general.quote: It is the sum of the million little unconscious dispositions that go to make life joyful or painful.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The more the heart is sated with joy, the more it becomes insatiable.
general.author: gabrielle roy

general.quote: Real joy comes not from ease or riches or from the praise of men, but from doing something worthwhile.
general.author: pierre coneille

general.quote: Troubles loom up big when they’re ahead, and joys seem always sweeter when they’re past.
general.author: edgar guest

general.quote: Stretch out your hand and take the world’s wide gift of Joy and Beauty.
general.author: corinne roosevelt robinson

general.quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: The soul’s joy lies in doing.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: It is a fine seasoning for joy to think of those we love.
general.author: moliere

general.quote: Joy is the holy fire that keeps our purpose warm and our intelligence aglow.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
general.author: hosea ballou

general.quote: Happiness… it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
general.author: franklin d. roosevelt

general.quote: Oh the wild joys of living! The leaping from rock to rock … the cool silver shock of the plunge in a pool’s living waters.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: The surest mark of a Christian is not faith, or even love, but joy.
general.author: samuel m. shoemaker

general.quote: Perhaps there could be no joy on this planet without an equal weight of pain to balance it out on some unknown scale.
general.author: stephanie meyer

general.quote: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within.
general.author: eckhart tolle

general.quote: Joy and grief are things of great hazard and danger in the life of man: The one breaks the heart; the other intoxicates the head.
general.author: benjamin whichcote

general.quote: Joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls. A joyful heart is the inevitable result of a heart burning with love.
general.author: mother teresa

general.quote: Great joy, especially after a sudden change of circumstances, is apt to be silent, and dwells rather in the heart than on the tongue.
general.author: henry fielding

general.quote: There is no greater joy under the sun than the joy of giving: giving of one’s time, energy, talent, and money to help one’s fellow man.
general.author: william h. taylor

general.quote: Life is about enjoying yourself and having a good time.
general.author: cher

general.quote: All human joys are swift of wing, For heaven doth so allot it; That when you get an easy thing, You find you haven’t got it.
general.author: eugene field

general.quote: Joy‘s recollection is no longer joy, while Sorrow’s memory is a sorrow still.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: You are younger today than you ever will be again. Make use of it for the sake of tomorrow.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: People come and go, pain comes and goes. But so does joy. And if our hearts are closed because we don’t want to suffer, they won’t be open enough to recognize the joy as it flies by.
general.author: geneen roth

general.quote: Joy has no cost.
general.author: marianne williamson

general.quote: He who has not looked on Sorrow will never see Joy.
general.author: kahlil gibran

general.quote: Joys are our wings, sorrows our spurs.
general.author: jean paul richter

general.quote: Joy runs deeper than despair.
general.author: corrie ten boom

general.quote: The end of life is life. Life is action, the use of one’s powers. And to use them to their height is our joy of duty.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: A garden isn’t meant to be useful. It’s for joy.
general.author: rumer godden

general.quote: Joys divided are increased.
general.author: josiah gilbert holland

general.quote: The joys we expect are not so bright, nor the troubles so dark as we fancy they will be.
general.author: charles reade

general.quote: Joy is not in things, it is in us.
general.author: richard wagner

general.quote: Unexplained joy is always so keen that…it seems to hold enough to reconcile one to the inevitable.
general.author: jessie b. fremont

general.quote: In this world, full often, our joys are only the tender shadows which our sorrows cast.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: I sometimes wonder whether all pleasures are not substitutes for joy.
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life.
general.author: william congreve

general.quote: Where there is joy there is creation. Where there is no joy there is no creation: know the nature of joy.
general.author: veda

general.quote: There is joy in work. There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: We French found it and called it joie de vivre — the joy of living.
general.author: renee repound

general.quote: Joy is free, unrestrained passion.
general.author: eileen stukane

general.quote: Men are not put into this world to be everlastingly played on by the harping fingers of joy.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The fact is always obvious much too late, but the most singular difference between happiness and joy is that happiness is a solid and joy a liquid.
general.author: j. d. salinger

general.quote: Joy is the best wine."
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: What I do, I do very well, and what I don’t do well, I don’t do at all.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Joy is more divine than sorrow; for joy is bread, and sorrow is medicine.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: You get more joy out of giving joy to others and should put a good deal of thought into the happiness that you are able to give.
general.author: eleanor roosevelt

general.quote: Joy is a subtle elf; I think one’s happiest when he forgets himself.
general.author: cyril tourneur

general.quote: They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
general.author: bible

general.quote: Joy is good–the angel’s food.
general.author: caroline spencer

general.quote: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
general.author: jim rohn

general.quote: What joy can the years bring half so sweet as the unhappiness they’ve taken away? "
general.author: logan pearsall smith

general.quote: There is no greater joy nor greater reward than to make a fundamental difference in someone’s life.
general.author: sister mary rose mcgeady

general.quote: Joy is the feeling of grinning on the inside.
general.author: dr. melba colgrove

general.quote: I have drunken deep of joy, and I will taste no other wine tonight.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: To pursue joy is to lose it. The only way to get it is to follow steadily the path of duty.
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: Cultivate more joy by arranging your life so that more joy will be likely.
general.author: georgia within

general.quote: Joy, has no cost.
general.author: marianne williamson

general.quote: There’s a great joy in my giving. It’s thrilling. It’s exhilarating. It’s important to be a part of sharing. It is my love. It is my joy.
general.author: w. clement stone

general.quote: May your joys be as deep as the ocean, your sorrows as light as its foam.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The joy in life is to be used for a purpose. I want to be used up when I die.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Before the reward there must be labor. You plant before you harvest. You sow in tears before you reap joy.
general.author: ralph ransom

general.quote: There is no hope of joy except in human relations.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: The talent of turning men into ridicule, and exposing to laughter those one converses with, is the gratification of little minds and ungenerous tempers. A young man with this cast of mind cuts himself off from all manner of improvement.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: Read, every day, something no one else is reading. Think, every day, something no one else is thinking. Do, every day, something no one else would be silly enough to do. It is bad for the mind to be always part of unanimity.
general.author: christopher morley

general.quote: Look for the ridiculous in everything and you will find it.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: Ridicule is a weak weapon when pointed at a strong mind; but common people are cowards and dread an empty laugh.
general.author: martin tupper

general.quote: Absurdities die of self-strangulation.
general.author: thomas chandler haliburton

general.quote: No God and no religion can survive ridicule. No political church, no nobility, no royalty or other fraud, can face ridicule in a fair field, and live.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: In the consciousness of the truth he has perceived, man now sees everywhere only the awfulness or the absurdity of existence and loathing seizes him.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: To the man of thought almost nothing is really ridiculous.
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe

general.quote: Of all the authorities to which men can be called to submit, the wisdom of our ancestors is the most whimsically absurd.
general.author: jeremy taylor

general.quote: I believe they talked of me, for they laughed consumedly.
general.author: george farquhar

general.quote: The irrationality of a thing is no argument against its existence, rather a condition of it.
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Ridicule is often employed with more power and success than severity.
general.author: horace

general.quote: When a person can no longer laugh at himself, it is time for others to laugh at him.
general.author: thomas szasz

general.quote: Ridicule often checks what is absurd, and fully as often smothers that which is noble.
general.author: sir walter scott

general.quote: The petty economies of the rich are just as amazing as the silly extravagances of the poor.
general.author: william feather

general.quote: It is easy for a man who sits idle at home, and has nobody to please but himself, to ridicule or censure the common practices of mankind.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Some men are, in regard to ridicule, like tin-roofed buildings in regard to hail: all that hits them bounds rattling off; not a stone goes through.
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: The privilege of absurdity; to which no living creature is subject, but man only.
general.author: thomas hobbes

general.quote: One cannot be always laughing at a man without now and then stumbling on something witty.
general.author: jane austen

general.quote: At any street corner the feeling of absurdity can strike any man in the face.
general.author: albert camus

general.quote: Every absurdity has a champion to defend it.
general.author: oliver goldsmith

general.quote: In the sphere of thought, absurdity and perversity remain the masters of the world, and their dominion is suspended only for brief periods.
general.author: arthur schopenhauer

general.quote: Mix a little foolishness with your serious plans. It is lovely to be silly at the right moment.
general.author: horace

general.quote: I have always made one prayer to God, a very short one. Here it is: "My God, make our enemies very ridiculous!" God has granted it to me.
general.author: voltaire

general.quote: Ridicule is generally made use of to laugh men out of virtue and good sense, by attacking everything praiseworthy in human life.
general.author: joseph addison

general.quote: No man is exempt from saying silly things; the mischief is to say them deliberately.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: There is nothing so absurd as not to have been said by a philosopher.
general.author: cicero

general.quote: I wish I loved the Human Race; I wish I loved its silly face; I wish I liked the way it walks; I wish I liked the way it talks; And when I’m introduced to one I wish I thought What Jolly Fun!
general.author: sir walter raleigh

general.quote: Ridicule more often settles things more thoroughly and better than acrimony.
general.author: horace

general.quote: He who brings ridicule to bear against truth finds in his hand a blade without a hilt.
general.author: walter savage landor

general.quote: It is always a silly thing to give advice, but to give good advice is fatal.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: It is not in the world of ideas that life is lived. Life is lived for better or worse in life, and to a man in life, his life can be no more absurd than it can be the opposite of absurd, whatever that opposite may be.
general.author: archibald macleish

general.quote: Mockery is often the result of a poverty of wit.
general.author: jean de la bruyere

general.quote: Some aspects of success seem rather silly as death approaches.
general.author: donald a. miller

general.quote: Nature meant for me a wife, a silly harmless household Dove, fond without art; and kind without deceit.
general.author: john dryden

general.quote: Nothing is more ridiculous than ridicule.
general.author: lord shaftesbury

general.quote: Generally the ridiculous touches the sublime.
general.author: jean francois marmontel
