general.author: ninon de l’enclos

general.quote: If you’re an attractive guy, everyone thinks you’re successful just because of the way you look.
general.author: james marsden

general.quote: The moment somebody says to me, "This is very risky," is the moment it becomes attractive to me.
general.author: kate capshaw

general.quote: The courts are as a stage, people love to see attractive players.
general.author: anna kournikova

general.quote: No woman can be handsome by the force of features alone, any more than she can be witty only by the help of speech.
general.author: thomas hughes

general.quote: A man of character finds a special attractiveness in difficulty, since it is only by coming to grips with difficulty that he can realize his potentialities.
general.author: charles de gaulle

general.quote: Are you not scared by seeing that the gypsies are more attractive to us than the apostles?
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: For attractive lips, speak words of kindness.
general.author: sam levenson

general.quote: I hold it to be the moral duty of women to make themselves beautiful in all lawful ways.
general.author: e. lynn linton

general.quote: Laziness may appear attractive but work gives satisfaction.
general.author: anne frank

general.quote: The more equally attractive two alternatives seem, the harder it can be to choose between them — no matter that, to the same degree, the choice can only matter less.
general.author: edward fredkin’s paradox

general.quote: A woman’s natural quality is to attract, and having attracted to enchain; and how influential she may be for good or evil, the history of every age makes clear.
general.author: mrs. hugh r. haweis

general.quote: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
general.author: christian dior

general.quote: On the attraction between man and woman society is based; but its refined is greater than its gross force, and its weight is like the gravitation of the globe.
general.author: cyrus augustus bartol

general.quote: Your enthusiasm will be infectious, stimulating and attractive to others. They will love you for it. They will go for you and with you.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: The inner speech, your thoughts, can cause you to be rich or poor, loved or unloved, happy or unhappy, attractive or unattractive, powerful or weak.
general.author: ralph charell

general.quote: The only thing that makes one place more attractive to me than another is the quantity of heart I find in it.
general.author: jane welsh carlyle

general.quote: Women and flowers are made to beloved for their beauty and sweetness, rather than themselves to love.
general.author: ninon de l’enclos

general.quote: Rarity gives a charm: thus early fruits are most esteemed; thus winter roses obtain a higher price; thus coyness sets off an extravagant mistress: a door ever open attracts no young suitor.
general.author: martial

general.quote: Military glory — the attractive rainbow that rises in showers of blood.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Thirty-five is a very attractive age. London society is full of women of the highest birth who have, of their own free choice, remained thirty-five for years.
general.author: oscar wilde

general.quote: When truth is discovered by someone else, it loses something of its attractiveness.
general.author: alexander solzhenitsyn

general.quote: Those who are formed to win general admiration are seldom calculated to bestow individual happiness.
general.author: lady marguerite blessington

general.quote: A pretty, silly, self-conceited woman will very often be far more courted, and seemingly far more liked and admired, than a woman of infinitely higher charms. All the while the men do not like her a tenth part as well.
general.author: charles buxton

general.quote: Though God’s attributes are equal, yet his mercy is more attractive and pleasing in our eyes than his justice.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: One of the most attractive things about the flowers is their beautiful reserve.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: Nothing under heaven so strongly doth allure the sense of man, and all his mind possess, as beauty’s love.
general.author: edmund spenser

general.quote: The most attractive sentences are not perhaps the wisest, but the surest and soundest.
general.author: henry david thoreau

general.quote: That hook of wiving, fairness which strikes the eye.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: I like villains because there’s something so attractive about a committed person — they have a plan, an ideology, no matter how twisted. They’re motivated.
general.author: russell crowe

general.quote: The first duty of a woman is to be pretty.
general.author: madame delphine gay de girardin

general.quote: We’re able to judge attractiveness with surprising speed and on the basis of very little information.
general.author: ingrid olson

general.quote: The poetic element lying hidden in most women is the source of their magnetic attraction.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: When confronted with two evils, a man will always choose the most attractive.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The more sensible a woman is, supposing her not to be masculine, the more attractive she is in her proportionate power to entertain.
general.author: leigh hunt

general.quote: She carried about her an indefinable air of having been used to love, or admiration probably, of men as well as women, which the most exquisitely modest women will sometimes wear, and which is unmistakable as it is alluring to the eye.
general.author: elizabeth stuart phelps

general.quote: To make the cunning artless, tame the rude, subdue the haughty, shake the undaunted soul; yea, put a bridle in the lion’s mouth, and lead him forth as a domestic cur;–these are the triumphs of all-powerful beauty.
general.author: joanna baillie

general.quote: Clever and attractive women do not want to vote; they are willing to let men govern as long as they govern men.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: A Code of Honor — never approach a friend’s girlfriend or wife with mischief as your goal. There are just too many women in the world to justify that sort of dishonorable behavior. Unless she’s really attractive.
general.author: bruce j freidmen

general.quote: Our poor eyes were so enriched as to behold, and our low hearts so exalted as to love, a maid who is such, that as the greatest thing the world can show is her beauty, so the least thing that may be praised in her is her beauty.
general.author: sir philip sidney

general.quote: The brain is wider than the sky.
general.author: emily dickinson

general.quote: My thoughts, my beliefs, my feelings are all in my brain. My brain is going to rot.
general.author: richard dawkins

general.quote: The brain can be easy to buy, but the heart never comes to market.
general.author: james russell lowell

general.quote: It’s good to make your brain work more than your body.
general.author: conor mcgregor

general.quote: It is necessary to relax your muscles when you can. Relaxing your brain is fatal.
general.author: stirling moss

general.quote: The heart has eyes which the brain knows nothing of.
general.author: charles h. perkhurst

general.quote: But if God had wanted us to think just with our wombs, why did He give us a brain?
general.author: clare boothe luce

general.quote: Research has shown that even small amounts of processed food alter the chemical balance in our brain and cause negative mood swings along with noticeable dips ill energy.
general.author: marilu henner

general.quote: You can’t change who you are, but you can change what you have in your head, you can refresh what you’re thinking about, you can put some fresh air in your brain.
general.author: ernesto bertarelli

general.quote: Where the heart lies, let the brain lie also.
general.author: robert browning

general.quote: The human brain has 100 billion neurons, each neuron connected to 10 thousand other neurons. Sitting on your shoulders is the most complicated object in the known universe.
general.author: michio kaku

general.quote: There is no need for temples, no need for complicated philosophies. My brain and my heart are my temples; my philosophy is kindness.
general.author: dalai lama

general.quote: I was taught that the human brain was the crowning glory of evolution so far, but I think it’s a very poor scheme for survival.
general.author: kurt vonnegut

general.quote: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
general.author: leonardo da vinci

general.quote: I like nonsense; it wakes up the brain cells.
general.author: dr. seuss

general.quote: In making our decisions, we must use the brains that God has given us. But we must also use our hearts which He also gave us.
general.author: alexander maclaren

general.quote: Build your self-esteem by recalling all the ways you have succeeded, and your brain will be filled with images of you making your achievements happen again and again.
general.author: jack canfield

general.quote: The chief function of the body is to carry the brain around.
general.author: thomas a. edison

general.quote: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
general.author: robert frost

general.quote: The stupidity of one brain multiplied by twelve.
general.author: elbert hubbard

general.quote: Math is like going to the gym for your brain. It sharpens your mind.
general.author: danica mckellar

general.quote: When God endowed human beings with brains, He did not intend to guarantee them.
general.author: charles de montesquieu

general.quote: A man’s brain has a more difficult time shifting from thinking to feeling than a women’s brain does.
general.author: barbara de angelis

general.quote: As long as my brain and fingers work, I’m cool.
general.author: eddie van halen

general.quote: Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: No brain is stronger than its weakest think.
general.author: thomas l. masson

general.quote: A brain of feathers, and a heart of lead.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: We are all now connected by the Internet, like neurons in a giant brain.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.
general.author: edward de bono

general.quote: To think is to practice brain chemistry.
general.author: deepak chopra

general.quote: Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
general.author: jules renard

general.quote: A fool’s brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Dollars and guns are no substitutes for brains and will power.
general.author: dwight david eisenhower

general.quote: We are dealing with the best-educated generation in history. But they’ve got a brain dressed up with nowhere to go.
general.author: timothy leary

general.quote: My own brain is to me the most unaccountable of machinery – always buzzing, humming, soaring roaring diving, and then buried in mud. And why? What’s this passion for?
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: Brains are an asset, if you hide them.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: Aristotle was famous for knowing everything. He taught that the brain exists merely to cool the blood and is not involved in the process of thinking. This is true only of certain persons.
general.author: will cuppy

general.quote: I regard the brain as a computer which will stop working when its components fail. There is no heaven or afterlife for broken down computers; that is a fairy story for people afraid of the dark.
general.author: stephen hawking

general.quote: The more you use your brain, the more brain you will have to use.
general.author: george a. dorsey

general.quote: Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can’t see where it keeps its brain.
general.author: j. k. rowling

general.quote: The right half of the brain controls the left half of the body. This means that only left handed people are in their right mind.
general.author: unknown

general.quote: There is no loneliness greater than the loneliness of a failure. The failure is a stranger in his own house.
general.author: eric hoffer

general.quote: The day your horse dies and your money’s gone, your relatives change into strangers.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: What a strange thing man is; and what a stranger thing woman.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: America, where people do not inquire of a stranger, "What is he?" But "What can he do?
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Strange to say, the luminous world is the invisible world; the luminous world is that which we do not see. Our eyes of flesh see only night.
general.author: victor hugo

general.quote: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; truth isn’t.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: There are German songs which can make a stranger to the language cry.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Every time a man unburdens his heart to a stranger he reaffirms the love that unites humanity.
general.author: germaine greer

general.quote: It is strange what contempt men have for the joys that are offered them freely.
general.author: george duhamel

general.quote: If a man be gracious and courteous to strangers, it shows he is a citizen of the world.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Don’t borrow money from a neighbor or a friend, but of a stranger where, paying for it you shall hear of it no more.
general.author: lord burleigh

general.quote: Politics doesn’t make strange bedfellows – marriage does.
general.author: groucho marx

general.quote: It is strange to be known so universally and yet to be so lonely.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Honest criticism is hard to take, especially from a relative, a friend, an acquaintance, or a stranger.
general.author: franklin p. jones

general.quote: If two friends ask you to judge a dispute, don’t accept because you will lose one friend; on the other hand, if two strangers come with the same request, accept because you will gain one friend.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: The sensitivity of men to small matters, and their indifference to great ones, indicates a strange inversion.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: If you have only one smile in you, give it to the people you love. Don’t be surly at home, then go out in the street and start grinning ‘Good morning’ at total strangers.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: I, a stranger and afraid, in a world I never made.
general.author: a. e. housman

general.quote: When one is a stranger to oneself then one is estranged from others too.
general.author: anne morrow lindbergh

general.quote: We have a strange and wonderful relationship – he’s strange and I’m wonderful.
general.author: mike ditka

general.quote: How strange this fear of death is! We are never frightened at a sunset.
general.author: george macdonald

general.quote: Nothing, perhaps, is strange, once you have accepted life itself, the great strange business which includes all lesser strangeness.
general.author: rose macaulay

general.quote: It is a strange desire, to seek power, and to lose liberty; or to seek power over others, and to lose power over a man’s self.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: There are certain queer times and occasions in this strange mixed affair we call life when a man takes his whole universe for a vast practical joke.
general.author: herman melville

general.quote: When the wine goes in, strange things come out.
general.author: johann friedrich von schiller

general.quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers. In the perfect stranger we perceive man himself; the image of a God is not disguised by resemblances to an uncle or doubts of wisdom of a mustache.
general.author: gilbert k. chesterton

general.quote: It is the strange fate of man, that even in the greatest of evils the fear of the worst continues to haunt him.
general.author: goethe

general.quote: They do certainly give very strange, and newfangled, names to diseases.
general.author: plato

general.quote: Strange is our situation here on earth. Each of us comes for a short visit, not knowing why, yet sometimes seeming to divine a purpose.
general.author: albert einstein

general.quote: Strangers are just friends I haven’t met yet.
general.author: will rogers

general.quote: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Anyone who knows a strange fact shares in its singularity.
general.author: jean genet

general.quote: I work in a strange business, and trust is a word that’s not even in the vocabulary.
general.author: kim basinger

general.quote: He whom God has touched will always be a being apart: he is, whatever he may do, a stranger among men; he is marked by a sign.
general.author: ernest renan

general.quote: The only living life is in the past and future — the present is an interlude — strange interlude in which we call on past and future to bear witness that we are living.
general.author: eugene o’neill

general.quote: Strange as it may seem, no amount of learning can cure stupidity, and formal education positively fortifies it.
general.author: stephen vizinczey

general.quote: What a strange vanity painting is; it attracts admiration by resembling the original, we do not admire.
general.author: blaise pascal

general.quote: Where a blood relation sobs, an intimate friend should choke up, a distant acquaintance should sigh, a stranger should merely fumble sympathetically with his handkerchief.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Congress is so strange. A man gets up to speak and says nothing. Nobody listens, then everybody disagrees.
general.author: boris marshalov

general.quote: If it weren’t for marriage, men and women would have to fight with total strangers.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: I have always depended on the kindness of strangers.
general.author: tennessee williams

general.quote: I do desire we may be better strangers.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Misery acquaints a man with strange bedfellows.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: ‘Tis strange what a man may do and a woman yet think him an angel.
general.author: william m. thackeray

general.quote: There are strange flowers of reason to match each error of the senses.
general.author: louis aragon

general.quote: It is disgraceful to live as a stranger in one’s country, and be an alien in any matter that affects our welfare.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: On what strange stuff Ambition feeds!
general.author: eliza cook

general.quote: The more I traveled the more I realized that fear makes strangers of people who should be friends.
general.author: shirley maclaine

general.quote: Is it not strange that desire should so many years outlive performance?
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: Never fight fair with a stranger, boy. You’ll never get out of the jungle that way.
general.author: arthur miller

general.quote: Life is strange. Every so often a good man wins.
general.author: frank dane

general.quote: It was his peculiar happiness that he scarcely ever found a stranger whom he did not leave a friend; but it must likewise be added, that he had not often a friend long without obliging him to become a stranger.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: All things must change to something new, to something strange.
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow

general.quote: We that are true lovers run into strange capers.
general.author: william shakespeare

general.quote: A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us.
general.author: antoine de saint-exupery

general.quote: The moment one accosts a stranger or is accosted by him is above all in this life the moment of drama… Whoever we meet watches us intently at the quick, strange moment of meeting, to see whether we are disposed to be friendly.
general.author: haniel long

general.quote: One of the characteristics of the dream is that nothing surprises us in it. With no regret, we agree to live in it with strangers, completely cut off from our habits and friends.
general.author: jean cocteau

general.quote: Truth is always strange, stranger than fiction.
general.author: lord byron

general.quote: It’s all right for a perfect stranger to kiss your hand as long as he’s perfect.
general.author: mae west

general.quote: We cannot possibly let ourselves get frozen into regarding everyone we do not know as an absolute stranger.
general.author: albert schweitzer

general.quote: When strangers start acting like neighbors… communities are reinvigorated.
general.author: ralph nader

general.quote: Strange to see how a good dinner and feasting reconciles everybody.
general.author: samuel pepys

general.quote: Education helps one cease being intimidated by strange situations.
general.author: maya angelou

general.quote: Be true to your own act and congratulate yourself if you have done something strange and extravagant to break the monotony of a decorous age.
general.author: ralph waldo emerson

general.quote: Today, give a stranger one of your smiles. It might be the only sunshine he sees all day.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There is nothing so strange and so unbelievable that it has not been said by one philosopher or another.
general.author: rene descartes

general.quote: Money is a strange business. People who haven’t got it aim it strongly. People who have are full of troubles.
general.author: ayrton senna

general.quote: Confidence is the bond of friendship.
general.author: publilius syrus

general.quote: Confidence imparts a wonderful inspiration to its possessor.
general.author: john milton

general.quote: Winning breeds confidence and confidence breeds winning.
general.author: hubert green

general.quote: People who have a confidence in their personal worth seem to be magnets for success and happiness.
general.author: alan loy mcginnis

general.quote: In a just cause it is right to be confident.
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: Danger breeds best on too much confidence.
general.author: pierre corneille

general.quote: We advance on our journey only when we face our goal, when we are confident and believe we are going to win out.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: The road to confidence is paved by daily accomplishments.
general.author: keith johnson

general.quote: Confidence is almost all about perception. Very few people are wholly confident in every area of their life. Those who appear to be so are probably good at acting — with themselves as the audience.
general.author: kate burton & brinley n. platts

general.quote: Confidence… is directness and courage in meeting the facts of life.
general.author: john dewey

general.quote: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.
general.author: criss jami

general.quote: I always thought I could play pro ball. I had confidence in my ability, You have to. If you don’t, who will?
general.author: johnny unitas

general.quote: Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
general.author: norman vincent peale

general.quote: Confidence always pleases those who receive it.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Hard to feel confident when you’re surrounded by horse-sized wolves.
general.author: stephenie meyer

general.quote: If you don’t have confidence, you’ll always find a way not to win.
general.author: carl lewis

general.quote: Lack of confidence is what makes you want to change somebody else’s mind. When you’re OK, you don’t need to convince anyone else in order to empower yourself.
general.author: jada pinkett smith

general.quote: Confidence … is the foundation upon which rests the consummation of all Life’s many plans.
general.author: edward s. rogers

general.quote: The most vital quality a soldier can possess is self-confidence.
general.author: george s. patton

general.quote: Surely modesty never hurt any cause; and the confidence of man seems to me to be much like the wrath of man.
general.author: john tillotson

general.quote: Be not confident and affirmative.
general.author: jeremy taylor

general.quote: Confidence and doubt are like two bulls in a car–either confidence is going to stay or your doubts or insecurities are going to stay, but there is not room for both to remain.
general.author: keith johnson

general.quote: My last confidence will be like my first.
general.author: sextus aurelius propertius

general.quote: People are slow to claim confidence in undertakings of magnitude.
general.author: ovid

general.quote: Self-confidence grows on trees, in other people’s orchards.
general.author: mignon mclaughlin

general.quote: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
general.author: michael o’brien

general.quote: Confidence is courage at ease.
general.author: daniel maher

general.quote: I think it’s the mark of a great player to be confident in tough situations.
general.author: john mcenroe

general.quote: There can be no great courage where there is no confidence or assurance, and half the battle is in the conviction that we can do what we undertake.
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Every failure made me more confident. Because I wanted even more to achieve as revenge. To show that I could.
general.author: roman polanski

general.quote: Women who are confident of their abilities are more likely to succeed than those who lack confidence, even though the latter may be much more competent and talented and industrious.
general.author: dr. joyce brothers

general.quote: The history of the world is full of men who rose to leadership, by sheer force of self-confidence, bravery and tenacity.
general.author: mahatma gandhi

general.quote: The best way for you to gain confidence is to prepare so well on something … that there can be little chance to fail.
general.author: frank cummins lockwood

general.quote: Self-confidence is the result of a successfully survived risk.
general.author: jack gibb

general.quote: I have always felt like you really don’t have a genuine confidence unless you demonstrate the ability to do something. You can talk about it, but you have to demonstrate it.
general.author: bill parcells

general.quote: If you doubt you can accomplish something, then you can’t accomplish it. You have to have confidence in your ability, and then be tough enough to follow through.
general.author: rosalynn carter

general.quote: Confidence is nowhere safe.
general.author: vergl

general.quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you’re feeling cocky, it’s because there’s something you don’t know.
general.author: eoin colfer

general.quote: With confidence, you can reach truly amazing heights; without confidence, even the simplest accomplishments are beyond your grasp.
general.author: jim loehr

general.quote: Embrace life, have confidence in yourself, take action.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Confidence is the hinge on the door to success.
general.author: mary o’hare dumas

general.quote: Confidence awakens confidence.
general.author: friedrich von sachsen

general.quote: The gain in self-confidence of having accomplished a tiresome labour is immense.
general.author: arnold bennett

general.quote: The confidence in another man’s virtue is no light evidence of a man’s own, and God willingly favors such a confidence.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: If you never struggle with confidence, you obviously are not stretching yourself far enough.
general.author: timothy ursiny

general.quote: However gradual may be the growth of confidence, that of credit requires still more time to arrive at maturity.
general.author: benjamin disraeli

general.quote: No matter what a woman looks like, if she’s confident, she’s sexy.
general.author: paris hilton

general.quote: I never seek to defeat the man I am fighting…. I seek to defeat his confidence.
general.author: arthur golden

general.quote: I have great faith in fools; self-confidence my friends call it.
general.author: edgar allan poe

general.quote: If once you forfeit the confidence of your fellow-citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem.
general.author: abraham lincoln

general.quote: Ninety-two percent of the stuff told you in confidence you couldn’t get anyone else to listen to.
general.author: franklin p. adams

general.quote: Confidence in another man’s virtue is no slight evidence of a man’s own.
general.author: michel eyquem de montaigne

general.quote: Without self-confidence we are as babes in the cradles. And how can we generate this imponderable quality, which is yet so invaluable most quickly? By thinking that other people are inferior to oneself.
general.author: virginia woolf

general.quote: The confidence which we have in ourselves gives birth to much of that which we have in others.
general.author: francois de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: No one who deserves confidence ever solicits it.
general.author: john churton collins

general.quote: Confidence is the bridge connecting expectations and performance, investment and results.
general.author: rosabeth moss kanter

general.quote: Confidence is the mark of a hopeful disposition.
general.author: aristotle

general.quote: There is a difference between conceit and confidence. Conceit is bragging about yourself. Confidence means you believe you can get the job done.
general.author: johnny unitas

general.quote: He is safe who admits no one to his confidence.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Confidence is a natural life force designed to overcome dark times.
general.author: sheenah hankin

general.quote: We need confidence in order to set goals and achieve success, however large or small those goals are and whatever success means to us. This is a competitive world and it is confident people who usually get to win.
general.author: jan ferguson

general.quote: Confidence is preparation. Everything else is beyond your control.
general.author: richard kline

general.quote: False confidence is the precursor of disaster.
general.author: david noonan

general.quote: Having confidence is like having the keys to the kingdom.
general.author: dag albright

general.quote: Confidence is the result of hours and days and weeks and years of constant work and dedication.
general.author: roger staubach

general.quote: Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.
general.author: peter t. mcintyre

general.quote: Winning becomes easier over time as the cornerstones of confidence become habits.
general.author: rosabeth moss kanter

general.quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life. With confidence, you have won even before you have started.
general.author: marcus garvey

general.quote: You need to play with supreme confidence, or else you’ll lose again, and then losing becomes a habit.
general.author: joe paterno

general.quote: Exuding confidence is a bit like being wealthy. Confidence, like money, only becomes a problem when it disappears.
general.author: kate burton & brinley n. platts

general.quote: Total self-confidence is built through positive expectations. You can build positive expectations by knowing that you have the power within to overcome any obstacle that lies ahead.
general.author: robert anthony

general.quote: If you have confidence you have patience. Confidence, that is everything.
general.author: ilie nastase

general.quote: He who has lost confidence can lose nothing more.
general.author: pierre claude boiste

general.quote: Ignorance and confidence are constant companions.
general.author: john mcafee

general.quote: Have confidence that if you have done a little thing well, you can do a bigger thing well too.
general.author: david storey

general.quote: To be confident is to act in faith.
general.author: bernard bynion

general.quote: Confidence is a plant of slow growth in an aged heart.
general.author: william pitt chatham

general.quote: Confidence in conversation has a greater share than wit.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Confidence is a very fragile thing.
general.author: joe montana

general.quote: Confidence is the feeling you have before you understand the situation.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: There can be no friendship without confidence, and no confidence without integrity.
general.author: samuel johnson

general.quote: Confidence is the most important single factor in this game, and no matter how great your natural talent, there is only one way to obtain and sustain it: work.
general.author: jack nicklaus

general.quote: We must have perseverance and above all confidence in ourselves. We must believe that we are gifted for something, and that this thing, at whatever cost, must be attained.
general.author: madame marie curie

general.quote: A person without confidence is like a jumbo jet sitting on the runway with an empty fuel tank.
general.author: keith johnson

general.quote: You’ve got to take the initiative and play your game. In a decisive set, confidence is the difference.
general.author: chris evert lloyd

general.quote: Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks in great and long honourable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself.
general.author: marcus tullius cicero

general.quote: Confidence is a lot of this game or any game. If you don’t think you can, you won’t.
general.author: jerry west

general.quote: Experience tells you what to do; confidence allows you to do it.
general.author: stan smith

general.quote: Anyone who ever gave you confidence, you owe them a lot.
general.author: truman capote

general.quote: Your sole contribution to the sum of things is yourself.
general.author: frank crane

general.quote: I’ve always had confidence. It came because I have lots of initiative. I wanted to make something of myself.
general.author: eddie murphy

general.quote: There’s one blessing only, the source and cornerstone of beatitude — confidence in self.
general.author: marcus annaeus seneca

general.quote: Confidence is a fine trait. Overconfidence isn’t.
general.author: laurell k. hamilton

general.quote: Most frequently we make confidants from vanity, a love of talking, a wish to win the confidence of others, and to make an exchange of secrets.
general.author: francois duc de la rochefoucauld

general.quote: Confidence sounds like rock and roll, loud, strong and played without apology.
general.author: timothy ursiny

general.quote: Courage comes from wanting to do it well. Security comes from knowing you can do it well. Confidence Confide comes from having done it well.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
general.author: arthur ashe

general.quote: Calm self-confidence is as far from conceit as the desire to earn a decent living is remote from greed.
general.author: channing pollock

general.quote: Confidence is a natural life force designed to overcome dark times.
general.author: sheenah hankin

general.quote: If you are prepared, then you are able to feel confident.
general.author: robert j. ringer

general.quote: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
general.author: lazarus long

general.quote: We have to serve ourselves many years before we gain our own confidence.
general.author: henry s. haskins

general.quote: What people see is determined by where they sit. They naturally see things from their own perspective, not from anyone else’s, including yours.
general.author: john c. maxwell

general.quote: Many are the things that man seeing must understand. Not seeing, how shall he know what lies in the hand of time to come?
general.author: sophocles

general.quote: If you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.
general.author: friedrich wilhelm nietzsche

general.quote: None is so blind as he who sees too much.
general.author: philip moeller

general.quote: One has not only an ability to perceive the world but an ability to alter one’s perception of it; more simply, one can change things by the manner in which one looks at them.
general.author: tom robbins

general.quote: Of more validity is the sight of one eye than the attention of ten ears; for in that a man seeth is an assurance, and that he heareth may be an error.
general.author: george turberville

general.quote: The only true love is love at first sight; second sight dispels it.
general.author: israel zangwill

general.quote: Of all the senses, sight must be the most delightful.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: To see a thing clearly in the mind makes it begin to take form.
general.author: henry ford

general.quote: The eyes those silent tongues of Love.
general.author: miguel de cervantes

general.quote: Perception is strong and sight weak.
general.author: miyamoto musashi

general.quote: The voyage of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
general.author: marcel proust

general.quote: Better see rightly on a pound a week than squint on a million.
general.author: george bernard shaw

general.quote: Seeing is believing.
general.author: john clarke

general.quote: When you focus all your attention on what is seen, your eyes will be blinded to what is real…. You must see the invisible, dream the impossible, and believe the unfathomable.
general.author: heritage james

general.quote: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
general.author: mark twain

general.quote: Out of sight, out of mind. The absent are always in the wrong.
general.author: thomas a kempis

general.quote: If the sight of the blue skies fills you with joy, if a blade of grass springing up in the fields has power to move you, if the simple things of nature have a message that you understand, rejoice, for your soul is alive.
general.author: eleonora duse

general.quote: No matter how intelligent a man is, he can’t see what he doesn’t know how to see.
general.author: ursula k. le guin

general.quote: Love at first sight is easy to understand; it’s when two people have been looking at each other for a lifetime that it becomes a miracle.
general.author: sam levenson

general.quote: At the moment of vision, the eyes see nothing.
general.author: william golding

general.quote: We need better sight for better choice.
general.author: r. a. feller

general.quote: In time of difficulties, we must not lose sight of our achievements.
general.author: mao zedong

general.quote: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
general.author: robertson davies

general.quote: How alive is thought, invisible, yet without thought there is no sight.
general.author: dejan stojanovic

general.quote: The advantage of love at first sight is that it delays a second sight.
general.author: natalie clifford barney

general.quote: Where eyes are shut, nothing can be seen.
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
general.author: augustine birrell

general.quote: Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.
general.author: alexander pope

general.quote: Would you rather have sight, or insight? I’d rather have a double cheeseburger.
general.author: jarod kintz

general.quote: If my ship sails from sight, it doesn’t mean my journey ends, it simply means the river bends.
general.author: enoch powell

general.quote: Sometimes not seeing things can be a blessing.
general.author: august strindberg

general.quote: Sight is by much the noblest of the senses.
general.author: laurence sterne

general.quote: What people see is never the end of what should be seen.
general.author: heritage james

general.quote: Many have sight but few have vision.
general.author: naren nagin

general.quote: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.
general.author: lucius annaeus seneca

general.quote: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.
general.author: vincent van gogh

general.quote: Each man is good in the sight of the Great Spirit.
general.author: sitting bull

general.quote: The pressure of survival in the big city will make you lose sight of your dream… Hang in there.
general.author: james de la vega

general.quote: One does not discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: He that cannot contract the sight of his mind, as well as disperse and dilate it, wanteth a great faculty.
general.author: francis bacon

general.quote: Anger and jealousy can no more bear to lose sight of their objects than love.
general.author: george eliot

general.quote: Out of sight, out of mind.
general.author: john heywood

general.quote: It’s hubris to think that the way we see things is everything there is.
general.author: lisa randall

general.quote: A problem out of sight is a problem out of mind, but it’s still a problem.
general.author: kirsty major

general.quote: What you see and hear depends a good deal on where you are standing; it also depends on what sort of person you are.
general.author: c. s. lewis

general.quote: See and to be seen.
general.author: ben jonson

general.quote: I believe in love at first sight for houses – but not for people.
general.author: danielle steel

general.quote: No eyes that have seen beauty ever lose their sight.
general.author: jean toomer

general.quote: What you see is what you get.
general.author: flip wilson

general.quote: There is none so blind as they that won’t see.
general.author: jonathan swift

general.quote: We see things not as they are but as we are.
general.author: anais nin

general.quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
general.author: andre gide

general.quote: Blindness itself commends the excellence of sight.
general.author: st. augustine

general.quote: The most pathetic person in the world is someone who has sight, but has no vision.
general.author: helen keller

general.quote: Each man is good in His sight. It is not necessary for eagles to be crows.
general.author: sitting bull

general.quote: You get caught up thinking about the future, you lose sight of the present.
general.author: antonio brown

general.quote: Seeing is an integrating activity. What you see is fixed in a moment; sight is a perception of depth and relationship, but not one of time and articulation.
general.author: james goodman

general.quote: The splinter in your eye is the best magnifying-glass available.
general.author: theodor w. adorno

general.quote: Sight is one of the most easily deceived senses. I could make a coin disappear and your eyes would believe it gone, even if it were merely up my sleeve.
general.author: megan chance

general.quote: What, my boy, you are not weeping? You should save your eyes for sight.
general.author: sarah williams

general.quote: You should show some respect for what other people see and feel, even though it be the exact opposite of what you see and feel.
general.author: luigi pirandello

general.quote: The folly of all follies is to be love sick for a shadow.
general.author: lord alfred tennyson

general.quote: Seek happiness for its own sake, and you will not find it; seek for duty, and happiness will follow as the shadow comes with the sunshine
general.author: tryon edwards

general.quote: Never fear shadows. They simply mean there’s a light shining somewhere nearby
general.author: ruth e. renkel

general.quote: When we have a world of only now, with no shadows of yesterdays or clouds of tomorrow, then saying what we can do will work
general.author: goldie ivener

general.quote: Man is a substance clad in shadows
general.author: john sterling

general.quote: Tragedy delights by affording a shadow of the pleasure which exists in pain
general.author: percy bysshe shelley

general.quote: The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream
general.author: william shakespeare quotes

general.quote: The hopeful man sees success where others see failure, sunshine where others see shadows and storm
general.author: orison swett marden

general.quote: Be content to stand in the light, and let the shadow fall where it will
general.author: mary w. stewart

general.quote: In this world everything changes except good deeds and bad deeds; these follow you as the shadow follows the body
general.author: ruth benedict

general.quote: Many miles away there’s a shadow on the door of a cottage on the Shore of a dark Scottish lake
general.author: sting

general.quote: What is life? It is the flash of a firefly in the night. It is the breath of a buffalo in the wintertime. It is the little shadow which runs across the grass and loses itself in the sunset
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To love someone is to isolate him from the world, wipe out every trace of him, dispossess him of his shadow, drag him into a murderous future. It is to circle around the other like a dead star and absorb him into a black light
general.author: jean baudrillard

general.quote: When men yield up the privilege of thinking, the last shadow of liberty quits the horizon
general.author: thomas paine

general.quote: When walking through the "valley of shadows," remember, a shadow is cast by a Light
general.author: h.k. barclay

general.quote: Shadows fall on even the brightest hours
general.author: bryan waller proctor

general.quote: Our ideals, like pictures, are made from lights and shadows
general.author: joseph joubert

general.quote: He who leaves his house in search of happiness pursues a shadow
general.author: unknown

general.quote: Power may be at the end of a gun, but sometimes it’s also at the end of the shadow or the image of a gun
general.author: jean genet

general.quote: Shadow owes its birth to light
general.author: john gay

general.quote: This life of separateness may be compared to a dream, a phantasm, a bubble, a shadow, a drop of dew, a flash of lightning
general.author: buddha

general.quote: Across the singing waves the shadows creep
general.author: celia leighton thaxter

general.quote: Thoughts are the shadows of our sensations — always darker, emptier, simpler than these
general.author: friedrich nietzsche

general.quote: Where love rules, there is no will to power; where power predominates, there love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other
general.author: carl jung

general.quote: Thus shadow owes its birth to light
general.author: john gay

general.quote: What is life? A frenzy. What is life? An illusion, a shadow, a fiction. And the greatest good is trivial; for all life is a dream and all dreams are dreams
general.author: pedro calderon de la barca

general.quote: Fear is the lengthened shadow of ignorance
general.author: arnold h. glasow

general.quote: Men are the dreams of a shadow
general.author: pindar

general.quote: Do we not all spend the greater part of our lives under the shadow of an event that has not yet come to pass?"
general.author: maurice maeterlinck

general.quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart
general.author: henry wadsworth longfellow quotes

general.quote: Where there is much light, the shadow is deep
general.author: johann wolfgang von goethe quotes

general.quote: Reason is like an officer when the king appears. The officer then loses his power and hides himself. Reason is the shadow cast by God; Go is the sun
general.author: jalal-uddin rumi

general.quote: Without knowledge, life is not more than the shadow of death
general.author: jean baptiste moliere

general.quote: Most of the shadows of this life are caused by standing in one’s own sunshine
general.author: ralph waldo emerson quotes

general.quote: Out of the chill and the shadow, Into the thrill and the shine; Out of the dearth and the famine, Into the fullness divine
general.author: margaret elizabeth sangster

general.quote: A crooked stick will have a crooked shadow
general.author: unknown

general.quote: To rid ourselves of our shadows — who we are — we must step into either total light or total darkness. Goodness and evil
general.author: jeremy p. johnson

general.quote: False friends are like our shadow, keeping close to us while we walk in the sunshine, but leaving us the instant we cross into the shade
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: Time is a very shadow that passeth away
general.author: apocrypha

general.quote: Bright lights cast dark shadows when shone from only one direction
general.author: david kelley

general.quote: To see a shadow and think it is a tree that is a pity; but to see a tree and to think it a shadow can be fatal
general.author: phyllis bottome

general.quote: We are formed and molded by our thoughts. Those whose minds are shaped by selfless thoughts give joy when they speak or act. Joy follows them like a shadow that never leaves them
general.author: buddha quotes

general.quote: In this world, full often, our joys are only the tender shadows which our sorrows cast
general.author: henry ward beecher

general.quote: Character is like a tree and reputation like its shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing

general.quote: Like our shadows, our wishes lengthen as our sun declines

general.quote: Manners are like the shadows of virtues, they are the momentary display of those qualities which our fellow creatures love and respect

general.quote: Poetry is an echo, asking a shadow to dance

general.quote: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life

general.quote: Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow

general.quote: Shadows are in reality, when the sun is shining, the most conspicuous thing in a landscape, next to the highest lights

general.quote: Good humor and enthusiasm should be the sunshine ahead that will keep that shadow behind

general.quote: Afflictions are but the shadows of God’s wings

general.quote: The present is the ever moving shadow that divides yesterday from tomorrow. In that lies hope

general.quote: When small men begin to cast big shadows, it means that the sun is about to set

general.quote: Above the cloud with its shadow is the star with its light. Above all things reverence thyself

general.quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow

general.quote: Beginnings are apt to be shadowy

general.quote: A people always ends by resembling its shadow

general.quote: Glory follows virtue as if it were its shadow

general.quote: False friends are like our shadow, keeping close to us while we walk in the sunshine, but leaving us the instant we cross into the shade
general.author: john christian bovee

general.quote: One’s reputation is like a shadow, it is gigantic when it precedes you, and a pigmy in proportion when it follows
general.author: charles maurice de talleyrand

general.quote: The shadows will always be behind those who walk toward the light
general.author: james f. oates jr.

general.quote: Discontent is something that follows ambition like a shadow

general.quote: The comic and the tragic lie inseparably close, like light and shadow

general.quote: We stand in our own light wherever we go, and fight our own shadows forever

general.quote: The dearest friend on earth is a mere shadow compared to Jesus Christ

general.quote: Fear has a large shadow, but he himself is small

general.quote: And the greater shadows fall from the lofty mountains

general.quote: Loss and possession, Death and life are one. There falls no shadow where There shines no sun

general.quote: The reputation of a man is like his shadow, gigantic when it precedes him, and pigmy in its proportions when it follows
general.author: charles maurice de talleyrand

general.quote: There falls no shadow where There shines no sun
general.author: hilaire belloc

general.quote: It takes one person to forgive, it takes two people to be reunited
general.author: lewis b. smedes

general.quote: You only lie to two people in your life, your girlfriend and the police

general.quote: If the people are happy, united, wealthy, and powerful, we presume the rest. We conclude that to be good from whence good is derived

general.quote: The people long eagerly for just two things. Bread and circuses

general.quote: There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating — people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing

general.quote: Stupid people always think they are right. Wise people listen to advice
general.author: bible

general.quote: If you shoot for the stars and hit the moon, it’s OK. But you’ve got to shoot for something. A lot of people don’t even shoot

general.quote: A lot of people have the ability, but they don’t put forth the effort

general.quote: The only real people are the people who never existed

general.quote: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself – an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly

general.quote: When two people decide to get a divorce, it isn’t a sign that they ‘don’t understand’ one another, but a sign that they have, at last, begun to
general.author: helen rowland

general.quote: If you want to be original just try being yourself, because God has never made two people exactly alike
general.author: bernard meltzer

general.quote: There are two kinds of people in the world. Those who walk into a room and say, "There you are!" and those who say, "Here I am

general.quote: What we know of other people’s only our memory of the moments during which we knew them

general.quote: Sometimes I am two people. Johnny is the nice one. Cash causes all the trouble. They fight

general.quote: No two people on earth are alike

general.quote: When you have a taste for exceptional people, you always end up meeting them everywhere

general.quote: We hold the view that the people make the best judgment in the long run

general.quote: There are people who in spite of their merit disgust us, and others who please us in spite of their faults

general.quote: The character of the common people changes in a single day

general.quote: The only normal people are the ones you don’t know very well

general.quote: People don’t live or die, people just float

general.quote: By gaining the people, the kingdom is gained; by losing the people, the kingdom is lost

general.quote: The people are to be taken in small doses

general.quote: A lot of people have ideas, but there are few who decide to do something about them now. Not tomorrow. Not next week. But today. The true entrepreneur is a doer, not a dreamer

general.quote: We are all agents of the same supreme power, the people

general.quote: People are eternally divided into two classes, the believer, builder, and praiser, and the unbeliever, destroyer and critic

general.quote: There are always two people in every picture: the photographer and the viewer

general.quote: When two people love each other, they don’t look at each other, they look in the same direction

general.quote: There are two kinds of people in the world: Those who are always getting ready to do something, and those who go ahead and do it

general.quote: The will of the people is the best law

general.quote: Men are so completely fools by necessity that he is but a fool in a higher strain of folly who does not confess his foolishness

general.quote: A person can live all his life alone. Well, maybe. But still, he needs someone who buries him even though he himself can dig a grave for himself.

general.quote: I love you, I love you, my heart is a rose that blossomed thanks to your love, my life is a desert covered in the gentle breeze of your breath and irrigated by the cool springs of your eyes; the traces of your little legs became shady oases for me, the smell of your hair is like the scent of myrrh, and wherever you go, the fragrance of a cinnamon tree comes from you.

general.quote: Friendship between a man and a woman is impossible. Passion, enmity, adoration, love – just not friendship.

general.quote: Men always want to be a woman’s, first love. Women dream of being the last relationship of a man.
general.author: Oscar Wilde

general.quote: The love of a married woman is a great thing. Married men have never dreamed of it.

general.quote: Keep love in your heart. Life without it is like a sunless garden with dead flowers.

general.quote: What they do in paradise? We do not know, but we know for sure what they don’t do there: they don’t get married and build a family.

general.quote: If you love me, love my umbrella.

general.quote: Love loves loving love.

general.quote: Do you love me? You may want that which does not exist, but you cannot love it. … So that you don’t have to love me anymore, .. – so that you don’t have a sentence to love me, that you receive an exhilarating love for me … All women are the same, the hell the same, you can’t love, get out of the way. you cannot love even five minutes so you don’t want to end love.

We should also consider an additional $50,000 'ye' tax, so that the owner of a store called 'Ye Olde Shoppe' would have to fork over $150,000 a year. general.quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue

general.quote: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.

general.quote: Take heed: you do not find what you do not seek.

general.quote: When people are like each other they tend to like each other.

general.quote: There is no failure except in no longer trying.

general.quote: What we see is mainly what we look for.

general.quote: The world is but a canvas to the imagination.

general.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

general.quote: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.

general.quote: If only wed stop trying to be happy wed have a pretty good time.

general.quote: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.

general.quote: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.

general.quote: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.

general.quote: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.

general.quote: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.

general.quote: It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.

general.quote: Don't be afraid to go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.

general.quote: Life is so constructed that an event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation.

general.quote: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.

general.quote: No man can succeed in a line of endeavor which he does not like.

general.quote: You will not be punished for your anger, you will be punished by your anger.

general.quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds you plant.

general.quote: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.

general.quote: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents, which in prosperous circumstances would have lain dormant.

general.quote: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm, you'll never enjoy the sunshine.

general.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.

general.quote: Every action of our lives touches on some chord that will vibrate in eternity.

general.quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.

general.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

general.quote: Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day.

general.quote: Most folks are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.

general.quote: If you would take, you must first give, this is the beginning of intelligence.

general.quote: Some people think it's holding that makes one strong sometimes it's letting go.

general.quote: Quality is never an accident; it is always the result of intelligent effort.

general.quote: Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood.

general.quote: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.

general.quote: You are important enough to ask and you are blessed enough to receive back.

general.quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.

general.quote: If you want your life to be more rewarding, you have to change the way you think.

general.quote: The only difference between your abilities and others is the ability to put yourself in their shoes and actually try.

general.quote: Great are they who see that spiritual is stronger than any material force, that thoughts rule the world.

general.quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honourable but more useful than a life spent in doing nothing.

general.quote: Don't leave a stone unturned. It's always something, to know you have done the most you could.

general.quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

general.quote: There is no retirement for an artist, it's your way of living so there is no end to it.

general.quote: Why worry about things you cannot control when you can keep yourself busy controlling the things that depend on you?

general.quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.

general.quote: Be not afraid of greatness: some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.

general.quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.

general.quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly, what is essential is invisible to the eye.

general.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.

general.quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

general.quote: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.

general.quote: Do not waste yourself in rejection, nor bark against the bad, but chant the beauty of the good.

general.quote: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.

general.quote: You got to be careful if you don't know where you're going, because you might not get there.

general.quote: You can't let praise or criticism get to you. It's a weakness to get caught up in either one.

general.quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.

general.quote: Our doubts are traitors and make us lose the good we often might win, by fearing to attempt.

general.quote: The minute you settle for less than you deserve, you get even less than you settled for.

general.quote: The highest stage in moral ure at which we can arrive is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.

general.quote: It is better to take many small steps in the right direction than to make a great leap forward only to stumble backward.

general.quote: If we have a positive mental attitude, then even when surrounded by hostility, we shall not lack inner peace.

general.quote: There is only one success to be able to spend your life in your own way.

general.quote: Promises are the uniquely human way of ordering the future, making it predictable and reliable to the extent that this is humanly possible.

general.quote: Appreciation is the highest form of prayer, for it acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts.

general.quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.

general.quote: Deep listening is miraculous for both listener and speaker.When someone receives us with open-hearted, non-judging, intensely interested listening, our spirits expand.

general.quote: All that is necessary is to accept the impossible, do without the indispensable, and bear the intolerable.

general.quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.

general.quote: You cannot find yourself by going into the past. You can find yourself by coming into the present.

general.quote: All our talents increase in the using, and the every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.

general.quote: In order to live free and happily you must sacrifice boredom. It is not always an easy sacrifice.

general.quote: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.

general.quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal: my strength lies solely in my tenacity

general.quote: Something opens our wings. Something makes boredom and hurt disappear. Someone fills the cup in front of us: We taste only sacredness.

general.quote: We must never forget that it is through our actions, words, and thoughts that we have a choice.

general.quote: Learn all you can from the mistakes of others. You won't have time to make them all yourself.

general.quote: Everything that happens happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.

general.quote: It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little do what you can.

general.quote: When you see a man of worth, think of how you may emulate him. When you see one who is unworthy, examine yourself.

general.quote: Those who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try nothing and succeed.

general.quote: Experience is not what happens to a man. It is what a man does with what happens to him.

general.quote: A good teacher is like a candle it consumes itself to light the way for others.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.

general.quote: Life is not measured by the breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath.

general.quote: The smallest flower is a thought, a life answering to some feature of the Great Whole, of whom they have a persistent intuition.

general.quote: Consider how hard it is to change yourself and you'll understand what little chance you have in trying to change others.

general.quote: If you'll not settle for anything less than your best, you will be amazed at what you can accomplish in your lives.

general.quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are small matters compared to what lies within us.
general.author: Oliver Holmes

general.quote: With the realization of ones own potential and self-confidence in ones ability, one can build a better world.

general.quote: There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.

general.quote: Forget about all the reasons why something may not work. You only need to find one good reason why it will.

general.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.

general.quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.

general.quote: We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.

general.quote: Many people think of prosperity that concerns money only to forget that true prosperity is of the mind.

general.quote: To be beautiful means to be yourself. You do not need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself.

general.quote: Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.

general.quote: It is very easy to forgive others their mistakes; it takes more grit to forgive them for having witnessed your own.

general.quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.

general.quote: Let us revere, let us worship, but erect and open-eyed, the highest, not the lowest; the future, not the past!

general.quote: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.

general.quote: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.
general.author: Margaret Runbeck

general.quote: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.

general.quote: If you must tell me your opinions, tell me what you believe in. I have plenty of douts of my own.

general.quote: Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish.

general.quote: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.
general.author: Og Mandino

general.quote: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
general.author: James Barrie

general.quote: The real measure of your wealth is how much youd be worth if you lost all your money.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
general.author: Buddha

general.quote: Take no thought of who is right or wrong or who is better than. Be not for or against.
general.author: Bruce Lee

general.quote: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to be flexible at all times.
general.author: Everett Dirksen

general.quote: Today, give a stranger a smile without waiting for it may be the joy they need to have a great day.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: The moment one gives close attention to anything, even a blade of grass, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself.
general.author: Henry Miller

general.quote: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
general.author: Lao Tzu

general.quote: How wonderful that we have met with a paradox. Now we have some hope of making progress.
general.author: Niels Bohr

general.quote: Everyone is a genius at least once a year. A real genius has his original ideas closer together.
general.author: Georg Lichtenberg

general.quote: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.

general.quote: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.

general.quote: Sadness may be part of life but there is no need to let it dominate your entire life.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: Keeping a little ahead of conditions is one of the secrets of business, the trailer seldom goes far.
general.author: Charles Schwab

general.quote: Nature gave us one tongue and two ears so we could hear twice as much as we speak.
general.author: Epictetus

general.quote: Don't wait for your feelings to change to take the action. Take the action and your feelings will change.
general.author: Barbara Baron

general.quote: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
general.author: Richard Bach

general.quote: You were not born a winner, and you were not born a loser. You are what you make yourself be.
general.author: Lou Holtz

general.quote: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul; the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
general.author: Napoleon Hill

general.quote: To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end of life.
general.author: Robert Stevenson

general.quote: The road leading to a goal does not separate you from the destination; it is essentially a part of it.
general.author: Charles DeLint

general.quote: Take things as they are. Punch when you have to punch. Kick when you have to kick.
general.author: Bruce Lee

general.quote: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.quote: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Mind is everything: muscle, pieces of rubber. All that I am, I am because of my mind.
general.author: Paavo Nurmi

general.quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
general.author: Anne Frank

general.quote: A friend is someone who understands your past, believes in your future, and accepts you just the way you are.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: He that never changes his opinions, never corrects his mistakes, and will never be wiser on the morrow than he is today.
general.author: Tryon Edwards

general.quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
general.author: Abraham Lincoln

general.quote: One must be fond of people and trust them if one is not to make a mess of life.
general.author: E. M. Forster

general.quote: We cannot change our memories, but we can change their meaning and the power they have over us.
general.author: David Seamans

general.quote: Being in humaneness is good. If we select other goodness and thus are far apart from humaneness, how can we be the wise?
general.author: Confucius

general.quote: To give hope to someone occurs when you teach them how to use the tools to do it for themselves.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: Id rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
general.author: Lucille Ball

general.quote: The past has no power to stop you from being present now. Only your grievance about the past can do that.
general.author: Eckhart Tolle

general.quote: If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and adore.
general.author: Ralph Emerson

general.quote: There are two kinds of failures: those who thought and never did, and those who did and never thought.
general.author: Laurence J. Peter

general.quote: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly. You're as old as you feel.
general.author: Elizabeth Arden

general.quote: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.

general.quote: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.

general.quote: Blessed is the person who is too busy to worry in the daytime, and too sleepy to worry at night.

general.quote: He can who thinks he can, and he can't who thinks he can't. This is an inexorable, indisputable law.

general.quote: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past, wisdom is of the future.
general.author: Vernon Cooper

general.quote: One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.

general.quote: People take different roads seeking fulfilment and happiness. Just because theyre not on your road doesn't mean they've gotten lost.
general.author: Dalai Lama

general.quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.

general.quote: There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.

general.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.

general.quote: Giving up doesn't always mean you are weak. Sometimes it means that you are strong enough to let go.
general.author: Unknown

general.quote: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be and you help them to become what they are capable of being.

general.quote: The most precious gift we can offer anyone is our attention. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers.
general.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

general.quote: If you focus on results, you will never change. If you focus on change, you will get results.

general.quote: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.

general.quote: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
general.author: Denis Waitley

general.quote: All difficult things have their origin in that which is easy, and great things in that which is small.
general.author: Lao-Tzu

general.quote: You can be what you want to be. You have the power within and we will help you always.
general.author: Byron Pulsifer

general.quote: To speak gratitude is courteous and pleasant, to enact gratitude is generous and noble, but to live gratitude is to touch Heaven.
general.author: Johannes Gaertner

general.quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
general.author: Doug Larson

general.quote: The greatest pleasure I know is to do a good action by stealth, and to have it found out by accident.

general.quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.

general.quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.

general.quote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart.

general.quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as ones own in the midst of abundance.

general.quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

general.quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.

general.quote: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.

general.quote: A man may fulfil the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer, and attempting a task he cannot achieve.

general.quote: I am not bothered by the fact that I am unknown. I am bothered when I do not know others.

general.quote: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
